Bug Summary

File:edit.c
Location:line 3234, column 19
Description:Access to field 'w_next' results in a dereference of a null pointer (loaded from variable 'wp')

Annotated Source Code

1/*
2 * VIM - Vi IMproved by Bram Moolenaar
3 *
4 * Do ":help uganda" in Vim to read copying and usage conditions.
5 * Do ":help credits" in Vim to see a list of people who contributed.
6 * See README.txt for an overview of the Vim source code.
7 */
8
9/*
10 * edit.c: functions for Insert mode
11 */
12
13#include <assert.h>
14#include <errno(*__errno_location ()).h>
15#include <string.h>
16#include <inttypes.h>
17#include <stdbool.h>
18
19#include "nvim/vim.h"
20#include "nvim/ascii.h"
21#include "nvim/edit.h"
22#include "nvim/buffer.h"
23#include "nvim/charset.h"
24#include "nvim/cursor.h"
25#include "nvim/digraph.h"
26#include "nvim/eval.h"
27#include "nvim/ex_docmd.h"
28#include "nvim/ex_getln.h"
29#include "nvim/farsi.h"
30#include "nvim/fileio.h"
31#include "nvim/fold.h"
32#include "nvim/getchar.h"
33#include "nvim/indent.h"
34#include "nvim/indent_c.h"
35#include "nvim/main.h"
36#include "nvim/mbyte.h"
37#include "nvim/memline.h"
38#include "nvim/memory.h"
39#include "nvim/message.h"
40#include "nvim/misc1.h"
41#include "nvim/misc2.h"
42#include "nvim/keymap.h"
43#include "nvim/move.h"
44#include "nvim/normal.h"
45#include "nvim/ops.h"
46#include "nvim/option.h"
47#include "nvim/path.h"
48#include "nvim/popupmnu.h"
49#include "nvim/quickfix.h"
50#include "nvim/regexp.h"
51#include "nvim/screen.h"
52#include "nvim/search.h"
53#include "nvim/spell.h"
54#include "nvim/strings.h"
55#include "nvim/syntax.h"
56#include "nvim/tag.h"
57#include "nvim/term.h"
58#include "nvim/ui.h"
59#include "nvim/undo.h"
60#include "nvim/window.h"
61#include "nvim/os/event.h"
62
63/*
64 * definitions used for CTRL-X submode
65 */
66#define CTRL_X_WANT_IDENT0x100 0x100
67
68#define CTRL_X_NOT_DEFINED_YET1 1
69#define CTRL_X_SCROLL2 2
70#define CTRL_X_WHOLE_LINE3 3
71#define CTRL_X_FILES4 4
72#define CTRL_X_TAGS(5 + 0x100) (5 + CTRL_X_WANT_IDENT0x100)
73#define CTRL_X_PATH_PATTERNS(6 + 0x100) (6 + CTRL_X_WANT_IDENT0x100)
74#define CTRL_X_PATH_DEFINES(7 + 0x100) (7 + CTRL_X_WANT_IDENT0x100)
75#define CTRL_X_FINISHED8 8
76#define CTRL_X_DICTIONARY(9 + 0x100) (9 + CTRL_X_WANT_IDENT0x100)
77#define CTRL_X_THESAURUS(10 + 0x100) (10 + CTRL_X_WANT_IDENT0x100)
78#define CTRL_X_CMDLINE11 11
79#define CTRL_X_FUNCTION12 12
80#define CTRL_X_OMNI13 13
81#define CTRL_X_SPELL14 14
82#define CTRL_X_LOCAL_MSG15 15 /* only used in "ctrl_x_msgs" */
83
84#define CTRL_X_MSG(i)ctrl_x_msgs[(i) & ~0x100] ctrl_x_msgs[(i) & ~CTRL_X_WANT_IDENT0x100]
85
86static char *ctrl_x_msgs[] =
87{
88 N_(" Keyword completion (^N^P)")" Keyword completion (^N^P)", /* ctrl_x_mode == 0, ^P/^N compl. */
89 N_(" ^X mode (^]^D^E^F^I^K^L^N^O^Ps^U^V^Y)")" ^X mode (^]^D^E^F^I^K^L^N^O^Ps^U^V^Y)",
90 NULL((void*)0),
91 N_(" Whole line completion (^L^N^P)")" Whole line completion (^L^N^P)",
92 N_(" File name completion (^F^N^P)")" File name completion (^F^N^P)",
93 N_(" Tag completion (^]^N^P)")" Tag completion (^]^N^P)",
94 N_(" Path pattern completion (^N^P)")" Path pattern completion (^N^P)",
95 N_(" Definition completion (^D^N^P)")" Definition completion (^D^N^P)",
96 NULL((void*)0),
97 N_(" Dictionary completion (^K^N^P)")" Dictionary completion (^K^N^P)",
98 N_(" Thesaurus completion (^T^N^P)")" Thesaurus completion (^T^N^P)",
99 N_(" Command-line completion (^V^N^P)")" Command-line completion (^V^N^P)",
100 N_(" User defined completion (^U^N^P)")" User defined completion (^U^N^P)",
101 N_(" Omni completion (^O^N^P)")" Omni completion (^O^N^P)",
102 N_(" Spelling suggestion (s^N^P)")" Spelling suggestion (s^N^P)",
103 N_(" Keyword Local completion (^N^P)")" Keyword Local completion (^N^P)",
104};
105
106static char e_hitend[] = N_("Hit end of paragraph")"Hit end of paragraph";
107static char e_complwin[] = N_("E839: Completion function changed window")"E839: Completion function changed window";
108static char e_compldel[] = N_("E840: Completion function deleted text")"E840: Completion function deleted text";
109
110/*
111 * Structure used to store one match for insert completion.
112 */
113typedef struct compl_S compl_T;
114struct compl_S {
115 compl_T *cp_next;
116 compl_T *cp_prev;
117 char_u *cp_str; /* matched text */
118 char cp_icase; /* TRUE or FALSE: ignore case */
119 char_u *(cp_text[CPT_COUNT4]); /* text for the menu */
120 char_u *cp_fname; /* file containing the match, allocated when
121 * cp_flags has FREE_FNAME */
122 int cp_flags; /* ORIGINAL_TEXT, CONT_S_IPOS or FREE_FNAME */
123 int cp_number; /* sequence number */
124};
125
126#define ORIGINAL_TEXT(1) (1) /* the original text when the expansion begun */
127#define FREE_FNAME(2) (2)
128
129/*
130 * All the current matches are stored in a list.
131 * "compl_first_match" points to the start of the list.
132 * "compl_curr_match" points to the currently selected entry.
133 * "compl_shown_match" is different from compl_curr_match during
134 * ins_compl_get_exp().
135 */
136static compl_T *compl_first_match = NULL((void*)0);
137static compl_T *compl_curr_match = NULL((void*)0);
138static compl_T *compl_shown_match = NULL((void*)0);
139
140/* After using a cursor key <Enter> selects a match in the popup menu,
141 * otherwise it inserts a line break. */
142static int compl_enter_selects = FALSE0;
143
144/* When "compl_leader" is not NULL only matches that start with this string
145 * are used. */
146static char_u *compl_leader = NULL((void*)0);
147
148static int compl_get_longest = FALSE0; /* put longest common string
149 in compl_leader */
150
151static int compl_used_match; /* Selected one of the matches. When
152 FALSE the match was edited or using
153 the longest common string. */
154
155static int compl_was_interrupted = FALSE0; /* didn't finish finding
156 completions. */
157
158static int compl_restarting = FALSE0; /* don't insert match */
159
160/* When the first completion is done "compl_started" is set. When it's
161 * FALSE the word to be completed must be located. */
162static int compl_started = FALSE0;
163
164/* Set when doing something for completion that may call edit() recursively,
165 * which is not allowed. */
166static int compl_busy = FALSE0;
167
168static int compl_matches = 0;
169static char_u *compl_pattern = NULL((void*)0);
170static int compl_direction = FORWARD1;
171static int compl_shows_dir = FORWARD1;
172static int compl_pending = 0; /* > 1 for postponed CTRL-N */
173static pos_T compl_startpos;
174static colnr_T compl_col = 0; /* column where the text starts
175 * that is being completed */
176static char_u *compl_orig_text = NULL((void*)0); /* text as it was before
177 * completion started */
178static int compl_cont_mode = 0;
179static expand_T compl_xp;
180
181static int compl_opt_refresh_always = FALSE0;
182
183
184#ifdef INCLUDE_GENERATED_DECLARATIONS1
185# include "edit.c.generated.h"
186#endif
187#define BACKSPACE_CHAR1 1
188#define BACKSPACE_WORD2 2
189#define BACKSPACE_WORD_NOT_SPACE3 3
190#define BACKSPACE_LINE4 4
191
192static int spell_bad_len = 0; /* length of located bad word */
193
194static colnr_T Insstart_textlen; /* length of line when insert started */
195static colnr_T Insstart_blank_vcol; /* vcol for first inserted blank */
196static bool_Bool update_Insstart_orig = true1; /* set Insstart_orig to Insstart */
197
198static char_u *last_insert = NULL((void*)0); /* the text of the previous insert,
199 K_SPECIAL and CSI are escaped */
200static int last_insert_skip; /* nr of chars in front of previous insert */
201static int new_insert_skip; /* nr of chars in front of current insert */
202static int did_restart_edit; /* "restart_edit" when calling edit() */
203
204static int can_cindent; /* may do cindenting on this line */
205
206static int old_indent = 0; /* for ^^D command in insert mode */
207
208static int revins_on; /* reverse insert mode on */
209static int revins_chars; /* how much to skip after edit */
210static int revins_legal; /* was the last char 'legal'? */
211static int revins_scol; /* start column of revins session */
212
213static int ins_need_undo; /* call u_save() before inserting a
214 char. Set when edit() is called.
215 after that arrow_used is used. */
216
217static int did_add_space = FALSE0; /* auto_format() added an extra space
218 under the cursor */
219
220/*
221 * edit(): Start inserting text.
222 *
223 * "cmdchar" can be:
224 * 'i' normal insert command
225 * 'a' normal append command
226 * 'R' replace command
227 * 'r' "r<CR>" command: insert one <CR>. Note: count can be > 1, for redo,
228 * but still only one <CR> is inserted. The <Esc> is not used for redo.
229 * 'g' "gI" command.
230 * 'V' "gR" command for Virtual Replace mode.
231 * 'v' "gr" command for single character Virtual Replace mode.
232 *
233 * This function is not called recursively. For CTRL-O commands, it returns
234 * and lets the caller handle the Normal-mode command.
235 *
236 * Return TRUE if a CTRL-O command caused the return (insert mode pending).
237 */
238int
239edit (
240 int cmdchar,
241 int startln, /* if set, insert at start of line */
242 long count
243)
244{
245 int c = 0;
246 char_u *ptr;
247 int lastc;
248 int mincol;
249 static linenr_T o_lnum = 0;
250 int i;
251 int did_backspace = TRUE1; /* previous char was backspace */
252 int line_is_white = FALSE0; /* line is empty before insert */
253 linenr_T old_topline = 0; /* topline before insertion */
254 int old_topfill = -1;
255 int inserted_space = FALSE0; /* just inserted a space */
256 int replaceState = REPLACE(0x40 + 0x10);
257 int nomove = FALSE0; /* don't move cursor on return */
258
259 /* Remember whether editing was restarted after CTRL-O. */
260 did_restart_edit = restart_edit;
261
262 /* sleep before redrawing, needed for "CTRL-O :" that results in an
263 * error message */
264 check_for_delay(TRUE1);
265
266 // set Insstart_orig to Insstart
267 update_Insstart_orig = true1;
268
269#ifdef HAVE_SANDBOX
270 /* Don't allow inserting in the sandbox. */
271 if (sandbox != 0) {
272 EMSG(_(e_sandbox))emsg((char_u *)(gettext((char *)(e_sandbox))));
273 return FALSE0;
274 }
275#endif
276 /* Don't allow changes in the buffer while editing the cmdline. The
277 * caller of getcmdline() may get confused. */
278 if (textlock != 0) {
279 EMSG(_(e_secure))emsg((char_u *)(gettext((char *)(e_secure))));
280 return FALSE0;
281 }
282
283 /* Don't allow recursive insert mode when busy with completion. */
284 if (compl_started || compl_busy || pum_visible()) {
285 EMSG(_(e_secure))emsg((char_u *)(gettext((char *)(e_secure))));
286 return FALSE0;
287 }
288 ins_compl_clear(); /* clear stuff for CTRL-X mode */
289
290 /*
291 * Trigger InsertEnter autocommands. Do not do this for "r<CR>" or "grx".
292 */
293 if (cmdchar != 'r' && cmdchar != 'v') {
294 pos_T save_cursor = curwin->w_cursor;
295
296 if (cmdchar == 'R')
297 ptr = (char_u *)"r";
298 else if (cmdchar == 'V')
299 ptr = (char_u *)"v";
300 else
301 ptr = (char_u *)"i";
302 set_vim_var_string(VV_INSERTMODE, ptr, 1);
303 set_vim_var_string(VV_CHAR, NULL((void*)0), -1); /* clear v:char */
304 apply_autocmds(EVENT_INSERTENTER, NULL((void*)0), NULL((void*)0), FALSE0, curbuf);
305
306 /* Make sure the cursor didn't move. Do call check_cursor_col() in
307 * case the text was modified. Since Insert mode was not started yet
308 * a call to check_cursor_col() may move the cursor, especially with
309 * the "A" command, thus set State to avoid that. Also check that the
310 * line number is still valid (lines may have been deleted).
311 * Do not restore if v:char was set to a non-empty string. */
312 if (!equalpos(curwin->w_cursor, save_cursor)(((curwin->w_cursor).lnum == (save_cursor).lnum) &&
((curwin->w_cursor).col == (save_cursor).col) && (
(curwin->w_cursor).coladd == (save_cursor).coladd))
313 && *get_vim_var_str(VV_CHAR) == NUL'\000'
314 && save_cursor.lnum <= curbuf->b_ml.ml_line_count) {
315 int save_state = State;
316
317 curwin->w_cursor = save_cursor;
318 State = INSERT0x10;
319 check_cursor_col();
320 State = save_state;
321 }
322 }
323
324 /* Check if the cursor line needs redrawing before changing State. If
325 * 'concealcursor' is "n" it needs to be redrawn without concealing. */
326 conceal_check_cursur_line();
327
328 /*
329 * When doing a paste with the middle mouse button, Insstart is set to
330 * where the paste started.
331 */
332 if (where_paste_started.lnum != 0)
333 Insstart = where_paste_started;
334 else {
335 Insstart = curwin->w_cursor;
336 if (startln)
337 Insstart.col = 0;
338 }
339 Insstart_textlen = (colnr_T)linetabsize(get_cursor_line_ptr());
340 Insstart_blank_vcol = MAXCOL(0x7fffffffL);
341 if (!did_ai)
342 ai_col = 0;
343
344 if (cmdchar != NUL'\000' && restart_edit == 0) {
345 ResetRedobuff();
346 AppendNumberToRedobuff(count);
347 if (cmdchar == 'V' || cmdchar == 'v') {
348 /* "gR" or "gr" command */
349 AppendCharToRedobuff('g');
350 AppendCharToRedobuff((cmdchar == 'v') ? 'r' : 'R');
351 } else {
352 AppendCharToRedobuff(cmdchar);
353 if (cmdchar == 'g') /* "gI" command */
354 AppendCharToRedobuff('I');
355 else if (cmdchar == 'r') /* "r<CR>" command */
356 count = 1; /* insert only one <CR> */
357 }
358 }
359
360 if (cmdchar == 'R') {
361 if (p_fkmap && p_ri) {
362 beep_flush();
363 EMSG(farsi_text_3)emsg((char_u *)(farsi_text_3)); /* encoded in Farsi */
364 State = INSERT0x10;
365 } else
366 State = REPLACE(0x40 + 0x10);
367 } else if (cmdchar == 'V' || cmdchar == 'v') {
368 State = VREPLACE(0x40 + 0x80 + 0x10);
369 replaceState = VREPLACE(0x40 + 0x80 + 0x10);
370 orig_line_count = curbuf->b_ml.ml_line_count;
371 vr_lines_changed = 1;
372 } else
373 State = INSERT0x10;
374
375 stop_insert_mode = FALSE0;
376
377 /*
378 * Need to recompute the cursor position, it might move when the cursor is
379 * on a TAB or special character.
380 */
381 curs_columns(TRUE1);
382
383 /*
384 * Enable langmap or IME, indicated by 'iminsert'.
385 * Note that IME may enabled/disabled without us noticing here, thus the
386 * 'iminsert' value may not reflect what is actually used. It is updated
387 * when hitting <Esc>.
388 */
389 if (curbuf->b_p_iminsert == B_IMODE_LMAP1)
390 State |= LANGMAP0x20;
391#ifdef USE_IM_CONTROL
392 im_set_active(curbuf->b_p_iminsert == B_IMODE_IM);
393#endif
394
395 setmouse();
396 clear_showcmd();
397 /* there is no reverse replace mode */
398 revins_on = (State == INSERT0x10 && p_ri);
399 if (revins_on)
400 undisplay_dollar();
401 revins_chars = 0;
402 revins_legal = 0;
403 revins_scol = -1;
404
405 /*
406 * Handle restarting Insert mode.
407 * Don't do this for "CTRL-O ." (repeat an insert): we get here with
408 * restart_edit non-zero, and something in the stuff buffer.
409 */
410 if (restart_edit != 0 && stuff_empty()) {
411 /*
412 * After a paste we consider text typed to be part of the insert for
413 * the pasted text. You can backspace over the pasted text too.
414 */
415 if (where_paste_started.lnum)
416 arrow_used = FALSE0;
417 else
418 arrow_used = TRUE1;
419 restart_edit = 0;
420
421 /*
422 * If the cursor was after the end-of-line before the CTRL-O and it is
423 * now at the end-of-line, put it after the end-of-line (this is not
424 * correct in very rare cases).
425 * Also do this if curswant is greater than the current virtual
426 * column. Eg after "^O$" or "^O80|".
427 */
428 validate_virtcol();
429 update_curswant();
430 if (((ins_at_eol && curwin->w_cursor.lnum == o_lnum)
431 || curwin->w_curswant > curwin->w_virtcol)
432 && *(ptr = get_cursor_line_ptr() + curwin->w_cursor.col) != NUL'\000') {
433 if (ptr[1] == NUL'\000')
434 ++curwin->w_cursor.col;
435 else if (has_mbyte) {
436 i = (*mb_ptr2len)(ptr);
437 if (ptr[i] == NUL'\000')
438 curwin->w_cursor.col += i;
439 }
440 }
441 ins_at_eol = FALSE0;
442 } else
443 arrow_used = FALSE0;
444
445 /* we are in insert mode now, don't need to start it anymore */
446 need_start_insertmode = FALSE0;
447
448 /* Need to save the line for undo before inserting the first char. */
449 ins_need_undo = TRUE1;
450
451 where_paste_started.lnum = 0;
452 can_cindent = TRUE1;
453 /* The cursor line is not in a closed fold, unless 'insertmode' is set or
454 * restarting. */
455 if (!p_im && did_restart_edit == 0)
456 foldOpenCursor();
457
458 /*
459 * If 'showmode' is set, show the current (insert/replace/..) mode.
460 * A warning message for changing a readonly file is given here, before
461 * actually changing anything. It's put after the mode, if any.
462 */
463 i = 0;
464 if (p_smd && msg_silent == 0)
465 i = showmode();
466
467 if (!p_im && did_restart_edit == 0)
468 change_warning(i == 0 ? 0 : i + 1);
469
470 ui_cursor_shape(); /* may show different cursor shape */
471 do_digraph(-1); /* clear digraphs */
472
473 /*
474 * Get the current length of the redo buffer, those characters have to be
475 * skipped if we want to get to the inserted characters.
476 */
477 ptr = get_inserted();
478 if (ptr == NULL((void*)0))
479 new_insert_skip = 0;
480 else {
481 new_insert_skip = (int)STRLEN(ptr)strlen((char *)(ptr));
482 free(ptr);
483 }
484
485 old_indent = 0;
486
487 /*
488 * Main loop in Insert mode: repeat until Insert mode is left.
489 */
490 for (;; ) {
491 if (!revins_legal)
492 revins_scol = -1; /* reset on illegal motions */
493 else
494 revins_legal = 0;
495 if (arrow_used) /* don't repeat insert when arrow key used */
496 count = 0;
497
498 if (update_Insstart_orig) {
499 Insstart_orig = Insstart;
500 }
501
502 if (stop_insert_mode) {
503 /* ":stopinsert" used or 'insertmode' reset */
504 count = 0;
505 goto doESCkey;
506 }
507
508 /* set curwin->w_curswant for next K_DOWN or K_UP */
509 if (!arrow_used)
510 curwin->w_set_curswant = TRUE1;
511
512 /* If there is no typeahead may check for timestamps (e.g., for when a
513 * menu invoked a shell command). */
514 if (stuff_empty()) {
515 did_check_timestamps = FALSE0;
516 if (need_check_timestamps)
517 check_timestamps(FALSE0);
518 }
519
520 /*
521 * When emsg() was called msg_scroll will have been set.
522 */
523 msg_scroll = FALSE0;
524
525
526 /* Open fold at the cursor line, according to 'foldopen'. */
527 if (fdo_flags & FDO_INSERT0x100)
528 foldOpenCursor();
529 /* Close folds where the cursor isn't, according to 'foldclose' */
530 if (!char_avail())
531 foldCheckClose();
532
533 /*
534 * If we inserted a character at the last position of the last line in
535 * the window, scroll the window one line up. This avoids an extra
536 * redraw.
537 * This is detected when the cursor column is smaller after inserting
538 * something.
539 * Don't do this when the topline changed already, it has
540 * already been adjusted (by insertchar() calling open_line())).
541 */
542 if (curbuf->b_mod_set
543 && curwin->w_p_wrapw_onebuf_opt.wo_wrap
544 && !did_backspace
545 && curwin->w_topline == old_topline
546 && curwin->w_topfill == old_topfill
547 ) {
548 mincol = curwin->w_wcol;
549 validate_cursor_col();
550
551 if ((int)curwin->w_wcol < mincol - curbuf->b_p_ts
552 && curwin->w_wrow == curwin->w_winrow
553 + curwin->w_height - 1 - p_so
554 && (curwin->w_cursor.lnum != curwin->w_topline
555 || curwin->w_topfill > 0
556 )) {
557 if (curwin->w_topfill > 0)
558 --curwin->w_topfill;
559 else if (hasFolding(curwin->w_topline, NULL((void*)0), &old_topline))
560 set_topline(curwin, old_topline + 1);
561 else
562 set_topline(curwin, curwin->w_topline + 1);
563 }
564 }
565
566 /* May need to adjust w_topline to show the cursor. */
567 update_topline();
568
569 did_backspace = FALSE0;
570
571 validate_cursor(); /* may set must_redraw */
572
573 /*
574 * Redraw the display when no characters are waiting.
575 * Also shows mode, ruler and positions cursor.
576 */
577 ins_redraw(TRUE1);
578
579 if (curwin->w_p_scbw_onebuf_opt.wo_scb)
580 do_check_scrollbind(TRUE1);
581
582 if (curwin->w_p_crbw_onebuf_opt.wo_crb)
583 do_check_cursorbind();
584 update_curswant();
585 old_topline = curwin->w_topline;
586 old_topfill = curwin->w_topfill;
587
588#ifdef USE_ON_FLY_SCROLL
589 dont_scroll = FALSE0; /* allow scrolling here */
590#endif
591
592 /*
593 * Get a character for Insert mode. Ignore K_IGNORE.
594 */
595 lastc = c; /* remember previous char for CTRL-D */
596 do {
597 c = safe_vgetc();
598 } while (c == K_IGNORE(-((253) + ((int)(KE_IGNORE) << 8))));
599
600 /* Don't want K_CURSORHOLD for the second key, e.g., after CTRL-V. */
601 did_cursorhold = TRUE1;
602
603 if (p_hkmap && KeyTyped)
604 c = hkmap(c); /* Hebrew mode mapping */
605 if (p_fkmap && KeyTyped)
606 c = fkmap(c); /* Farsi mode mapping */
607
608 /*
609 * Special handling of keys while the popup menu is visible or wanted
610 * and the cursor is still in the completed word. Only when there is
611 * a match, skip this when no matches were found.
612 */
613 if (compl_started
614 && pum_wanted()
615 && curwin->w_cursor.col >= compl_col
616 && (compl_shown_match == NULL((void*)0)
617 || compl_shown_match != compl_shown_match->cp_next)) {
618 /* BS: Delete one character from "compl_leader". */
619 if ((c == K_BS(-(('k') + ((int)('b') << 8))) || c == Ctrl_H8)
620 && curwin->w_cursor.col > compl_col
621 && (c = ins_compl_bs()) == NUL'\000')
622 continue;
623
624 /* When no match was selected or it was edited. */
625 if (!compl_used_match) {
626 /* CTRL-L: Add one character from the current match to
627 * "compl_leader". Except when at the original match and
628 * there is nothing to add, CTRL-L works like CTRL-P then. */
629 if (c == Ctrl_L12
630 && (ctrl_x_mode != CTRL_X_WHOLE_LINE3
631 || (int)STRLEN(compl_shown_match->cp_str)strlen((char *)(compl_shown_match->cp_str))
632 > curwin->w_cursor.col - compl_col)) {
633 ins_compl_addfrommatch();
634 continue;
635 }
636
637 /* A non-white character that fits in with the current
638 * completion: Add to "compl_leader". */
639 if (ins_compl_accept_char(c)) {
640 /* Trigger InsertCharPre. */
641 char_u *str = do_insert_char_pre(c);
642 char_u *p;
643
644 if (str != NULL((void*)0)) {
645 for (p = str; *p != NUL'\000'; mb_ptr_adv(p)p += has_mbyte ? (*mb_ptr2len)(p) : 1)
646 ins_compl_addleader(PTR2CHAR(p)(has_mbyte ? mb_ptr2char(p) : (int)*(p)));
647 free(str);
648 } else
649 ins_compl_addleader(c);
650 continue;
651 }
652
653 /* Pressing CTRL-Y selects the current match. When
654 * compl_enter_selects is set the Enter key does the same. */
655 if (c == Ctrl_Y25 || (compl_enter_selects
656 && (c == CAR'\015' || c == K_KENTER(-(('K') + ((int)('A') << 8))) || c == NL'\012'))) {
657 ins_compl_delete();
658 ins_compl_insert();
659 }
660 }
661 }
662
663 /* Prepare for or stop CTRL-X mode. This doesn't do completion, but
664 * it does fix up the text when finishing completion. */
665 compl_get_longest = FALSE0;
666 if (ins_compl_prep(c))
667 continue;
668
669 /* CTRL-\ CTRL-N goes to Normal mode,
670 * CTRL-\ CTRL-G goes to mode selected with 'insertmode',
671 * CTRL-\ CTRL-O is like CTRL-O but without moving the cursor. */
672 if (c == Ctrl_BSL28) {
673 /* may need to redraw when no more chars available now */
674 ins_redraw(FALSE0);
675 ++no_mapping;
676 ++allow_keys;
677 c = plain_vgetc();
678 --no_mapping;
679 --allow_keys;
680 if (c != Ctrl_N14 && c != Ctrl_G7 && c != Ctrl_O15) {
681 /* it's something else */
682 vungetc(c);
683 c = Ctrl_BSL28;
684 } else if (c == Ctrl_G7 && p_im)
685 continue;
686 else {
687 if (c == Ctrl_O15) {
688 ins_ctrl_o();
689 ins_at_eol = FALSE0; /* cursor keeps its column */
690 nomove = TRUE1;
691 }
692 count = 0;
693 goto doESCkey;
694 }
695 }
696
697 c = do_digraph(c);
698
699 if ((c == Ctrl_V22 || c == Ctrl_Q17) && ctrl_x_mode == CTRL_X_CMDLINE11)
700 goto docomplete;
701 if (c == Ctrl_V22 || c == Ctrl_Q17) {
702 ins_ctrl_v();
703 c = Ctrl_V22; /* pretend CTRL-V is last typed character */
704 continue;
705 }
706
707 if (cindent_on()
708 && ctrl_x_mode == 0
709 ) {
710 /* A key name preceded by a bang means this key is not to be
711 * inserted. Skip ahead to the re-indenting below.
712 * A key name preceded by a star means that indenting has to be
713 * done before inserting the key. */
714 line_is_white = inindent(0);
715 if (in_cinkeys(c, '!', line_is_white))
716 goto force_cindent;
717 if (can_cindent && in_cinkeys(c, '*', line_is_white)
718 && stop_arrow() == OK1)
719 do_c_expr_indent();
720 }
721
722 if (curwin->w_p_rlw_onebuf_opt.wo_rl)
723 switch (c) {
724 case K_LEFT(-(('k') + ((int)('l') << 8))): c = K_RIGHT(-(('k') + ((int)('r') << 8))); break;
725 case K_S_LEFT(-(('#') + ((int)('4') << 8))): c = K_S_RIGHT(-(('%') + ((int)('i') << 8))); break;
726 case K_C_LEFT(-((253) + ((int)(KE_C_LEFT) << 8))): c = K_C_RIGHT(-((253) + ((int)(KE_C_RIGHT) << 8))); break;
727 case K_RIGHT(-(('k') + ((int)('r') << 8))): c = K_LEFT(-(('k') + ((int)('l') << 8))); break;
728 case K_S_RIGHT(-(('%') + ((int)('i') << 8))): c = K_S_LEFT(-(('#') + ((int)('4') << 8))); break;
729 case K_C_RIGHT(-((253) + ((int)(KE_C_RIGHT) << 8))): c = K_C_LEFT(-((253) + ((int)(KE_C_LEFT) << 8))); break;
730 }
731
732 /*
733 * If 'keymodel' contains "startsel", may start selection. If it
734 * does, a CTRL-O and c will be stuffed, we need to get these
735 * characters.
736 */
737 if (ins_start_select(c))
738 continue;
739
740 /*
741 * The big switch to handle a character in insert mode.
742 */
743 switch (c) {
744 case ESC'\033': /* End input mode */
745 if (echeck_abbr(ESC'\033' + ABBR_OFF0x100))
746 break;
747 /*FALLTHROUGH*/
748
749 case Ctrl_C3: /* End input mode */
750 if (c == Ctrl_C3 && cmdwin_type != 0) {
751 /* Close the cmdline window. */
752 cmdwin_result = K_IGNORE(-((253) + ((int)(KE_IGNORE) << 8)));
753 got_int = FALSE0; /* don't stop executing autocommands et al. */
754 nomove = TRUE1;
755 goto doESCkey;
756 }
757
758#ifdef UNIX
759do_intr:
760#endif
761 /* when 'insertmode' set, and not halfway a mapping, don't leave
762 * Insert mode */
763 if (goto_im()) {
764 if (got_int) {
765 (void)vgetc(); /* flush all buffers */
766 got_int = FALSE0;
767 } else
768 vim_beep();
769 break;
770 }
771doESCkey:
772 /*
773 * This is the ONLY return from edit()!
774 */
775 /* Always update o_lnum, so that a "CTRL-O ." that adds a line
776 * still puts the cursor back after the inserted text. */
777 if (ins_at_eol && gchar_cursor() == NUL'\000')
778 o_lnum = curwin->w_cursor.lnum;
779
780 if (ins_esc(&count, cmdchar, nomove)) {
781 if (cmdchar != 'r' && cmdchar != 'v')
782 apply_autocmds(EVENT_INSERTLEAVE, NULL((void*)0), NULL((void*)0),
783 FALSE0, curbuf);
784 did_cursorhold = FALSE0;
785 return c == Ctrl_O15;
786 }
787 continue;
788
789 case Ctrl_Z26: /* suspend when 'insertmode' set */
790 if (!p_im)
791 goto normalchar; /* insert CTRL-Z as normal char */
792 stuffReadbuff((char_u *)":st\r");
793 c = Ctrl_O15;
794 /*FALLTHROUGH*/
795
796 case Ctrl_O15: /* execute one command */
797 if (ctrl_x_mode == CTRL_X_OMNI13)
798 goto docomplete;
799 if (echeck_abbr(Ctrl_O15 + ABBR_OFF0x100))
800 break;
801 ins_ctrl_o();
802
803 /* don't move the cursor left when 'virtualedit' has "onemore". */
804 if (ve_flags & VE_ONEMORE8) {
805 ins_at_eol = FALSE0;
806 nomove = TRUE1;
807 }
808 count = 0;
809 goto doESCkey;
810
811 case K_INS(-(('k') + ((int)('I') << 8))): /* toggle insert/replace mode */
812 case K_KINS(-((253) + ((int)(KE_KINS) << 8))):
813 ins_insert(replaceState);
814 break;
815
816 case K_SELECT(-((245) + ((int)(('X')) << 8))): /* end of Select mode mapping - ignore */
817 break;
818
819
820 case K_HELP(-(('%') + ((int)('1') << 8))): /* Help key works like <ESC> <Help> */
821 case K_F1(-(('k') + ((int)('1') << 8))):
822 case K_XF1(-((253) + ((int)(KE_XF1) << 8))):
823 stuffcharReadbuff(K_HELP(-(('%') + ((int)('1') << 8))));
824 if (p_im)
825 need_start_insertmode = TRUE1;
826 goto doESCkey;
827
828
829 case K_ZERO(-((255) + ((int)(('X')) << 8))): /* Insert the previously inserted text. */
830 case NUL'\000':
831 case Ctrl_A1:
832 /* For ^@ the trailing ESC will end the insert, unless there is an
833 * error. */
834 if (stuff_inserted(NUL'\000', 1L, (c == Ctrl_A1)) == FAIL0
835 && c != Ctrl_A1 && !p_im)
836 goto doESCkey; /* quit insert mode */
837 inserted_space = FALSE0;
838 break;
839
840 case Ctrl_R18: /* insert the contents of a register */
841 ins_reg();
842 auto_format(FALSE0, TRUE1);
843 inserted_space = FALSE0;
844 break;
845
846 case Ctrl_G7: /* commands starting with CTRL-G */
847 ins_ctrl_g();
848 break;
849
850 case Ctrl_HAT30: /* switch input mode and/or langmap */
851 ins_ctrl_hat();
852 break;
853
854 case Ctrl__31: /* switch between languages */
855 if (!p_ari)
856 goto normalchar;
857 ins_ctrl_();
858 break;
859
860 case Ctrl_D4: /* Make indent one shiftwidth smaller. */
861 if (ctrl_x_mode == CTRL_X_PATH_DEFINES(7 + 0x100))
862 goto docomplete;
863 /* FALLTHROUGH */
864
865 case Ctrl_T20: /* Make indent one shiftwidth greater. */
866 if (c == Ctrl_T20 && ctrl_x_mode == CTRL_X_THESAURUS(10 + 0x100)) {
867 if (has_compl_option(FALSE0))
868 goto docomplete;
869 break;
870 }
871 ins_shift(c, lastc);
872 auto_format(FALSE0, TRUE1);
873 inserted_space = FALSE0;
874 break;
875
876 case K_DEL(-(('k') + ((int)('D') << 8))): /* delete character under the cursor */
877 case K_KDEL(-((253) + ((int)(KE_KDEL) << 8))):
878 ins_del();
879 auto_format(FALSE0, TRUE1);
880 break;
881
882 case K_BS(-(('k') + ((int)('b') << 8))): /* delete character before the cursor */
883 case Ctrl_H8:
884 did_backspace = ins_bs(c, BACKSPACE_CHAR1, &inserted_space);
885 auto_format(FALSE0, TRUE1);
886 break;
887
888 case Ctrl_W23: /* delete word before the cursor */
889 did_backspace = ins_bs(c, BACKSPACE_WORD2, &inserted_space);
890 auto_format(FALSE0, TRUE1);
891 break;
892
893 case Ctrl_U21: /* delete all inserted text in current line */
894 /* CTRL-X CTRL-U completes with 'completefunc'. */
895 if (ctrl_x_mode == CTRL_X_FUNCTION12)
896 goto docomplete;
897 did_backspace = ins_bs(c, BACKSPACE_LINE4, &inserted_space);
898 auto_format(FALSE0, TRUE1);
899 inserted_space = FALSE0;
900 break;
901
902 case K_LEFTMOUSE(-((253) + ((int)(KE_LEFTMOUSE) << 8))): /* mouse keys */
903 case K_LEFTMOUSE_NM(-((253) + ((int)(KE_LEFTMOUSE_NM) << 8))):
904 case K_LEFTDRAG(-((253) + ((int)(KE_LEFTDRAG) << 8))):
905 case K_LEFTRELEASE(-((253) + ((int)(KE_LEFTRELEASE) << 8))):
906 case K_LEFTRELEASE_NM(-((253) + ((int)(KE_LEFTRELEASE_NM) << 8))):
907 case K_MIDDLEMOUSE(-((253) + ((int)(KE_MIDDLEMOUSE) << 8))):
908 case K_MIDDLEDRAG(-((253) + ((int)(KE_MIDDLEDRAG) << 8))):
909 case K_MIDDLERELEASE(-((253) + ((int)(KE_MIDDLERELEASE) << 8))):
910 case K_RIGHTMOUSE(-((253) + ((int)(KE_RIGHTMOUSE) << 8))):
911 case K_RIGHTDRAG(-((253) + ((int)(KE_RIGHTDRAG) << 8))):
912 case K_RIGHTRELEASE(-((253) + ((int)(KE_RIGHTRELEASE) << 8))):
913 case K_X1MOUSE(-((253) + ((int)(KE_X1MOUSE) << 8))):
914 case K_X1DRAG(-((253) + ((int)(KE_X1DRAG) << 8))):
915 case K_X1RELEASE(-((253) + ((int)(KE_X1RELEASE) << 8))):
916 case K_X2MOUSE(-((253) + ((int)(KE_X2MOUSE) << 8))):
917 case K_X2DRAG(-((253) + ((int)(KE_X2DRAG) << 8))):
918 case K_X2RELEASE(-((253) + ((int)(KE_X2RELEASE) << 8))):
919 ins_mouse(c);
920 break;
921
922 case K_MOUSEDOWN(-((253) + ((int)(KE_MOUSEDOWN) << 8))): /* Default action for scroll wheel up: scroll up */
923 ins_mousescroll(MSCR_DOWN0);
924 break;
925
926 case K_MOUSEUP(-((253) + ((int)(KE_MOUSEUP) << 8))): /* Default action for scroll wheel down: scroll down */
927 ins_mousescroll(MSCR_UP1);
928 break;
929
930 case K_MOUSELEFT(-((253) + ((int)(KE_MOUSELEFT) << 8))): /* Scroll wheel left */
931 ins_mousescroll(MSCR_LEFT-1);
932 break;
933
934 case K_MOUSERIGHT(-((253) + ((int)(KE_MOUSERIGHT) << 8))): /* Scroll wheel right */
935 ins_mousescroll(MSCR_RIGHT-2);
936 break;
937
938 case K_IGNORE(-((253) + ((int)(KE_IGNORE) << 8))): /* Something mapped to nothing */
939 break;
940
941 case K_CURSORHOLD(-((253) + ((int)(KE_CURSORHOLD) << 8))): /* Didn't type something for a while. */
942 apply_autocmds(EVENT_CURSORHOLDI, NULL((void*)0), NULL((void*)0), FALSE0, curbuf);
943 did_cursorhold = TRUE1;
944 break;
945
946 case K_EVENT(-((253) + ((int)(KE_EVENT) << 8))):
947 event_process();
948 break;
949
950 case K_HOME(-(('k') + ((int)('h') << 8))): /* <Home> */
951 case K_KHOME(-(('K') + ((int)('1') << 8))):
952 case K_S_HOME(-(('#') + ((int)('2') << 8))):
953 case K_C_HOME(-((253) + ((int)(KE_C_HOME) << 8))):
954 ins_home(c);
955 break;
956
957 case K_END(-(('@') + ((int)('7') << 8))): /* <End> */
958 case K_KEND(-(('K') + ((int)('4') << 8))):
959 case K_S_END(-(('*') + ((int)('7') << 8))):
960 case K_C_END(-((253) + ((int)(KE_C_END) << 8))):
961 ins_end(c);
962 break;
963
964 case K_LEFT(-(('k') + ((int)('l') << 8))): /* <Left> */
965 if (mod_mask & (MOD_MASK_SHIFT0x02|MOD_MASK_CTRL0x04))
966 ins_s_left();
967 else
968 ins_left();
969 break;
970
971 case K_S_LEFT(-(('#') + ((int)('4') << 8))): /* <S-Left> */
972 case K_C_LEFT(-((253) + ((int)(KE_C_LEFT) << 8))):
973 ins_s_left();
974 break;
975
976 case K_RIGHT(-(('k') + ((int)('r') << 8))): /* <Right> */
977 if (mod_mask & (MOD_MASK_SHIFT0x02|MOD_MASK_CTRL0x04))
978 ins_s_right();
979 else
980 ins_right();
981 break;
982
983 case K_S_RIGHT(-(('%') + ((int)('i') << 8))): /* <S-Right> */
984 case K_C_RIGHT(-((253) + ((int)(KE_C_RIGHT) << 8))):
985 ins_s_right();
986 break;
987
988 case K_UP(-(('k') + ((int)('u') << 8))): /* <Up> */
989 if (pum_visible())
990 goto docomplete;
991 if (mod_mask & MOD_MASK_SHIFT0x02)
992 ins_pageup();
993 else
994 ins_up(FALSE0);
995 break;
996
997 case K_S_UP(-((253) + ((int)(KE_S_UP) << 8))): /* <S-Up> */
998 case K_PAGEUP(-(('k') + ((int)('P') << 8))):
999 case K_KPAGEUP(-(('K') + ((int)('3') << 8))):
1000 if (pum_visible())
1001 goto docomplete;
1002 ins_pageup();
1003 break;
1004
1005 case K_DOWN(-(('k') + ((int)('d') << 8))): /* <Down> */
1006 if (pum_visible())
1007 goto docomplete;
1008 if (mod_mask & MOD_MASK_SHIFT0x02)
1009 ins_pagedown();
1010 else
1011 ins_down(FALSE0);
1012 break;
1013
1014 case K_S_DOWN(-((253) + ((int)(KE_S_DOWN) << 8))): /* <S-Down> */
1015 case K_PAGEDOWN(-(('k') + ((int)('N') << 8))):
1016 case K_KPAGEDOWN(-(('K') + ((int)('5') << 8))):
1017 if (pum_visible())
1018 goto docomplete;
1019 ins_pagedown();
1020 break;
1021
1022
1023 case K_S_TAB(-(('k') + ((int)('B') << 8))): /* When not mapped, use like a normal TAB */
1024 c = TAB'\011';
1025 /* FALLTHROUGH */
1026
1027 case TAB'\011': /* TAB or Complete patterns along path */
1028 if (ctrl_x_mode == CTRL_X_PATH_PATTERNS(6 + 0x100))
1029 goto docomplete;
1030 inserted_space = FALSE0;
1031 if (ins_tab())
1032 goto normalchar; /* insert TAB as a normal char */
1033 auto_format(FALSE0, TRUE1);
1034 break;
1035
1036 case K_KENTER(-(('K') + ((int)('A') << 8))): /* <Enter> */
1037 c = CAR'\015';
1038 /* FALLTHROUGH */
1039 case CAR'\015':
1040 case NL'\012':
1041 /* In a quickfix window a <CR> jumps to the error under the
1042 * cursor. */
1043 if (bt_quickfix(curbuf) && c == CAR'\015') {
1044 if (curwin->w_llist_ref == NULL((void*)0)) /* quickfix window */
1045 do_cmdline_cmd((char_u *)".cc");
1046 else /* location list window */
1047 do_cmdline_cmd((char_u *)".ll");
1048 break;
1049 }
1050 if (cmdwin_type != 0) {
1051 /* Execute the command in the cmdline window. */
1052 cmdwin_result = CAR'\015';
1053 goto doESCkey;
1054 }
1055 if (ins_eol(c) && !p_im)
1056 goto doESCkey; /* out of memory */
1057 auto_format(FALSE0, FALSE0);
1058 inserted_space = FALSE0;
1059 break;
1060
1061 case Ctrl_K11: /* digraph or keyword completion */
1062 if (ctrl_x_mode == CTRL_X_DICTIONARY(9 + 0x100)) {
1063 if (has_compl_option(TRUE1))
1064 goto docomplete;
1065 break;
1066 }
1067 c = ins_digraph();
1068 if (c == NUL'\000')
1069 break;
1070 goto normalchar;
1071
1072 case Ctrl_X24: /* Enter CTRL-X mode */
1073 ins_ctrl_x();
1074 break;
1075
1076 case Ctrl_RSB29: /* Tag name completion after ^X */
1077 if (ctrl_x_mode != CTRL_X_TAGS(5 + 0x100))
1078 goto normalchar;
1079 goto docomplete;
1080
1081 case Ctrl_F6: /* File name completion after ^X */
1082 if (ctrl_x_mode != CTRL_X_FILES4)
1083 goto normalchar;
1084 goto docomplete;
1085
1086 case 's': /* Spelling completion after ^X */
1087 case Ctrl_S19:
1088 if (ctrl_x_mode != CTRL_X_SPELL14)
1089 goto normalchar;
1090 goto docomplete;
1091
1092 case Ctrl_L12: /* Whole line completion after ^X */
1093 if (ctrl_x_mode != CTRL_X_WHOLE_LINE3) {
1094 /* CTRL-L with 'insertmode' set: Leave Insert mode */
1095 if (p_im) {
1096 if (echeck_abbr(Ctrl_L12 + ABBR_OFF0x100))
1097 break;
1098 goto doESCkey;
1099 }
1100 goto normalchar;
1101 }
1102 /* FALLTHROUGH */
1103
1104 case Ctrl_P16: /* Do previous/next pattern completion */
1105 case Ctrl_N14:
1106 /* if 'complete' is empty then plain ^P is no longer special,
1107 * but it is under other ^X modes */
1108 if (*curbuf->b_p_cpt == NUL'\000'
1109 && ctrl_x_mode != 0
1110 && !(compl_cont_status & CONT_LOCAL32))
1111 goto normalchar;
1112
1113docomplete:
1114 compl_busy = TRUE1;
1115 if (ins_complete(c) == FAIL0)
1116 compl_cont_status = 0;
1117 compl_busy = FALSE0;
1118 break;
1119
1120 case Ctrl_Y25: /* copy from previous line or scroll down */
1121 case Ctrl_E5: /* copy from next line or scroll up */
1122 c = ins_ctrl_ey(c);
1123 break;
1124
1125 default:
1126#ifdef UNIX
1127 if (c == intr_char) /* special interrupt char */
1128 goto do_intr;
1129#endif
1130
1131normalchar:
1132 /*
1133 * Insert a normal character.
1134 */
1135 if (!p_paste) {
1136 /* Trigger InsertCharPre. */
1137 char_u *str = do_insert_char_pre(c);
1138 char_u *p;
1139
1140 if (str != NULL((void*)0)) {
1141 if (*str != NUL'\000' && stop_arrow() != FAIL0) {
1142 /* Insert the new value of v:char literally. */
1143 for (p = str; *p != NUL'\000'; mb_ptr_adv(p)p += has_mbyte ? (*mb_ptr2len)(p) : 1) {
1144 c = PTR2CHAR(p)(has_mbyte ? mb_ptr2char(p) : (int)*(p));
1145 if (c == CAR'\015' || c == K_KENTER(-(('K') + ((int)('A') << 8))) || c == NL'\012')
1146 ins_eol(c);
1147 else
1148 ins_char(c);
1149 }
1150 AppendToRedobuffLit(str, -1);
1151 }
1152 free(str);
1153 c = NUL'\000';
1154 }
1155
1156 /* If the new value is already inserted or an empty string
1157 * then don't insert any character. */
1158 if (c == NUL'\000')
1159 break;
1160 }
1161 /* Try to perform smart-indenting. */
1162 ins_try_si(c);
1163
1164 if (c == ' ') {
1165 inserted_space = TRUE1;
1166 if (inindent(0))
1167 can_cindent = FALSE0;
1168 if (Insstart_blank_vcol == MAXCOL(0x7fffffffL)
1169 && curwin->w_cursor.lnum == Insstart.lnum)
1170 Insstart_blank_vcol = get_nolist_virtcol();
1171 }
1172
1173 /* Insert a normal character and check for abbreviations on a
1174 * special character. Let CTRL-] expand abbreviations without
1175 * inserting it. */
1176 if (vim_iswordc(c) || (!echeck_abbr(
1177 /* Add ABBR_OFF for characters above 0x100, this is
1178 * what check_abbr() expects. */
1179 (has_mbyte && c >= 0x100) ? (c + ABBR_OFF0x100) :
1180 c) && c != Ctrl_RSB29)) {
1181 insert_special(c, FALSE0, FALSE0);
1182 revins_legal++;
1183 revins_chars++;
1184 }
1185
1186 auto_format(FALSE0, TRUE1);
1187
1188 /* When inserting a character the cursor line must never be in a
1189 * closed fold. */
1190 foldOpenCursor();
1191 break;
1192 } /* end of switch (c) */
1193
1194 /* If typed something may trigger CursorHoldI again. */
1195 if (c != K_CURSORHOLD(-((253) + ((int)(KE_CURSORHOLD) << 8))))
1196 did_cursorhold = FALSE0;
1197
1198 /* If the cursor was moved we didn't just insert a space */
1199 if (arrow_used)
1200 inserted_space = FALSE0;
1201
1202 if (can_cindent && cindent_on()
1203 && ctrl_x_mode == 0
1204 ) {
1205force_cindent:
1206 /*
1207 * Indent now if a key was typed that is in 'cinkeys'.
1208 */
1209 if (in_cinkeys(c, ' ', line_is_white)) {
1210 if (stop_arrow() == OK1)
1211 /* re-indent the current line */
1212 do_c_expr_indent();
1213 }
1214 }
1215
1216 } /* for (;;) */
1217 /* NOTREACHED */
1218}
1219
1220/*
1221 * Redraw for Insert mode.
1222 * This is postponed until getting the next character to make '$' in the 'cpo'
1223 * option work correctly.
1224 * Only redraw when there are no characters available. This speeds up
1225 * inserting sequences of characters (e.g., for CTRL-R).
1226 */
1227static void
1228ins_redraw (
1229 int ready /* not busy with something */
1230)
1231{
1232 linenr_T conceal_old_cursor_line = 0;
1233 linenr_T conceal_new_cursor_line = 0;
1234 int conceal_update_lines = FALSE0;
1235
1236 if (char_avail())
1237 return;
1238
1239 /* Trigger CursorMoved if the cursor moved. Not when the popup menu is
1240 * visible, the command might delete it. */
1241 if (ready && (
1242 has_cursormovedI()
1243 ||
1244 curwin->w_p_colew_onebuf_opt.wo_cole > 0
1245 )
1246 && !equalpos(last_cursormoved, curwin->w_cursor)(((last_cursormoved).lnum == (curwin->w_cursor).lnum) &&
((last_cursormoved).col == (curwin->w_cursor).col) &&
((last_cursormoved).coladd == (curwin->w_cursor).coladd))
1247 && !pum_visible()
1248 ) {
1249 /* Need to update the screen first, to make sure syntax
1250 * highlighting is correct after making a change (e.g., inserting
1251 * a "(". The autocommand may also require a redraw, so it's done
1252 * again below, unfortunately. */
1253 if (syntax_present(curwin) && must_redraw)
1254 update_screen(0);
1255 if (has_cursormovedI())
1256 apply_autocmds(EVENT_CURSORMOVEDI, NULL((void*)0), NULL((void*)0), FALSE0, curbuf);
1257 if (curwin->w_p_colew_onebuf_opt.wo_cole > 0) {
1258 conceal_old_cursor_line = last_cursormoved.lnum;
1259 conceal_new_cursor_line = curwin->w_cursor.lnum;
1260 conceal_update_lines = TRUE1;
1261 }
1262 last_cursormoved = curwin->w_cursor;
1263 }
1264
1265 /* Trigger TextChangedI if b_changedtick differs. */
1266 if (ready && has_textchangedI()
1267 && last_changedtick != curbuf->b_changedtick
1268 && !pum_visible()
1269 ) {
1270 if (last_changedtick_buf == curbuf)
1271 apply_autocmds(EVENT_TEXTCHANGEDI, NULL((void*)0), NULL((void*)0), FALSE0, curbuf);
1272 last_changedtick_buf = curbuf;
1273 last_changedtick = curbuf->b_changedtick;
1274 }
1275
1276 if (must_redraw)
1277 update_screen(0);
1278 else if (clear_cmdline || redraw_cmdline)
1279 showmode(); /* clear cmdline and show mode */
1280 if ((conceal_update_lines
1281 && (conceal_old_cursor_line != conceal_new_cursor_line
1282 || conceal_cursor_line(curwin)))
1283 || need_cursor_line_redraw) {
1284 if (conceal_old_cursor_line != conceal_new_cursor_line)
1285 update_single_line(curwin, conceal_old_cursor_line);
1286 update_single_line(curwin, conceal_new_cursor_line == 0
1287 ? curwin->w_cursor.lnum : conceal_new_cursor_line);
1288 curwin->w_valid &= ~VALID_CROW0x10;
1289 }
1290 showruler(FALSE0);
1291 setcursor();
1292 emsg_on_display = FALSE0; /* may remove error message now */
1293}
1294
1295/*
1296 * Handle a CTRL-V or CTRL-Q typed in Insert mode.
1297 */
1298static void ins_ctrl_v(void)
1299{
1300 int c;
1301 int did_putchar = FALSE0;
1302
1303 /* may need to redraw when no more chars available now */
1304 ins_redraw(FALSE0);
1305
1306 if (redrawing() && !char_avail()) {
1307 edit_putchar('^', TRUE1);
1308 did_putchar = TRUE1;
1309 }
1310 AppendToRedobuff((char_u *)CTRL_V_STR"\026"); /* CTRL-V */
1311
1312 add_to_showcmd_c(Ctrl_V22);
1313
1314 c = get_literal();
1315 if (did_putchar)
1316 /* when the line fits in 'columns' the '^' is at the start of the next
1317 * line and will not removed by the redraw */
1318 edit_unputchar();
1319 clear_showcmd();
1320 insert_special(c, FALSE0, TRUE1);
1321 revins_chars++;
1322 revins_legal++;
1323}
1324
1325/*
1326 * Put a character directly onto the screen. It's not stored in a buffer.
1327 * Used while handling CTRL-K, CTRL-V, etc. in Insert mode.
1328 */
1329static int pc_status;
1330#define PC_STATUS_UNSET0 0 /* pc_bytes was not set */
1331#define PC_STATUS_RIGHT1 1 /* right halve of double-wide char */
1332#define PC_STATUS_LEFT2 2 /* left halve of double-wide char */
1333#define PC_STATUS_SET3 3 /* pc_bytes was filled */
1334static char_u pc_bytes[MB_MAXBYTES21 + 1]; /* saved bytes */
1335static int pc_attr;
1336static int pc_row;
1337static int pc_col;
1338
1339void edit_putchar(int c, int highlight)
1340{
1341 int attr;
1342
1343 if (ScreenLines != NULL((void*)0)) {
1344 update_topline(); /* just in case w_topline isn't valid */
1345 validate_cursor();
1346 if (highlight)
1347 attr = hl_attr(HLF_8)highlight_attr[(int)(HLF_8)];
1348 else
1349 attr = 0;
1350 pc_row = curwin->w_winrow + curwin->w_wrow;
1351 pc_col = curwin->w_wincol;
1352 pc_status = PC_STATUS_UNSET0;
1353 if (curwin->w_p_rlw_onebuf_opt.wo_rl) {
1354 pc_col += curwin->w_width - 1 - curwin->w_wcol;
1355 if (has_mbyte) {
1356 int fix_col = mb_fix_col(pc_col, pc_row);
1357
1358 if (fix_col != pc_col) {
1359 screen_putchar(' ', pc_row, fix_col, attr);
1360 --curwin->w_wcol;
1361 pc_status = PC_STATUS_RIGHT1;
1362 }
1363 }
1364 } else {
1365 pc_col += curwin->w_wcol;
1366 if (mb_lefthalve(pc_row, pc_col))
1367 pc_status = PC_STATUS_LEFT2;
1368 }
1369
1370 /* save the character to be able to put it back */
1371 if (pc_status == PC_STATUS_UNSET0) {
1372 screen_getbytes(pc_row, pc_col, pc_bytes, &pc_attr);
1373 pc_status = PC_STATUS_SET3;
1374 }
1375 screen_putchar(c, pc_row, pc_col, attr);
1376 }
1377}
1378
1379/*
1380 * Undo the previous edit_putchar().
1381 */
1382void edit_unputchar(void)
1383{
1384 if (pc_status != PC_STATUS_UNSET0 && pc_row >= msg_scrolled) {
1385 if (pc_status == PC_STATUS_RIGHT1)
1386 ++curwin->w_wcol;
1387 if (pc_status == PC_STATUS_RIGHT1 || pc_status == PC_STATUS_LEFT2)
1388 redrawWinline(curwin->w_cursor.lnum, FALSE0);
1389 else
1390 screen_puts(pc_bytes, pc_row - msg_scrolled, pc_col, pc_attr);
1391 }
1392}
1393
1394/*
1395 * Called when p_dollar is set: display a '$' at the end of the changed text
1396 * Only works when cursor is in the line that changes.
1397 */
1398void display_dollar(colnr_T col)
1399{
1400 colnr_T save_col;
1401
1402 if (!redrawing())
1403 return;
1404
1405 cursor_off();
1406 save_col = curwin->w_cursor.col;
1407 curwin->w_cursor.col = col;
1408 if (has_mbyte) {
1409 char_u *p;
1410
1411 /* If on the last byte of a multi-byte move to the first byte. */
1412 p = get_cursor_line_ptr();
1413 curwin->w_cursor.col -= (*mb_head_off)(p, p + col);
1414 }
1415 curs_columns(FALSE0); /* recompute w_wrow and w_wcol */
1416 if (curwin->w_wcol < curwin->w_width) {
1417 edit_putchar('$', FALSE0);
1418 dollar_vcol = curwin->w_virtcol;
1419 }
1420 curwin->w_cursor.col = save_col;
1421}
1422
1423/*
1424 * Call this function before moving the cursor from the normal insert position
1425 * in insert mode.
1426 */
1427static void undisplay_dollar(void)
1428{
1429 if (dollar_vcol >= 0) {
1430 dollar_vcol = -1;
1431 redrawWinline(curwin->w_cursor.lnum, FALSE0);
1432 }
1433}
1434
1435/*
1436 * Insert an indent (for <Tab> or CTRL-T) or delete an indent (for CTRL-D).
1437 * Keep the cursor on the same character.
1438 * type == INDENT_INC increase indent (for CTRL-T or <Tab>)
1439 * type == INDENT_DEC decrease indent (for CTRL-D)
1440 * type == INDENT_SET set indent to "amount"
1441 * if round is TRUE, round the indent to 'shiftwidth' (only with _INC and _Dec).
1442 */
1443void
1444change_indent (
1445 int type,
1446 int amount,
1447 int round,
1448 int replaced, /* replaced character, put on replace stack */
1449 int call_changed_bytes /* call changed_bytes() */
1450)
1451{
1452 int vcol;
1453 int last_vcol;
1454 int insstart_less; /* reduction for Insstart.col */
1455 int new_cursor_col;
1456 int i;
1457 char_u *ptr;
1458 int save_p_list;
1459 int start_col;
1460 colnr_T vc;
1461 colnr_T orig_col = 0; /* init for GCC */
1462 char_u *new_line, *orig_line = NULL((void*)0); /* init for GCC */
1463
1464 /* VREPLACE mode needs to know what the line was like before changing */
1465 if (State & VREPLACE_FLAG0x80) {
1466 orig_line = vim_strsave(get_cursor_line_ptr()); /* Deal with NULL below */
1467 orig_col = curwin->w_cursor.col;
1468 }
1469
1470 /* for the following tricks we don't want list mode */
1471 save_p_list = curwin->w_p_listw_onebuf_opt.wo_list;
1472 curwin->w_p_listw_onebuf_opt.wo_list = FALSE0;
1473 vc = getvcol_nolist(&curwin->w_cursor);
1474 vcol = vc;
1475
1476 /*
1477 * For Replace mode we need to fix the replace stack later, which is only
1478 * possible when the cursor is in the indent. Remember the number of
1479 * characters before the cursor if it's possible.
1480 */
1481 start_col = curwin->w_cursor.col;
1482
1483 /* determine offset from first non-blank */
1484 new_cursor_col = curwin->w_cursor.col;
1485 beginline(BL_WHITE1);
1486 new_cursor_col -= curwin->w_cursor.col;
1487
1488 insstart_less = curwin->w_cursor.col;
1489
1490 /*
1491 * If the cursor is in the indent, compute how many screen columns the
1492 * cursor is to the left of the first non-blank.
1493 */
1494 if (new_cursor_col < 0)
1495 vcol = get_indent() - vcol;
1496
1497 if (new_cursor_col > 0) /* can't fix replace stack */
1498 start_col = -1;
1499
1500 /*
1501 * Set the new indent. The cursor will be put on the first non-blank.
1502 */
1503 if (type == INDENT_SET1)
1504 (void)set_indent(amount, call_changed_bytes ? SIN_CHANGED1 : 0);
1505 else {
1506 int save_State = State;
1507
1508 /* Avoid being called recursively. */
1509 if (State & VREPLACE_FLAG0x80)
1510 State = INSERT0x10;
1511 shift_line(type == INDENT_DEC3, round, 1, call_changed_bytes);
1512 State = save_State;
1513 }
1514 insstart_less -= curwin->w_cursor.col;
1515
1516 /*
1517 * Try to put cursor on same character.
1518 * If the cursor is at or after the first non-blank in the line,
1519 * compute the cursor column relative to the column of the first
1520 * non-blank character.
1521 * If we are not in insert mode, leave the cursor on the first non-blank.
1522 * If the cursor is before the first non-blank, position it relative
1523 * to the first non-blank, counted in screen columns.
1524 */
1525 if (new_cursor_col >= 0) {
1526 /*
1527 * When changing the indent while the cursor is touching it, reset
1528 * Insstart_col to 0.
1529 */
1530 if (new_cursor_col == 0)
1531 insstart_less = MAXCOL(0x7fffffffL);
1532 new_cursor_col += curwin->w_cursor.col;
1533 } else if (!(State & INSERT0x10))
1534 new_cursor_col = curwin->w_cursor.col;
1535 else {
1536 /*
1537 * Compute the screen column where the cursor should be.
1538 */
1539 vcol = get_indent() - vcol;
1540 curwin->w_virtcol = (colnr_T)((vcol < 0) ? 0 : vcol);
1541
1542 /*
1543 * Advance the cursor until we reach the right screen column.
1544 */
1545 vcol = last_vcol = 0;
1546 new_cursor_col = -1;
1547 ptr = get_cursor_line_ptr();
1548 while (vcol <= (int)curwin->w_virtcol) {
1549 last_vcol = vcol;
1550 if (has_mbyte && new_cursor_col >= 0)
1551 new_cursor_col += (*mb_ptr2len)(ptr + new_cursor_col);
1552 else
1553 ++new_cursor_col;
1554 vcol += lbr_chartabsize(ptr, ptr + new_cursor_col, (colnr_T)vcol);
1555 }
1556 vcol = last_vcol;
1557
1558 /*
1559 * May need to insert spaces to be able to position the cursor on
1560 * the right screen column.
1561 */
1562 if (vcol != (int)curwin->w_virtcol) {
1563 curwin->w_cursor.col = (colnr_T)new_cursor_col;
1564 i = (int)curwin->w_virtcol - vcol;
1565 ptr = xmallocz(i);
1566 memset(ptr, ' ', i);
1567 new_cursor_col += i;
1568 ins_str(ptr);
1569 free(ptr);
1570 }
1571
1572 /*
1573 * When changing the indent while the cursor is in it, reset
1574 * Insstart_col to 0.
1575 */
1576 insstart_less = MAXCOL(0x7fffffffL);
1577 }
1578
1579 curwin->w_p_listw_onebuf_opt.wo_list = save_p_list;
1580
1581 if (new_cursor_col <= 0)
1582 curwin->w_cursor.col = 0;
1583 else
1584 curwin->w_cursor.col = (colnr_T)new_cursor_col;
1585 curwin->w_set_curswant = TRUE1;
1586 changed_cline_bef_curs();
1587
1588 /*
1589 * May have to adjust the start of the insert.
1590 */
1591 if (State & INSERT0x10) {
1592 if (curwin->w_cursor.lnum == Insstart.lnum && Insstart.col != 0) {
1593 if ((int)Insstart.col <= insstart_less)
1594 Insstart.col = 0;
1595 else
1596 Insstart.col -= insstart_less;
1597 }
1598 if ((int)ai_col <= insstart_less)
1599 ai_col = 0;
1600 else
1601 ai_col -= insstart_less;
1602 }
1603
1604 /*
1605 * For REPLACE mode, may have to fix the replace stack, if it's possible.
1606 * If the number of characters before the cursor decreased, need to pop a
1607 * few characters from the replace stack.
1608 * If the number of characters before the cursor increased, need to push a
1609 * few NULs onto the replace stack.
1610 */
1611 if (REPLACE_NORMAL(State)(((State) & 0x40) && !((State) & 0x80)) && start_col >= 0) {
1612 while (start_col > (int)curwin->w_cursor.col) {
1613 replace_join(0); /* remove a NUL from the replace stack */
1614 --start_col;
1615 }
1616 while (start_col < (int)curwin->w_cursor.col || replaced) {
1617 replace_push(NUL'\000');
1618 if (replaced) {
1619 replace_push(replaced);
1620 replaced = NUL'\000';
1621 }
1622 ++start_col;
1623 }
1624 }
1625
1626 /*
1627 * For VREPLACE mode, we also have to fix the replace stack. In this case
1628 * it is always possible because we backspace over the whole line and then
1629 * put it back again the way we wanted it.
1630 */
1631 if (State & VREPLACE_FLAG0x80) {
1632 /* If orig_line didn't allocate, just return. At least we did the job,
1633 * even if you can't backspace. */
1634 if (orig_line == NULL((void*)0))
1635 return;
1636
1637 /* Save new line */
1638 new_line = vim_strsave(get_cursor_line_ptr());
1639
1640 /* We only put back the new line up to the cursor */
1641 new_line[curwin->w_cursor.col] = NUL'\000';
1642
1643 /* Put back original line */
1644 ml_replace(curwin->w_cursor.lnum, orig_line, FALSE0);
1645 curwin->w_cursor.col = orig_col;
1646
1647 /* Backspace from cursor to start of line */
1648 backspace_until_column(0);
1649
1650 /* Insert new stuff into line again */
1651 ins_bytes(new_line);
1652
1653 free(new_line);
1654 }
1655}
1656
1657/*
1658 * Truncate the space at the end of a line. This is to be used only in an
1659 * insert mode. It handles fixing the replace stack for REPLACE and VREPLACE
1660 * modes.
1661 */
1662void truncate_spaces(char_u *line)
1663{
1664 int i;
1665
1666 /* find start of trailing white space */
1667 for (i = (int)STRLEN(line)strlen((char *)(line)) - 1; i >= 0 && vim_iswhite(line[i])((line[i]) == ' ' || (line[i]) == '\t'); i--) {
1668 if (State & REPLACE_FLAG0x40)
1669 replace_join(0); /* remove a NUL from the replace stack */
1670 }
1671 line[i + 1] = NUL'\000';
1672}
1673
1674/*
1675 * Backspace the cursor until the given column. Handles REPLACE and VREPLACE
1676 * modes correctly. May also be used when not in insert mode at all.
1677 * Will attempt not to go before "col" even when there is a composing
1678 * character.
1679 */
1680void backspace_until_column(int col)
1681{
1682 while ((int)curwin->w_cursor.col > col) {
1683 curwin->w_cursor.col--;
1684 if (State & REPLACE_FLAG0x40)
1685 replace_do_bs(col);
1686 else if (!del_char_after_col(col))
1687 break;
1688 }
1689}
1690
1691/*
1692 * Like del_char(), but make sure not to go before column "limit_col".
1693 * Only matters when there are composing characters.
1694 * Return TRUE when something was deleted.
1695 */
1696static int del_char_after_col(int limit_col)
1697{
1698 if (enc_utf8 && limit_col >= 0) {
1699 colnr_T ecol = curwin->w_cursor.col + 1;
1700
1701 /* Make sure the cursor is at the start of a character, but
1702 * skip forward again when going too far back because of a
1703 * composing character. */
1704 mb_adjust_cursor();
1705 while (curwin->w_cursor.col < (colnr_T)limit_col) {
1706 int l = utf_ptr2len(get_cursor_pos_ptr());
1707
1708 if (l == 0) /* end of line */
1709 break;
1710 curwin->w_cursor.col += l;
1711 }
1712 if (*get_cursor_pos_ptr() == NUL'\000' || curwin->w_cursor.col == ecol)
1713 return FALSE0;
1714 del_bytes((long)((int)ecol - curwin->w_cursor.col), FALSE0, TRUE1);
1715 } else
1716 (void)del_char(FALSE0);
1717 return TRUE1;
1718}
1719
1720/*
1721 * CTRL-X pressed in Insert mode.
1722 */
1723static void ins_ctrl_x(void)
1724{
1725 /* CTRL-X after CTRL-X CTRL-V doesn't do anything, so that CTRL-X
1726 * CTRL-V works like CTRL-N */
1727 if (ctrl_x_mode != CTRL_X_CMDLINE11) {
1728 /* if the next ^X<> won't ADD nothing, then reset
1729 * compl_cont_status */
1730 if (compl_cont_status & CONT_N_ADDS4)
1731 compl_cont_status |= CONT_INTRPT(2 + 4);
1732 else
1733 compl_cont_status = 0;
1734 /* We're not sure which CTRL-X mode it will be yet */
1735 ctrl_x_mode = CTRL_X_NOT_DEFINED_YET1;
1736 edit_submode = (char_u *)_(CTRL_X_MSG(ctrl_x_mode))gettext((char *)(ctrl_x_msgs[(ctrl_x_mode) & ~0x100]));
1737 edit_submode_pre = NULL((void*)0);
1738 showmode();
1739 }
1740}
1741
1742/*
1743 * Return TRUE if the 'dict' or 'tsr' option can be used.
1744 */
1745static int has_compl_option(int dict_opt)
1746{
1747 if (dict_opt ? (*curbuf->b_p_dict == NUL'\000' && *p_dict == NUL'\000'
1748 && !curwin->w_p_spellw_onebuf_opt.wo_spell
1749 )
1750 : (*curbuf->b_p_tsr == NUL'\000' && *p_tsr == NUL'\000')) {
1751 ctrl_x_mode = 0;
1752 edit_submode = NULL((void*)0);
1753 msg_attr(dict_opt ? (char_u *)_("'dictionary' option is empty")gettext((char *)("'dictionary' option is empty"))
1754 : (char_u *)_("'thesaurus' option is empty")gettext((char *)("'thesaurus' option is empty")),
1755 hl_attr(HLF_E)highlight_attr[(int)(HLF_E)]);
1756 if (emsg_silent == 0) {
1757 vim_beep();
1758 setcursor();
1759 out_flush();
1760 ui_delay(2000L, false0);
1761 }
1762 return FALSE0;
1763 }
1764 return TRUE1;
1765}
1766
1767/*
1768 * Is the character 'c' a valid key to go to or keep us in CTRL-X mode?
1769 * This depends on the current mode.
1770 */
1771int vim_is_ctrl_x_key(int c)
1772{
1773 /* Always allow ^R - let it's results then be checked */
1774 if (c == Ctrl_R18)
1775 return TRUE1;
1776
1777 /* Accept <PageUp> and <PageDown> if the popup menu is visible. */
1778 if (ins_compl_pum_key(c))
1779 return TRUE1;
1780
1781 switch (ctrl_x_mode) {
1782 case 0: /* Not in any CTRL-X mode */
1783 return c == Ctrl_N14 || c == Ctrl_P16 || c == Ctrl_X24;
1784 case CTRL_X_NOT_DEFINED_YET1:
1785 return c == Ctrl_X24 || c == Ctrl_Y25 || c == Ctrl_E5
1786 || c == Ctrl_L12 || c == Ctrl_F6 || c == Ctrl_RSB29
1787 || c == Ctrl_I9 || c == Ctrl_D4 || c == Ctrl_P16
1788 || c == Ctrl_N14 || c == Ctrl_T20 || c == Ctrl_V22
1789 || c == Ctrl_Q17 || c == Ctrl_U21 || c == Ctrl_O15
1790 || c == Ctrl_S19 || c == Ctrl_K11 || c == 's';
1791 case CTRL_X_SCROLL2:
1792 return c == Ctrl_Y25 || c == Ctrl_E5;
1793 case CTRL_X_WHOLE_LINE3:
1794 return c == Ctrl_L12 || c == Ctrl_P16 || c == Ctrl_N14;
1795 case CTRL_X_FILES4:
1796 return c == Ctrl_F6 || c == Ctrl_P16 || c == Ctrl_N14;
1797 case CTRL_X_DICTIONARY(9 + 0x100):
1798 return c == Ctrl_K11 || c == Ctrl_P16 || c == Ctrl_N14;
1799 case CTRL_X_THESAURUS(10 + 0x100):
1800 return c == Ctrl_T20 || c == Ctrl_P16 || c == Ctrl_N14;
1801 case CTRL_X_TAGS(5 + 0x100):
1802 return c == Ctrl_RSB29 || c == Ctrl_P16 || c == Ctrl_N14;
1803 case CTRL_X_PATH_PATTERNS(6 + 0x100):
1804 return c == Ctrl_P16 || c == Ctrl_N14;
1805 case CTRL_X_PATH_DEFINES(7 + 0x100):
1806 return c == Ctrl_D4 || c == Ctrl_P16 || c == Ctrl_N14;
1807 case CTRL_X_CMDLINE11:
1808 return c == Ctrl_V22 || c == Ctrl_Q17 || c == Ctrl_P16 || c == Ctrl_N14
1809 || c == Ctrl_X24;
1810 case CTRL_X_FUNCTION12:
1811 return c == Ctrl_U21 || c == Ctrl_P16 || c == Ctrl_N14;
1812 case CTRL_X_OMNI13:
1813 return c == Ctrl_O15 || c == Ctrl_P16 || c == Ctrl_N14;
1814 case CTRL_X_SPELL14:
1815 return c == Ctrl_S19 || c == Ctrl_P16 || c == Ctrl_N14;
1816 }
1817 EMSG(_(e_internal))emsg((char_u *)(gettext((char *)(e_internal))));
1818 return FALSE0;
1819}
1820
1821/*
1822 * Return TRUE when character "c" is part of the item currently being
1823 * completed. Used to decide whether to abandon complete mode when the menu
1824 * is visible.
1825 */
1826static int ins_compl_accept_char(int c)
1827{
1828 if (ctrl_x_mode & CTRL_X_WANT_IDENT0x100)
1829 /* When expanding an identifier only accept identifier chars. */
1830 return vim_isIDc(c);
1831
1832 switch (ctrl_x_mode) {
1833 case CTRL_X_FILES4:
1834 /* When expanding file name only accept file name chars. But not
1835 * path separators, so that "proto/<Tab>" expands files in
1836 * "proto", not "proto/" as a whole */
1837 return vim_isfilec(c) && !vim_ispathsep(c);
1838
1839 case CTRL_X_CMDLINE11:
1840 case CTRL_X_OMNI13:
1841 /* Command line and Omni completion can work with just about any
1842 * printable character, but do stop at white space. */
1843 return vim_isprintc(c) && !vim_iswhite(c)((c) == ' ' || (c) == '\t');
1844
1845 case CTRL_X_WHOLE_LINE3:
1846 /* For while line completion a space can be part of the line. */
1847 return vim_isprintc(c);
1848 }
1849 return vim_iswordc(c);
1850}
1851
1852/*
1853 * This is like ins_compl_add(), but if 'ic' and 'inf' are set, then the
1854 * case of the originally typed text is used, and the case of the completed
1855 * text is inferred, ie this tries to work out what case you probably wanted
1856 * the rest of the word to be in -- webb
1857 */
1858int ins_compl_add_infercase(char_u *str, int len, int icase, char_u *fname, int dir, int flags)
1859{
1860 char_u *p;
1861 int i, c;
1862 int actual_len; /* Take multi-byte characters */
1863 int actual_compl_length; /* into account. */
1864 int min_len;
1865 int *wca; /* Wide character array. */
1866 int has_lower = FALSE0;
1867 int was_letter = FALSE0;
1868
1869 if (p_ic && curbuf->b_p_inf && len > 0) {
1870 /* Infer case of completed part. */
1871
1872 /* Find actual length of completion. */
1873 if (has_mbyte) {
1874 p = str;
1875 actual_len = 0;
1876 while (*p != NUL'\000') {
1877 mb_ptr_adv(p)p += has_mbyte ? (*mb_ptr2len)(p) : 1;
1878 ++actual_len;
1879 }
1880 } else
1881 actual_len = len;
1882
1883 /* Find actual length of original text. */
1884 if (has_mbyte) {
1885 p = compl_orig_text;
1886 actual_compl_length = 0;
1887 while (*p != NUL'\000') {
1888 mb_ptr_adv(p)p += has_mbyte ? (*mb_ptr2len)(p) : 1;
1889 ++actual_compl_length;
1890 }
1891 } else
1892 actual_compl_length = compl_length;
1893
1894 /* "actual_len" may be smaller than "actual_compl_length" when using
1895 * thesaurus, only use the minimum when comparing. */
1896 min_len = actual_len < actual_compl_length
1897 ? actual_len : actual_compl_length;
1898
1899 /* Allocate wide character array for the completion and fill it. */
1900 wca = xmalloc(actual_len * sizeof(*wca));
1901 p = str;
1902 for (i = 0; i < actual_len; ++i)
1903 if (has_mbyte)
1904 wca[i] = mb_ptr2char_adv(&p);
1905 else
1906 wca[i] = *(p++);
1907
1908 /* Rule 1: Were any chars converted to lower? */
1909 p = compl_orig_text;
1910 for (i = 0; i < min_len; ++i) {
1911 if (has_mbyte)
1912 c = mb_ptr2char_adv(&p);
1913 else
1914 c = *(p++);
1915 if (vim_islower(c)) {
1916 has_lower = TRUE1;
1917 if (vim_isupper(wca[i])) {
1918 /* Rule 1 is satisfied. */
1919 for (i = actual_compl_length; i < actual_len; ++i)
1920 wca[i] = vim_tolower(wca[i]);
1921 break;
1922 }
1923 }
1924 }
1925
1926 /*
1927 * Rule 2: No lower case, 2nd consecutive letter converted to
1928 * upper case.
1929 */
1930 if (!has_lower) {
1931 p = compl_orig_text;
1932 for (i = 0; i < min_len; ++i) {
1933 if (has_mbyte)
1934 c = mb_ptr2char_adv(&p);
1935 else
1936 c = *(p++);
1937 if (was_letter && vim_isupper(c) && vim_islower(wca[i])) {
1938 /* Rule 2 is satisfied. */
1939 for (i = actual_compl_length; i < actual_len; ++i)
1940 wca[i] = vim_toupper(wca[i]);
1941 break;
1942 }
1943 was_letter = vim_islower(c) || vim_isupper(c);
1944 }
1945 }
1946
1947 /* Copy the original case of the part we typed. */
1948 p = compl_orig_text;
1949 for (i = 0; i < min_len; ++i) {
1950 if (has_mbyte)
1951 c = mb_ptr2char_adv(&p);
1952 else
1953 c = *(p++);
1954 if (vim_islower(c))
1955 wca[i] = vim_tolower(wca[i]);
1956 else if (vim_isupper(c))
1957 wca[i] = vim_toupper(wca[i]);
1958 }
1959
1960 /*
1961 * Generate encoding specific output from wide character array.
1962 * Multi-byte characters can occupy up to five bytes more than
1963 * ASCII characters, and we also need one byte for NUL, so stay
1964 * six bytes away from the edge of IObuff.
1965 */
1966 p = IObuff;
1967 i = 0;
1968 while (i < actual_len && (p - IObuff + 6) < IOSIZE(1024+1))
1969 if (has_mbyte)
1970 p += (*mb_char2bytes)(wca[i++], p);
1971 else
1972 *(p++) = wca[i++];
1973 *p = NUL'\000';
1974
1975 free(wca);
1976
1977 return ins_compl_add(IObuff, len, icase, fname, NULL((void*)0), dir,
1978 flags, FALSE0);
1979 }
1980 return ins_compl_add(str, len, icase, fname, NULL((void*)0), dir, flags, FALSE0);
1981}
1982
1983/*
1984 * Add a match to the list of matches.
1985 * If the given string is already in the list of completions, then return
1986 * NOTDONE, otherwise add it to the list and return OK. If there is an error
1987 * then FAIL is returned.
1988 */
1989static int
1990ins_compl_add (
1991 char_u *str,
1992 int len,
1993 int icase,
1994 char_u *fname,
1995 char_u **cptext, /* extra text for popup menu or NULL */
1996 int cdir,
1997 int flags,
1998 int adup /* accept duplicate match */
1999)
2000{
2001 compl_T *match;
2002 int dir = (cdir == 0 ? compl_direction : cdir);
2003
2004 ui_breakcheck();
2005 if (got_int)
2006 return FAIL0;
2007 if (len < 0)
2008 len = (int)STRLEN(str)strlen((char *)(str));
2009
2010 /*
2011 * If the same match is already present, don't add it.
2012 */
2013 if (compl_first_match != NULL((void*)0) && !adup) {
2014 match = compl_first_match;
2015 do {
2016 if ( !(match->cp_flags & ORIGINAL_TEXT(1))
2017 && STRNCMP(match->cp_str, str, len)strncmp((char *)(match->cp_str), (char *)(str), (size_t)(len
)) == 0
2018 && match->cp_str[len] == NUL'\000')
2019 return NOTDONE2;
2020 match = match->cp_next;
2021 } while (match != NULL((void*)0) && match != compl_first_match);
2022 }
2023
2024 /* Remove any popup menu before changing the list of matches. */
2025 ins_compl_del_pum();
2026
2027 /*
2028 * Allocate a new match structure.
2029 * Copy the values to the new match structure.
2030 */
2031 match = xcalloc(1, sizeof(compl_T));
2032 match->cp_number = -1;
2033 if (flags & ORIGINAL_TEXT(1))
2034 match->cp_number = 0;
2035 match->cp_str = vim_strnsave(str, len);
2036 match->cp_icase = icase;
2037
2038 /* match-fname is:
2039 * - compl_curr_match->cp_fname if it is a string equal to fname.
2040 * - a copy of fname, FREE_FNAME is set to free later THE allocated mem.
2041 * - NULL otherwise. --Acevedo */
2042 if (fname != NULL((void*)0)
2043 && compl_curr_match != NULL((void*)0)
2044 && compl_curr_match->cp_fname != NULL((void*)0)
2045 && STRCMP(fname, compl_curr_match->cp_fname)strcmp((char *)(fname), (char *)(compl_curr_match->cp_fname
)) == 0)
2046 match->cp_fname = compl_curr_match->cp_fname;
2047 else if (fname != NULL((void*)0)) {
2048 match->cp_fname = vim_strsave(fname);
2049 flags |= FREE_FNAME(2);
2050 } else
2051 match->cp_fname = NULL((void*)0);
2052 match->cp_flags = flags;
2053
2054 if (cptext != NULL((void*)0)) {
2055 int i;
2056
2057 for (i = 0; i < CPT_COUNT4; ++i)
2058 if (cptext[i] != NULL((void*)0) && *cptext[i] != NUL'\000')
2059 match->cp_text[i] = vim_strsave(cptext[i]);
2060 }
2061
2062 /*
2063 * Link the new match structure in the list of matches.
2064 */
2065 if (compl_first_match == NULL((void*)0))
2066 match->cp_next = match->cp_prev = NULL((void*)0);
2067 else if (dir == FORWARD1) {
2068 match->cp_next = compl_curr_match->cp_next;
2069 match->cp_prev = compl_curr_match;
2070 } else { /* BACKWARD */
2071 match->cp_next = compl_curr_match;
2072 match->cp_prev = compl_curr_match->cp_prev;
2073 }
2074 if (match->cp_next)
2075 match->cp_next->cp_prev = match;
2076 if (match->cp_prev)
2077 match->cp_prev->cp_next = match;
2078 else /* if there's nothing before, it is the first match */
2079 compl_first_match = match;
2080 compl_curr_match = match;
2081
2082 /*
2083 * Find the longest common string if still doing that.
2084 */
2085 if (compl_get_longest && (flags & ORIGINAL_TEXT(1)) == 0)
2086 ins_compl_longest_match(match);
2087
2088 return OK1;
2089}
2090
2091/*
2092 * Return TRUE if "str[len]" matches with match->cp_str, considering
2093 * match->cp_icase.
2094 */
2095static int ins_compl_equal(compl_T *match, char_u *str, int len)
2096{
2097 if (match->cp_icase)
2098 return STRNICMP(match->cp_str, str, (size_t)len)strncasecmp((char *)(match->cp_str), (char *)(str), (size_t
)((size_t)len)) == 0;
2099 return STRNCMP(match->cp_str, str, (size_t)len)strncmp((char *)(match->cp_str), (char *)(str), (size_t)((
size_t)len)) == 0;
2100}
2101
2102/*
2103 * Reduce the longest common string for match "match".
2104 */
2105static void ins_compl_longest_match(compl_T *match)
2106{
2107 char_u *p, *s;
2108 int c1, c2;
2109 int had_match;
2110
2111 if (compl_leader == NULL((void*)0)) {
2112 /* First match, use it as a whole. */
2113 compl_leader = vim_strsave(match->cp_str);
2114 had_match = (curwin->w_cursor.col > compl_col);
2115 ins_compl_delete();
2116 ins_bytes(compl_leader + ins_compl_len());
2117 ins_redraw(FALSE0);
2118
2119 /* When the match isn't there (to avoid matching itself) remove it
2120 * again after redrawing. */
2121 if (!had_match)
2122 ins_compl_delete();
2123 compl_used_match = FALSE0;
2124 } else {
2125 /* Reduce the text if this match differs from compl_leader. */
2126 p = compl_leader;
2127 s = match->cp_str;
2128 while (*p != NUL'\000') {
2129 if (has_mbyte) {
2130 c1 = mb_ptr2char(p);
2131 c2 = mb_ptr2char(s);
2132 } else {
2133 c1 = *p;
2134 c2 = *s;
2135 }
2136 if (match->cp_icase ? (vim_tolower(c1) != vim_tolower(c2))
2137 : (c1 != c2))
2138 break;
2139 if (has_mbyte) {
2140 mb_ptr_adv(p)p += has_mbyte ? (*mb_ptr2len)(p) : 1;
2141 mb_ptr_adv(s)s += has_mbyte ? (*mb_ptr2len)(s) : 1;
2142 } else {
2143 ++p;
2144 ++s;
2145 }
2146 }
2147
2148 if (*p != NUL'\000') {
2149 /* Leader was shortened, need to change the inserted text. */
2150 *p = NUL'\000';
2151 had_match = (curwin->w_cursor.col > compl_col);
2152 ins_compl_delete();
2153 ins_bytes(compl_leader + ins_compl_len());
2154 ins_redraw(FALSE0);
2155
2156 /* When the match isn't there (to avoid matching itself) remove it
2157 * again after redrawing. */
2158 if (!had_match)
2159 ins_compl_delete();
2160 }
2161
2162 compl_used_match = FALSE0;
2163 }
2164}
2165
2166/*
2167 * Add an array of matches to the list of matches.
2168 * Frees matches[].
2169 */
2170static void ins_compl_add_matches(int num_matches, char_u **matches, int icase)
2171{
2172 int i;
2173 int add_r = OK1;
2174 int dir = compl_direction;
2175
2176 for (i = 0; i < num_matches && add_r != FAIL0; i++)
2177 if ((add_r = ins_compl_add(matches[i], -1, icase,
2178 NULL((void*)0), NULL((void*)0), dir, 0, FALSE0)) == OK1)
2179 /* if dir was BACKWARD then honor it just once */
2180 dir = FORWARD1;
2181 FreeWild(num_matches, matches);
2182}
2183
2184/* Make the completion list cyclic.
2185 * Return the number of matches (excluding the original).
2186 */
2187static int ins_compl_make_cyclic(void)
2188{
2189 compl_T *match;
2190 int count = 0;
2191
2192 if (compl_first_match != NULL((void*)0)) {
2193 /*
2194 * Find the end of the list.
2195 */
2196 match = compl_first_match;
2197 /* there's always an entry for the compl_orig_text, it doesn't count. */
2198 while (match->cp_next != NULL((void*)0) && match->cp_next != compl_first_match) {
2199 match = match->cp_next;
2200 ++count;
2201 }
2202 match->cp_next = compl_first_match;
2203 compl_first_match->cp_prev = match;
2204 }
2205 return count;
2206}
2207
2208/*
2209 * Start completion for the complete() function.
2210 * "startcol" is where the matched text starts (1 is first column).
2211 * "list" is the list of matches.
2212 */
2213void set_completion(colnr_T startcol, list_T *list)
2214{
2215 /* If already doing completions stop it. */
2216 if (ctrl_x_mode != 0)
2217 ins_compl_prep(' ');
2218 ins_compl_clear();
2219
2220 if (stop_arrow() == FAIL0)
2221 return;
2222
2223 compl_direction = FORWARD1;
2224 if (startcol > curwin->w_cursor.col)
2225 startcol = curwin->w_cursor.col;
2226 compl_col = startcol;
2227 compl_length = (int)curwin->w_cursor.col - (int)startcol;
2228 /* compl_pattern doesn't need to be set */
2229 compl_orig_text = vim_strnsave(get_cursor_line_ptr() + compl_col,
2230 compl_length);
2231 if (ins_compl_add(compl_orig_text, -1, p_ic, NULL((void*)0), NULL((void*)0), 0,
2232 ORIGINAL_TEXT(1), FALSE0) != OK1) {
2233 return;
2234 }
2235
2236 /* Handle like dictionary completion. */
2237 ctrl_x_mode = CTRL_X_WHOLE_LINE3;
2238
2239 ins_compl_add_list(list);
2240 compl_matches = ins_compl_make_cyclic();
2241 compl_started = TRUE1;
2242 compl_used_match = TRUE1;
2243 compl_cont_status = 0;
2244
2245 compl_curr_match = compl_first_match;
2246 ins_complete(Ctrl_N14);
2247 out_flush();
2248}
2249
2250
2251/* "compl_match_array" points the currently displayed list of entries in the
2252 * popup menu. It is NULL when there is no popup menu. */
2253static pumitem_T *compl_match_array = NULL((void*)0);
2254static int compl_match_arraysize;
2255
2256/*
2257 * Update the screen and when there is any scrolling remove the popup menu.
2258 */
2259static void ins_compl_upd_pum(void)
2260{
2261 int h;
2262
2263 if (compl_match_array != NULL((void*)0)) {
2264 h = curwin->w_cline_height;
2265 update_screen(0);
2266 if (h != curwin->w_cline_height)
2267 ins_compl_del_pum();
2268 }
2269}
2270
2271/*
2272 * Remove any popup menu.
2273 */
2274static void ins_compl_del_pum(void)
2275{
2276 if (compl_match_array != NULL((void*)0)) {
2277 pum_undisplay();
2278 free(compl_match_array);
2279 compl_match_array = NULL((void*)0);
2280 }
2281}
2282
2283/*
2284 * Return TRUE if the popup menu should be displayed.
2285 */
2286static int pum_wanted(void)
2287{
2288 /* 'completeopt' must contain "menu" or "menuone" */
2289 if (vim_strchr(p_cot, 'm') == NULL((void*)0))
2290 return FALSE0;
2291
2292 /* The display looks bad on a B&W display. */
2293 if (t_colors < 8
2294 )
2295 return FALSE0;
2296 return TRUE1;
2297}
2298
2299/*
2300 * Return TRUE if there are two or more matches to be shown in the popup menu.
2301 * One if 'completopt' contains "menuone".
2302 */
2303static int pum_enough_matches(void)
2304{
2305 compl_T *compl;
2306 int i;
2307
2308 /* Don't display the popup menu if there are no matches or there is only
2309 * one (ignoring the original text). */
2310 compl = compl_first_match;
2311 i = 0;
2312 do {
2313 if (compl == NULL((void*)0)
2314 || ((compl->cp_flags & ORIGINAL_TEXT(1)) == 0 && ++i == 2))
2315 break;
2316 compl = compl->cp_next;
2317 } while (compl != compl_first_match);
2318
2319 if (strstr((char *)p_cot, "menuone") != NULL((void*)0))
2320 return i >= 1;
2321 return i >= 2;
2322}
2323
2324/*
2325 * Show the popup menu for the list of matches.
2326 * Also adjusts "compl_shown_match" to an entry that is actually displayed.
2327 */
2328void ins_compl_show_pum(void)
2329{
2330 compl_T *compl;
2331 compl_T *shown_compl = NULL((void*)0);
2332 int did_find_shown_match = FALSE0;
2333 int shown_match_ok = FALSE0;
2334 int i;
2335 int cur = -1;
2336 colnr_T col;
2337 int lead_len = 0;
2338
2339 if (!pum_wanted() || !pum_enough_matches())
2340 return;
2341
2342 /* Dirty hard-coded hack: remove any matchparen highlighting. */
2343 do_cmdline_cmd((char_u *)"if exists('g:loaded_matchparen')|3match none|endif");
2344
2345 /* Update the screen before drawing the popup menu over it. */
2346 update_screen(0);
2347
2348 if (compl_match_array == NULL((void*)0)) {
2349 /* Need to build the popup menu list. */
2350 compl_match_arraysize = 0;
2351 compl = compl_first_match;
2352 if (compl_leader != NULL((void*)0))
2353 lead_len = (int)STRLEN(compl_leader)strlen((char *)(compl_leader));
2354 do {
2355 if ((compl->cp_flags & ORIGINAL_TEXT(1)) == 0
2356 && (compl_leader == NULL((void*)0)
2357 || ins_compl_equal(compl, compl_leader, lead_len)))
2358 ++compl_match_arraysize;
2359 compl = compl->cp_next;
2360 } while (compl != NULL((void*)0) && compl != compl_first_match);
2361 if (compl_match_arraysize == 0)
2362 return;
2363
2364 assert(compl_match_arraysize >= 0)((compl_match_arraysize >= 0) ? (void) (0) : __assert_fail
("compl_match_arraysize >= 0", "/home/travis/build/neovim/bot-ci/build/neovim/src/nvim/edit.c"
, 2364, __PRETTY_FUNCTION__));
2365 compl_match_array = xcalloc(compl_match_arraysize, sizeof(pumitem_T));
2366 /* If the current match is the original text don't find the first
2367 * match after it, don't highlight anything. */
2368 if (compl_shown_match->cp_flags & ORIGINAL_TEXT(1))
2369 shown_match_ok = TRUE1;
2370
2371 i = 0;
2372 compl = compl_first_match;
2373 do {
2374 if ((compl->cp_flags & ORIGINAL_TEXT(1)) == 0
2375 && (compl_leader == NULL((void*)0)
2376 || ins_compl_equal(compl, compl_leader, lead_len))) {
2377 if (!shown_match_ok) {
2378 if (compl == compl_shown_match || did_find_shown_match) {
2379 /* This item is the shown match or this is the
2380 * first displayed item after the shown match. */
2381 compl_shown_match = compl;
2382 did_find_shown_match = TRUE1;
2383 shown_match_ok = TRUE1;
2384 } else
2385 /* Remember this displayed match for when the
2386 * shown match is just below it. */
2387 shown_compl = compl;
2388 cur = i;
2389 }
2390
2391 if (compl->cp_text[CPT_ABBR0] != NULL((void*)0))
2392 compl_match_array[i].pum_text =
2393 compl->cp_text[CPT_ABBR0];
2394 else
2395 compl_match_array[i].pum_text = compl->cp_str;
2396 compl_match_array[i].pum_kind = compl->cp_text[CPT_KIND2];
2397 compl_match_array[i].pum_info = compl->cp_text[CPT_INFO3];
2398 if (compl->cp_text[CPT_MENU1] != NULL((void*)0))
2399 compl_match_array[i++].pum_extra =
2400 compl->cp_text[CPT_MENU1];
2401 else
2402 compl_match_array[i++].pum_extra = compl->cp_fname;
2403 }
2404
2405 if (compl == compl_shown_match) {
2406 did_find_shown_match = TRUE1;
2407
2408 /* When the original text is the shown match don't set
2409 * compl_shown_match. */
2410 if (compl->cp_flags & ORIGINAL_TEXT(1))
2411 shown_match_ok = TRUE1;
2412
2413 if (!shown_match_ok && shown_compl != NULL((void*)0)) {
2414 /* The shown match isn't displayed, set it to the
2415 * previously displayed match. */
2416 compl_shown_match = shown_compl;
2417 shown_match_ok = TRUE1;
2418 }
2419 }
2420 compl = compl->cp_next;
2421 } while (compl != NULL((void*)0) && compl != compl_first_match);
2422
2423 if (!shown_match_ok) /* no displayed match at all */
2424 cur = -1;
2425 } else {
2426 /* popup menu already exists, only need to find the current item.*/
2427 for (i = 0; i < compl_match_arraysize; ++i)
2428 if (compl_match_array[i].pum_text == compl_shown_match->cp_str
2429 || compl_match_array[i].pum_text
2430 == compl_shown_match->cp_text[CPT_ABBR0]) {
2431 cur = i;
2432 break;
2433 }
2434 }
2435
2436 if (compl_match_array != NULL((void*)0)) {
2437 /* Compute the screen column of the start of the completed text.
2438 * Use the cursor to get all wrapping and other settings right. */
2439 col = curwin->w_cursor.col;
2440 curwin->w_cursor.col = compl_col;
2441 pum_display(compl_match_array, compl_match_arraysize, cur);
2442 curwin->w_cursor.col = col;
2443 }
2444}
2445
2446#define DICT_FIRST(1) (1) /* use just first element in "dict" */
2447#define DICT_EXACT(2) (2) /* "dict" is the exact name of a file */
2448
2449/*
2450 * Add any identifiers that match the given pattern in the list of dictionary
2451 * files "dict_start" to the list of completions.
2452 */
2453static void
2454ins_compl_dictionaries (
2455 char_u *dict_start,
2456 char_u *pat,
2457 int flags, /* DICT_FIRST and/or DICT_EXACT */
2458 int thesaurus /* Thesaurus completion */
2459)
2460{
2461 char_u *dict = dict_start;
2462 char_u *ptr;
2463 char_u *buf;
2464 regmatch_T regmatch;
2465 char_u **files;
2466 int count;
2467 int save_p_scs;
2468 int dir = compl_direction;
2469
2470 if (*dict == NUL'\000') {
2471 /* When 'dictionary' is empty and spell checking is enabled use
2472 * "spell". */
2473 if (!thesaurus && curwin->w_p_spellw_onebuf_opt.wo_spell)
2474 dict = (char_u *)"spell";
2475 else
2476 return;
2477 }
2478
2479 buf = xmalloc(LSIZE512);
2480 regmatch.regprog = NULL((void*)0); /* so that we can goto theend */
2481
2482 /* If 'infercase' is set, don't use 'smartcase' here */
2483 save_p_scs = p_scs;
2484 if (curbuf->b_p_inf)
2485 p_scs = FALSE0;
2486
