2487 /* When invoked to match whole lines for CTRL-X CTRL-L adjust the pattern
2488 * to only match at the start of a line. Otherwise just match the
2489 * pattern. Also need to double backslashes. */
2490 if (ctrl_x_mode == CTRL_X_WHOLE_LINE3) {
2491 char_u *pat_esc = vim_strsave_escaped(pat, (char_u *)"\\");
2492
2493 size_t len = STRLEN(pat_esc)strlen((char *)(pat_esc)) + 10;
2494 ptr = xmalloc(len);
2495 vim_snprintf((char *)ptr, len, "^\\s*\\zs\\V%s", pat_esc);
2496 regmatch.regprog = vim_regcomp(ptr, RE_MAGIC1);
2497 free(pat_esc);
2498 free(ptr);
2499 } else {
2500 regmatch.regprog = vim_regcomp(pat, p_magic ? RE_MAGIC1 : 0);
2501 if (regmatch.regprog == NULL((void*)0))
2502 goto theend;
2503 }
2504
2505 /* ignore case depends on 'ignorecase', 'smartcase' and "pat" */
2506 regmatch.rm_ic = ignorecase(pat);
2507 while (*dict != NUL'\000' && !got_int && !compl_interrupted) {
2508 /* copy one dictionary file name into buf */
2509 if (flags == DICT_EXACT(2)) {
2510 count = 1;
2511 files = &dict;
2512 } else {
2513 /* Expand wildcards in the dictionary name, but do not allow
2514 * backticks (for security, the 'dict' option may have been set in
2515 * a modeline). */
2516 copy_option_part(&dict, buf, LSIZE512, ",");
2517 if (!thesaurus && STRCMP(buf, "spell")strcmp((char *)(buf), (char *)("spell")) == 0)
2518 count = -1;
2519 else if (vim_strchr(buf, '`') != NULL((void*)0)
2520 || expand_wildcards(1, &buf, &count, &files,
2521 EW_FILE0x02|EW_SILENT0x20) != OK1)
2522 count = 0;
2523 }
2524
2525 if (count == -1) {
2526 /* Complete from active spelling. Skip "\<" in the pattern, we
2527 * don't use it as a RE. */
2528 if (pat[0] == '\\' && pat[1] == '<')
2529 ptr = pat + 2;
2530 else
2531 ptr = pat;
2532 spell_dump_compl(ptr, regmatch.rm_ic, &dir, 0);
2533 } else if (count > 0) { /* avoid warning for using "files" uninit */
2534 ins_compl_files(count, files, thesaurus, flags,
2535 &regmatch, buf, &dir);
2536 if (flags != DICT_EXACT(2))
2537 FreeWild(count, files);
2538 }
2539 if (flags != 0)
2540 break;
2541 }
2542
2543theend:
2544 p_scs = save_p_scs;
2545 vim_regfree(regmatch.regprog);
2546 free(buf);
2547}
2548
2549static void ins_compl_files(int count, char_u **files, int thesaurus, int flags, regmatch_T *regmatch, char_u *buf, int *dir)
2550{
2551 char_u *ptr;
2552 int i;
2553 FILE *fp;
2554 int add_r;
2555
2556 for (i = 0; i < count && !got_int && !compl_interrupted; i++) {
2557 fp = mch_fopen((char *)files[i], "r")fopen(((char *)files[i]), ("r")); /* open dictionary file */
2558 if (flags != DICT_EXACT(2)) {
2559 vim_snprintf((char *)IObuff, IOSIZE(1024+1),
2560 _("Scanning dictionary: %s")gettext((char *)("Scanning dictionary: %s")), (char *)files[i]);
2561 (void)msg_trunc_attr(IObuff, TRUE1, hl_attr(HLF_R)highlight_attr[(int)(HLF_R)]);
2562 }
2563
2564 if (fp != NULL((void*)0)) {
2565 /*
2566 * Read dictionary file line by line.
2567 * Check each line for a match.
2568 */
2569 while (!got_int && !compl_interrupted
2570 && !vim_fgets(buf, LSIZE512, fp)) {
2571 ptr = buf;
2572 while (vim_regexec(regmatch, buf, (colnr_T)(ptr - buf))) {
2573 ptr = regmatch->startp[0];
2574 if (ctrl_x_mode == CTRL_X_WHOLE_LINE3)
2575 ptr = find_line_end(ptr);
2576 else
2577 ptr = find_word_end(ptr);
2578 add_r = ins_compl_add_infercase(regmatch->startp[0],
2579 (int)(ptr - regmatch->startp[0]),
2580 p_ic, files[i], *dir, 0);
2581 if (thesaurus) {
2582 char_u *wstart;
2583
2584 /*
2585 * Add the other matches on the line
2586 */
2587 ptr = buf;
2588 while (!got_int) {
2589 /* Find start of the next word. Skip white
2590 * space and punctuation. */
2591 ptr = find_word_start(ptr);
2592 if (*ptr == NUL'\000' || *ptr == NL'\012')
2593 break;
2594 wstart = ptr;
2595
2596 /* Find end of the word. */
2597 if (has_mbyte)
2598 /* Japanese words may have characters in
2599 * different classes, only separate words
2600 * with single-byte non-word characters. */
2601 while (*ptr != NUL'\000') {
2602 int l = (*mb_ptr2len)(ptr);
2603
2604 if (l < 2 && !vim_iswordc(*ptr))
2605 break;
2606 ptr += l;
2607 }
2608 else
2609 ptr = find_word_end(ptr);
2610
2611 /* Add the word. Skip the regexp match. */
2612 if (wstart != regmatch->startp[0])
2613 add_r = ins_compl_add_infercase(wstart,
2614 (int)(ptr - wstart),
2615 p_ic, files[i], *dir, 0);
2616 }
2617 }
2618 if (add_r == OK1)
2619 /* if dir was BACKWARD then honor it just once */
2620 *dir = FORWARD1;
2621 else if (add_r == FAIL0)
2622 break;
2623 /* avoid expensive call to vim_regexec() when at end
2624 * of line */
2625 if (*ptr == '\n' || got_int)
2626 break;
2627 }
2628 line_breakcheck();
2629 ins_compl_check_keys(50);
2630 }
2631 fclose(fp);
2632 }
2633 }
2634}
2635
2636/*
2637 * Find the start of the next word.
2638 * Returns a pointer to the first char of the word. Also stops at a NUL.
2639 */
2640char_u *find_word_start(char_u *ptr)
2641{
2642 if (has_mbyte)
2643 while (*ptr != NUL'\000' && *ptr != '\n' && mb_get_class(ptr) <= 1)
2644 ptr += (*mb_ptr2len)(ptr);
2645 else
2646 while (*ptr != NUL'\000' && *ptr != '\n' && !vim_iswordc(*ptr))
2647 ++ptr;
2648 return ptr;
2649}
2650
2651/*
2652 * Find the end of the word. Assumes it starts inside a word.
2653 * Returns a pointer to just after the word.
2654 */
2655char_u *find_word_end(char_u *ptr)
2656{
2657 int start_class;
2658
2659 if (has_mbyte) {
2660 start_class = mb_get_class(ptr);
2661 if (start_class > 1)
2662 while (*ptr != NUL'\000') {
2663 ptr += (*mb_ptr2len)(ptr);
2664 if (mb_get_class(ptr) != start_class)
2665 break;
2666 }
2667 } else
2668 while (vim_iswordc(*ptr))
2669 ++ptr;
2670 return ptr;
2671}
2672
2673/*
2674 * Find the end of the line, omitting CR and NL at the end.
2675 * Returns a pointer to just after the line.
2676 */
2677static char_u *find_line_end(char_u *ptr)
2678{
2679 char_u *s;
2680
2681 s = ptr + STRLEN(ptr)strlen((char *)(ptr));
2682 while (s > ptr && (s[-1] == CAR'\015' || s[-1] == NL'\012'))
2683 --s;
2684 return s;
2685}
2686
2687/*
2688 * Free the list of completions
2689 */
2690static void ins_compl_free(void)
2691{
2692 compl_T *match;
2693 int i;
2694
2695 free(compl_pattern);
2696 compl_pattern = NULL((void*)0);
2697 free(compl_leader);
2698 compl_leader = NULL((void*)0);
2699
2700 if (compl_first_match == NULL((void*)0))
2701 return;
2702
2703 ins_compl_del_pum();
2704 pum_clear();
2705
2706 compl_curr_match = compl_first_match;
2707 do {
2708 match = compl_curr_match;
2709 compl_curr_match = compl_curr_match->cp_next;
2710 free(match->cp_str);
2711 /* several entries may use the same fname, free it just once. */
2712 if (match->cp_flags & FREE_FNAME(2))
2713 free(match->cp_fname);
2714 for (i = 0; i < CPT_COUNT4; ++i)
2715 free(match->cp_text[i]);
2716 free(match);
2717 } while (compl_curr_match != NULL((void*)0) && compl_curr_match != compl_first_match);
2718 compl_first_match = compl_curr_match = NULL((void*)0);
2719 compl_shown_match = NULL((void*)0);
2720}
2721
2722static void ins_compl_clear(void)
2723{
2724 compl_cont_status = 0;
2725 compl_started = FALSE0;
2726 compl_matches = 0;
2727 free(compl_pattern);
2728 compl_pattern = NULL((void*)0);
2729 free(compl_leader);
2730 compl_leader = NULL((void*)0);
2731 edit_submode_extra = NULL((void*)0);
2732 free(compl_orig_text);
2733 compl_orig_text = NULL((void*)0);
2734 compl_enter_selects = FALSE0;
2735}
2736
2737/*
2738 * Return TRUE when Insert completion is active.
2739 */
2740int ins_compl_active(void)
2741{
2742 return compl_started;
2743}
2744
2745/*
2746 * Delete one character before the cursor and show the subset of the matches
2747 * that match the word that is now before the cursor.
2748 * Returns the character to be used, NUL if the work is done and another char
2749 * to be got from the user.
2750 */
2751static int ins_compl_bs(void)
2752{
2753 char_u *line;
2754 char_u *p;
2755
2756 line = get_cursor_line_ptr();
2757 p = line + curwin->w_cursor.col;
2758 mb_ptr_back(line, p)p -= has_mbyte ? ((*mb_head_off)(line, p - 1) + 1) : 1;
2759
2760 /* Stop completion when the whole word was deleted. For Omni completion
2761 * allow the word to be deleted, we won't match everything. */
2762 if ((int)(p - line) - (int)compl_col < 0
2763 || ((int)(p - line) - (int)compl_col == 0
2764 && (ctrl_x_mode & CTRL_X_OMNI13) == 0))
2765 return K_BS(-(('k') + ((int)('b') << 8)));
2766
2767 /* Deleted more than what was used to find matches or didn't finish
2768 * finding all matches: need to look for matches all over again. */
2769 if (curwin->w_cursor.col <= compl_col + compl_length
2770 || ins_compl_need_restart())
2771 ins_compl_restart();
2772
2773 free(compl_leader);
2774 compl_leader = vim_strnsave(line + compl_col, (int)(p - line) - compl_col);
2775 ins_compl_new_leader();
2776 if (compl_shown_match != NULL((void*)0))
2777 /* Make sure current match is not a hidden item. */
2778 compl_curr_match = compl_shown_match;
2779
2780 return NUL'\000';
2781}
2782
2783/*
2784 * Return TRUE when we need to find matches again, ins_compl_restart() is to
2785 * be called.
2786 */
2787static int ins_compl_need_restart(void)
2788{
2789 /* Return TRUE if we didn't complete finding matches or when the
2790 * 'completefunc' returned "always" in the "refresh" dictionary item. */
2791 return compl_was_interrupted
2792 || ((ctrl_x_mode == CTRL_X_FUNCTION12 || ctrl_x_mode == CTRL_X_OMNI13)
2793 && compl_opt_refresh_always);
2794}
2795
2796/*
2797 * Called after changing "compl_leader".
2798 * Show the popup menu with a different set of matches.
2799 * May also search for matches again if the previous search was interrupted.
2800 */
2801static void ins_compl_new_leader(void)
2802{
2803 ins_compl_del_pum();
2804 ins_compl_delete();
2805 ins_bytes(compl_leader + ins_compl_len());
2806 compl_used_match = FALSE0;
2807
2808 if (compl_started)
2809 ins_compl_set_original_text(compl_leader);
2810 else {
2811 spell_bad_len = 0; /* need to redetect bad word */
2812 /*
2813 * Matches were cleared, need to search for them now. First display
2814 * the changed text before the cursor. Set "compl_restarting" to
2815 * avoid that the first match is inserted.
2816 */
2817 update_screen(0);
2818 compl_restarting = TRUE1;
2819 if (ins_complete(Ctrl_N14) == FAIL0)
2820 compl_cont_status = 0;
2821 compl_restarting = FALSE0;
2822 }
2823
2824 compl_enter_selects = !compl_used_match;
2825
2826 /* Show the popup menu with a different set of matches. */
2827 ins_compl_show_pum();
2828
2829 /* Don't let Enter select the original text when there is no popup menu. */
2830 if (compl_match_array == NULL((void*)0))
2831 compl_enter_selects = FALSE0;
2832}
2833
2834/*
2835 * Return the length of the completion, from the completion start column to
2836 * the cursor column. Making sure it never goes below zero.
2837 */
2838static int ins_compl_len(void)
2839{
2840 int off = (int)curwin->w_cursor.col - (int)compl_col;
2841
2842 if (off < 0)
2843 return 0;
2844 return off;
2845}
2846
2847/*
2848 * Append one character to the match leader. May reduce the number of
2849 * matches.
2850 */
2851static void ins_compl_addleader(int c)
2852{
2853 int cc;
2854
2855 if (has_mbyte && (cc = (*mb_char2len)(c)) > 1) {
2856 char_u buf[MB_MAXBYTES21 + 1];
2857
2858 (*mb_char2bytes)(c, buf);
2859 buf[cc] = NUL'\000';
2860 ins_char_bytes(buf, cc);
2861 if (compl_opt_refresh_always)
2862 AppendToRedobuff(buf);
2863 } else {
2864 ins_char(c);
2865 if (compl_opt_refresh_always)
2866 AppendCharToRedobuff(c);
2867 }
2868
2869 /* If we didn't complete finding matches we must search again. */
2870 if (ins_compl_need_restart())
2871 ins_compl_restart();
2872
2873 /* When 'always' is set, don't reset compl_leader. While completing,
2874 * cursor doesn't point original position, changing compl_leader would
2875 * break redo. */
2876 if (!compl_opt_refresh_always) {
2877 free(compl_leader);
2878 compl_leader = vim_strnsave(get_cursor_line_ptr() + compl_col,
2879 (int)(curwin->w_cursor.col - compl_col));
2880 ins_compl_new_leader();
2881 }
2882}
2883
2884/*
2885 * Setup for finding completions again without leaving CTRL-X mode. Used when
2886 * BS or a key was typed while still searching for matches.
2887 */
2888static void ins_compl_restart(void)
2889{
2890 ins_compl_free();
2891 compl_started = FALSE0;
2892 compl_matches = 0;
2893 compl_cont_status = 0;
2894 compl_cont_mode = 0;
2895}
2896
2897/*
2898 * Set the first match, the original text.
2899 */
2900static void ins_compl_set_original_text(char_u *str)
2901{
2902 /* Replace the original text entry. */
2903 if (compl_first_match->cp_flags & ORIGINAL_TEXT(1)) { /* safety check */
2904 free(compl_first_match->cp_str);
2905 compl_first_match->cp_str = vim_strsave(str);
2906 }
2907}
2908
2909/*
2910 * Append one character to the match leader. May reduce the number of
2911 * matches.
2912 */
2913static void ins_compl_addfrommatch(void)
2914{
2915 char_u *p;
2916 int len = (int)curwin->w_cursor.col - (int)compl_col;
2917 int c;
2918 compl_T *cp;
2919
2920 p = compl_shown_match->cp_str;
2921 if ((int)STRLEN(p)strlen((char *)(p)) <= len) { /* the match is too short */
2922 /* When still at the original match use the first entry that matches
2923 * the leader. */
2924 if (compl_shown_match->cp_flags & ORIGINAL_TEXT(1)) {
2925 p = NULL((void*)0);
2926 for (cp = compl_shown_match->cp_next; cp != NULL((void*)0)
2927 && cp != compl_first_match; cp = cp->cp_next) {
2928 if (compl_leader == NULL((void*)0)
2929 || ins_compl_equal(cp, compl_leader,
2930 (int)STRLEN(compl_leader)strlen((char *)(compl_leader)))) {
2931 p = cp->cp_str;
2932 break;
2933 }
2934 }
2935 if (p == NULL((void*)0) || (int)STRLEN(p)strlen((char *)(p)) <= len)
2936 return;
2937 } else
2938 return;
2939 }
2940 p += len;
2941 c = PTR2CHAR(p)(has_mbyte ? mb_ptr2char(p) : (int)*(p));
2942 ins_compl_addleader(c);
2943}
2944
2945/*
2946 * Prepare for Insert mode completion, or stop it.
2947 * Called just after typing a character in Insert mode.
2948 * Returns TRUE when the character is not to be inserted;
2949 */
2950static int ins_compl_prep(int c)
2951{
2952 char_u *ptr;
2953 int want_cindent;
2954 int retval = FALSE0;
2955
2956 /* Forget any previous 'special' messages if this is actually
2957 * a ^X mode key - bar ^R, in which case we wait to see what it gives us.
2958 */
2959 if (c != Ctrl_R18 && vim_is_ctrl_x_key(c))
2960 edit_submode_extra = NULL((void*)0);
2961
2962 /* Ignore end of Select mode mapping and mouse scroll buttons. */
2963 if (c == K_SELECT(-((245) + ((int)(('X')) << 8))) || c == K_MOUSEDOWN(-((253) + ((int)(KE_MOUSEDOWN) << 8))) || c == K_MOUSEUP(-((253) + ((int)(KE_MOUSEUP) << 8)))
2964 || c == K_MOUSELEFT(-((253) + ((int)(KE_MOUSELEFT) << 8))) || c == K_MOUSERIGHT(-((253) + ((int)(KE_MOUSERIGHT) << 8))))
2965 return retval;
2966
2967 /* Set "compl_get_longest" when finding the first matches. */
2968 if (ctrl_x_mode == CTRL_X_NOT_DEFINED_YET1
2969 || (ctrl_x_mode == 0 && !compl_started)) {
2970 compl_get_longest = (vim_strchr(p_cot, 'l') != NULL((void*)0));
2971 compl_used_match = TRUE1;
2972 }
2973
2974 if (ctrl_x_mode == CTRL_X_NOT_DEFINED_YET1) {
2975 /*
2976 * We have just typed CTRL-X and aren't quite sure which CTRL-X mode
2977 * it will be yet. Now we decide.
2978 */
2979 switch (c) {
2980 case Ctrl_E5:
2981 case Ctrl_Y25:
2982 ctrl_x_mode = CTRL_X_SCROLL2;
2983 if (!(State & REPLACE_FLAG0x40))
2984 edit_submode = (char_u *)_(" (insert) Scroll (^E/^Y)")gettext((char *)(" (insert) Scroll (^E/^Y)"));
2985 else
2986 edit_submode = (char_u *)_(" (replace) Scroll (^E/^Y)")gettext((char *)(" (replace) Scroll (^E/^Y)"));
2987 edit_submode_pre = NULL((void*)0);
2988 showmode();
2989 break;
2990 case Ctrl_L12:
2991 ctrl_x_mode = CTRL_X_WHOLE_LINE3;
2992 break;
2993 case Ctrl_F6:
2994 ctrl_x_mode = CTRL_X_FILES4;
2995 break;
2996 case Ctrl_K11:
2997 ctrl_x_mode = CTRL_X_DICTIONARY(9 + 0x100);
2998 break;
2999 case Ctrl_R18:
3000 /* Simply allow ^R to happen without affecting ^X mode */
3001 break;
3002 case Ctrl_T20:
3003 ctrl_x_mode = CTRL_X_THESAURUS(10 + 0x100);
3004 break;
3005 case Ctrl_U21:
3006 ctrl_x_mode = CTRL_X_FUNCTION12;
3007 break;
3008 case Ctrl_O15:
3009 ctrl_x_mode = CTRL_X_OMNI13;
3010 break;
3011 case 's':
3012 case Ctrl_S19:
3013 ctrl_x_mode = CTRL_X_SPELL14;
3014 ++emsg_off; /* Avoid getting the E756 error twice. */
3015 spell_back_to_badword();
3016 --emsg_off;
3017 break;
3018 case Ctrl_RSB29:
3019 ctrl_x_mode = CTRL_X_TAGS(5 + 0x100);
3020 break;
3021 case Ctrl_I9:
3022 case K_S_TAB(-(('k') + ((int)('B') << 8))):
3023 ctrl_x_mode = CTRL_X_PATH_PATTERNS(6 + 0x100);
3024 break;
3025 case Ctrl_D4:
3026 ctrl_x_mode = CTRL_X_PATH_DEFINES(7 + 0x100);
3027 break;
3028 case Ctrl_V22:
3029 case Ctrl_Q17:
3030 ctrl_x_mode = CTRL_X_CMDLINE11;
3031 break;
3032 case Ctrl_P16:
3033 case Ctrl_N14:
3034 /* ^X^P means LOCAL expansion if nothing interrupted (eg we
3035 * just started ^X mode, or there were enough ^X's to cancel
3036 * the previous mode, say ^X^F^X^X^P or ^P^X^X^X^P, see below)
3037 * do normal expansion when interrupting a different mode (say
3038 * ^X^F^X^P or ^P^X^X^P, see below)
3039 * nothing changes if interrupting mode 0, (eg, the flag
3040 * doesn't change when going to ADDING mode -- Acevedo */
3041 if (!(compl_cont_status & CONT_INTRPT(2 + 4)))
3042 compl_cont_status |= CONT_LOCAL32;
3043 else if (compl_cont_mode != 0)
3044 compl_cont_status &= ~CONT_LOCAL32;
3045 /* FALLTHROUGH */
3046 default:
3047 /* If we have typed at least 2 ^X's... for modes != 0, we set
3048 * compl_cont_status = 0 (eg, as if we had just started ^X
3049 * mode).
3050 * For mode 0, we set "compl_cont_mode" to an impossible
3051 * value, in both cases ^X^X can be used to restart the same
3052 * mode (avoiding ADDING mode).
3053 * Undocumented feature: In a mode != 0 ^X^P and ^X^X^P start
3054 * 'complete' and local ^P expansions respectively.
3055 * In mode 0 an extra ^X is needed since ^X^P goes to ADDING
3056 * mode -- Acevedo */
3057 if (c == Ctrl_X24) {
3058 if (compl_cont_mode != 0)
3059 compl_cont_status = 0;
3060 else
3061 compl_cont_mode = CTRL_X_NOT_DEFINED_YET1;
3062 }
3063 ctrl_x_mode = 0;
3064 edit_submode = NULL((void*)0);
3065 showmode();
3066 break;
3067 }
3068 } else if (ctrl_x_mode != 0) {
3069 /* We're already in CTRL-X mode, do we stay in it? */
3070 if (!vim_is_ctrl_x_key(c)) {
3071 if (ctrl_x_mode == CTRL_X_SCROLL2)
3072 ctrl_x_mode = 0;
3073 else
3074 ctrl_x_mode = CTRL_X_FINISHED8;
3075 edit_submode = NULL((void*)0);
3076 }
3077 showmode();
3078 }
3079
3080 if (compl_started || ctrl_x_mode == CTRL_X_FINISHED8) {
3081 /* Show error message from attempted keyword completion (probably
3082 * 'Pattern not found') until another key is hit, then go back to
3083 * showing what mode we are in. */
3084 showmode();
3085 if ((ctrl_x_mode == 0 && c != Ctrl_N14 && c != Ctrl_P16 && c != Ctrl_R18
3086 && !ins_compl_pum_key(c))
3087 || ctrl_x_mode == CTRL_X_FINISHED8) {
3088 /* Get here when we have finished typing a sequence of ^N and
3089 * ^P or other completion characters in CTRL-X mode. Free up
3090 * memory that was used, and make sure we can redo the insert. */
3091 if (compl_curr_match != NULL((void*)0) || compl_leader != NULL((void*)0) || c == Ctrl_E5) {
3092 /*
3093 * If any of the original typed text has been changed, eg when
3094 * ignorecase is set, we must add back-spaces to the redo
3095 * buffer. We add as few as necessary to delete just the part
3096 * of the original text that has changed.
3097 * When using the longest match, edited the match or used
3098 * CTRL-E then don't use the current match.
3099 */
3100 if (compl_curr_match != NULL((void*)0) && compl_used_match && c != Ctrl_E5)
3101 ptr = compl_curr_match->cp_str;
3102 else
3103 ptr = NULL((void*)0);
3104 ins_compl_fixRedoBufForLeader(ptr);
3105 }
3106
3107 want_cindent = (can_cindent && cindent_on());
3108 /*
3109 * When completing whole lines: fix indent for 'cindent'.
3110 * Otherwise, break line if it's too long.
3111 */
3112 if (compl_cont_mode == CTRL_X_WHOLE_LINE3) {
3113 /* re-indent the current line */
3114 if (want_cindent) {
3115 do_c_expr_indent();
3116 want_cindent = FALSE0; /* don't do it again */
3117 }
3118 } else {
3119 int prev_col = curwin->w_cursor.col;
3120
3121 /* put the cursor on the last char, for 'tw' formatting */
3122 if (prev_col > 0)
3123 dec_cursor();
3124 if (stop_arrow() == OK1)
3125 insertchar(NUL'\000', 0, -1);
3126 if (prev_col > 0
3127 && get_cursor_line_ptr()[curwin->w_cursor.col] != NUL'\000')
3128 inc_cursor();
3129 }
3130
3131 /* If the popup menu is displayed pressing CTRL-Y means accepting
3132 * the selection without inserting anything. When
3133 * compl_enter_selects is set the Enter key does the same. */
3134 if ((c == Ctrl_Y25 || (compl_enter_selects
3135 && (c == CAR'\015' || c == K_KENTER(-(('K') + ((int)('A') << 8))) || c == NL'\012')))
3136 && pum_visible())
3137 retval = TRUE1;
3138
3139 /* CTRL-E means completion is Ended, go back to the typed text. */
3140 if (c == Ctrl_E5) {
3141 ins_compl_delete();
3142 if (compl_leader != NULL((void*)0))
3143 ins_bytes(compl_leader + ins_compl_len());
3144 else if (compl_first_match != NULL((void*)0))
3145 ins_bytes(compl_orig_text + ins_compl_len());
3146 retval = TRUE1;
3147 }
3148
3149 auto_format(FALSE0, TRUE1);
3150
3151 ins_compl_free();
3152 compl_started = FALSE0;
3153 compl_matches = 0;
3154 if (!shortmess(SHM_COMPLETIONMENU'c')) {
3155 msg_clr_cmdline(); // necessary for "noshowmode"
3156 }
3157 ctrl_x_mode = 0;
3158 compl_enter_selects = FALSE0;
3159 if (edit_submode != NULL((void*)0)) {
3160 edit_submode = NULL((void*)0);
3161 showmode();
3162 }
3163
3164 /*
3165 * Indent now if a key was typed that is in 'cinkeys'.
3166 */
3167 if (want_cindent && in_cinkeys(KEY_COMPLETE0x103, ' ', inindent(0)))
3168 do_c_expr_indent();
3169 /* Trigger the CompleteDone event to give scripts a chance to act
3170 * upon the completion. */
3171 apply_autocmds(EVENT_COMPLETEDONE, NULL((void*)0), NULL((void*)0), FALSE0, curbuf);
3172 }
3173 } else if (ctrl_x_mode == CTRL_X_LOCAL_MSG15)
3174 /* Trigger the CompleteDone event to give scripts a chance to act
3175 * upon the (possibly failed) completion. */
3176 apply_autocmds(EVENT_COMPLETEDONE, NULL((void*)0), NULL((void*)0), FALSE0, curbuf);
3177
3178 /* reset continue_* if we left expansion-mode, if we stay they'll be
3179 * (re)set properly in ins_complete() */
3180 if (!vim_is_ctrl_x_key(c)) {
3181 compl_cont_status = 0;
3182 compl_cont_mode = 0;
3183 }
3184
3185 return retval;
3186}
3187
3188/*
3189 * Fix the redo buffer for the completion leader replacing some of the typed
3190 * text. This inserts backspaces and appends the changed text.
3191 * "ptr" is the known leader text or NUL.
3192 */
3193static void ins_compl_fixRedoBufForLeader(char_u *ptr_arg)
3194{
3195 int len;
3196 char_u *p;
3197 char_u *ptr = ptr_arg;
3198
3199 if (ptr == NULL((void*)0)) {
3200 if (compl_leader != NULL((void*)0))
3201 ptr = compl_leader;
3202 else
3203 return; /* nothing to do */
3204 }
3205 if (compl_orig_text != NULL((void*)0)) {
3206 p = compl_orig_text;
3207 for (len = 0; p[len] != NUL'\000' && p[len] == ptr[len]; ++len)
3208 ;
3209 if (len > 0)
3210 len -= (*mb_head_off)(p, p + len);
3211 for (p += len; *p != NUL'\000'; mb_ptr_adv(p)p += has_mbyte ? (*mb_ptr2len)(p) : 1)
3212 AppendCharToRedobuff(K_BS(-(('k') + ((int)('b') << 8))));
3213 } else
3214 len = 0;
3215 if (ptr != NULL((void*)0))
3216 AppendToRedobuffLit(ptr + len, -1);
3217}
3218
3219/*
3220 * Loops through the list of windows, loaded-buffers or non-loaded-buffers
3221 * (depending on flag) starting from buf and looking for a non-scanned
3222 * buffer (other than curbuf). curbuf is special, if it is called with
3223 * buf=curbuf then it has to be the first call for a given flag/expansion.
3224 *
3225 * Returns the buffer to scan, if any, otherwise returns curbuf -- Acevedo
3226 */
3227static buf_T *ins_compl_next_buf(buf_T *buf, int flag)
3228{
3229 static win_T *wp;
1
'wp' initialized to a null pointer value
→
3230
3231 if (flag == 'w') { /* just windows */
2
←
Taking true branch
→
3232 if (buf == curbuf) /* first call for this flag/expansion */
3
←
Assuming 'buf' is not equal to 'curbuf'
→
4
←
Taking false branch
→
3233 wp = curwin;
3234 while ((wp = (wp->w_next != NULL((void*)0) ? wp->w_next : firstwin)) != curwin
5
←
Access to field 'w_next' results in a dereference of a null pointer (loaded from variable 'wp')
3235 && wp->w_buffer->b_scanned)
3236 ;
3237 buf = wp->w_buffer;
3238 } else
3239 /* 'b' (just loaded buffers), 'u' (just non-loaded buffers) or 'U'
3240 * (unlisted buffers)
3241 * When completing whole lines skip unloaded buffers. */
3242 while ((buf = (buf->b_next != NULL((void*)0) ? buf->b_next : firstbuf)) != curbuf
3243 && ((flag == 'U'
3244 ? buf->b_p_bl
3245 : (!buf->b_p_bl
3246 || (buf->b_ml.ml_mfp == NULL((void*)0)) != (flag == 'u')))
3247 || buf->b_scanned))
3248 ;
3249 return buf;
3250}
3251
3252
3253/*
3254 * Execute user defined complete function 'completefunc' or 'omnifunc', and
3255 * get matches in "matches".
3256 */
3257static void
3258expand_by_function (
3259 int type, /* CTRL_X_OMNI or CTRL_X_FUNCTION */
3260 char_u *base
3261)
3262{
3263 list_T *matchlist = NULL((void*)0);
3264 dict_T *matchdict = NULL((void*)0);
3265 char_u *args[2];
3266 char_u *funcname;
3267 pos_T pos;
3268 win_T *curwin_save;
3269 buf_T *curbuf_save;
3270 typval_T rettv;
3271
3272 funcname = (type == CTRL_X_FUNCTION12) ? curbuf->b_p_cfu : curbuf->b_p_ofu;
3273 if (*funcname == NUL'\000')
3274 return;
3275
3276 /* Call 'completefunc' to obtain the list of matches. */
3277 args[0] = (char_u *)"0";
3278 args[1] = base;
3279
3280 pos = curwin->w_cursor;
3281 curwin_save = curwin;
3282 curbuf_save = curbuf;
3283
3284 /* Call a function, which returns a list or dict. */
3285 if (call_vim_function(funcname, 2, args, FALSE0, FALSE0, &rettv) == OK1) {
3286 switch (rettv.v_type) {
3287 case VAR_LIST4:
3288 matchlist = rettv.vval.v_list;
3289 break;
3290 case VAR_DICT5:
3291 matchdict = rettv.vval.v_dict;
3292 break;
3293 default:
3294 /* TODO: Give error message? */
3295 clear_tv(&rettv);
3296 break;
3297 }
3298 }
3299
3300 if (curwin_save != curwin || curbuf_save != curbuf) {
3301 EMSG(_(e_complwin))emsg((char_u *)(gettext((char *)(e_complwin))));
3302 goto theend;
3303 }
3304 curwin->w_cursor = pos; /* restore the cursor position */
3305 check_cursor();
3306 if (!equalpos(curwin->w_cursor, pos)(((curwin->w_cursor).lnum == (pos).lnum) && ((curwin
->w_cursor).col == (pos).col) && ((curwin->w_cursor
).coladd == (pos).coladd))) {
3307 EMSG(_(e_compldel))emsg((char_u *)(gettext((char *)(e_compldel))));
3308 goto theend;
3309 }
3310
3311 if (matchlist != NULL((void*)0))
3312 ins_compl_add_list(matchlist);
3313 else if (matchdict != NULL((void*)0))
3314 ins_compl_add_dict(matchdict);
3315
3316theend:
3317 if (matchdict != NULL((void*)0))
3318 dict_unref(matchdict);
3319 if (matchlist != NULL((void*)0))
3320 list_unref(matchlist);
3321}
3322
3323/*
3324 * Add completions from a list.
3325 */
3326static void ins_compl_add_list(list_T *list)
3327{
3328 listitem_T *li;
3329 int dir = compl_direction;
3330
3331 /* Go through the List with matches and add each of them. */
3332 for (li = list->lv_first; li != NULL((void*)0); li = li->li_next) {
3333 if (ins_compl_add_tv(&li->li_tv, dir) == OK1)
3334 /* if dir was BACKWARD then honor it just once */
3335 dir = FORWARD1;
3336 else if (did_emsg)
3337 break;
3338 }
3339}
3340
3341/*
3342 * Add completions from a dict.
3343 */
3344static void ins_compl_add_dict(dict_T *dict)
3345{
3346 dictitem_T *di_refresh;
3347 dictitem_T *di_words;
3348
3349 /* Check for optional "refresh" item. */
3350 compl_opt_refresh_always = FALSE0;
3351 di_refresh = dict_find(dict, (char_u *)"refresh", 7);
3352 if (di_refresh != NULL((void*)0) && di_refresh->di_tv.v_type == VAR_STRING2) {
3353 char_u *v = di_refresh->di_tv.vval.v_string;
3354
3355 if (v != NULL((void*)0) && STRCMP(v, (char_u *)"always")strcmp((char *)(v), (char *)((char_u *)"always")) == 0)
3356 compl_opt_refresh_always = TRUE1;
3357 }
3358
3359 /* Add completions from a "words" list. */
3360 di_words = dict_find(dict, (char_u *)"words", 5);
3361 if (di_words != NULL((void*)0) && di_words->di_tv.v_type == VAR_LIST4)
3362 ins_compl_add_list(di_words->di_tv.vval.v_list);
3363}
3364
3365/*
3366 * Add a match to the list of matches from a typeval_T.
3367 * If the given string is already in the list of completions, then return
3368 * NOTDONE, otherwise add it to the list and return OK. If there is an error
3369 * then FAIL is returned.
3370 */
3371int ins_compl_add_tv(typval_T *tv, int dir)
3372{
3373 char_u *word;
3374 int icase = FALSE0;
3375 int adup = FALSE0;
3376 int aempty = FALSE0;
3377 char_u *(cptext[CPT_COUNT4]);
3378
3379 if (tv->v_type == VAR_DICT5 && tv->vval.v_dict != NULL((void*)0)) {
3380 word = get_dict_string(tv->vval.v_dict, (char_u *)"word", FALSE0);
3381 cptext[CPT_ABBR0] = get_dict_string(tv->vval.v_dict,
3382 (char_u *)"abbr", FALSE0);
3383 cptext[CPT_MENU1] = get_dict_string(tv->vval.v_dict,
3384 (char_u *)"menu", FALSE0);
3385 cptext[CPT_KIND2] = get_dict_string(tv->vval.v_dict,
3386 (char_u *)"kind", FALSE0);
3387 cptext[CPT_INFO3] = get_dict_string(tv->vval.v_dict,
3388 (char_u *)"info", FALSE0);
3389 if (get_dict_string(tv->vval.v_dict, (char_u *)"icase", FALSE0) != NULL((void*)0))
3390 icase = get_dict_number(tv->vval.v_dict, (char_u *)"icase");
3391 if (get_dict_string(tv->vval.v_dict, (char_u *)"dup", FALSE0) != NULL((void*)0))
3392 adup = get_dict_number(tv->vval.v_dict, (char_u *)"dup");
3393 if (get_dict_string(tv->vval.v_dict, (char_u *)"empty", FALSE0) != NULL((void*)0))
3394 aempty = get_dict_number(tv->vval.v_dict, (char_u *)"empty");
3395 } else {
3396 word = get_tv_string_chk(tv);
3397 memset(cptext, 0, sizeof(cptext));
3398 }
3399 if (word == NULL((void*)0) || (!aempty && *word == NUL'\000'))
3400 return FAIL0;
3401 return ins_compl_add(word, -1, icase, NULL((void*)0), cptext, dir, 0, adup);
3402}
3403
3404/*
3405 * Get the next expansion(s), using "compl_pattern".
3406 * The search starts at position "ini" in curbuf and in the direction
3407 * compl_direction.
3408 * When "compl_started" is FALSE start at that position, otherwise continue
3409 * where we stopped searching before.
3410 * This may return before finding all the matches.
3411 * Return the total number of matches or -1 if still unknown -- Acevedo
3412 */
3413static int ins_compl_get_exp(pos_T *ini)
3414{
3415 static pos_T first_match_pos;
3416 static pos_T last_match_pos;
3417 static char_u *e_cpt = (char_u *)""; /* curr. entry in 'complete' */
3418 static int found_all = FALSE0; /* Found all matches of a
3419 certain type. */
3420 static buf_T *ins_buf = NULL((void*)0); /* buffer being scanned */
3421
3422 pos_T *pos;
3423 char_u **matches;
3424 int save_p_scs;
3425 bool_Bool save_p_ws;
3426 int save_p_ic;
3427 int i;
3428 int num_matches;
3429 int len;
3430 int found_new_match;
3431 int type = ctrl_x_mode;
3432 char_u *ptr;
3433 char_u *dict = NULL((void*)0);
3434 int dict_f = 0;
3435 compl_T *old_match;
3436 int set_match_pos;
3437
3438 if (!compl_started) {
3439 FOR_ALL_BUFFERS(buf)for (buf_T *buf = firstbuf; buf != ((void*)0); buf = buf->
b_next) {
3440 buf->b_scanned = 0;
3441 }
3442 found_all = FALSE0;
3443 ins_buf = curbuf;
3444 e_cpt = (compl_cont_status & CONT_LOCAL32)
3445 ? (char_u *)"." : curbuf->b_p_cpt;
3446 last_match_pos = first_match_pos = *ini;
3447 }
3448
3449 old_match = compl_curr_match; /* remember the last current match */
3450 pos = (compl_direction == FORWARD1) ? &last_match_pos : &first_match_pos;
3451 /* For ^N/^P loop over all the flags/windows/buffers in 'complete' */
3452 for (;; ) {
3453 found_new_match = FAIL0;
3454 set_match_pos = FALSE0;
3455
3456 /* For ^N/^P pick a new entry from e_cpt if compl_started is off,
3457 * or if found_all says this entry is done. For ^X^L only use the
3458 * entries from 'complete' that look in loaded buffers. */
3459 if ((ctrl_x_mode == 0 || ctrl_x_mode == CTRL_X_WHOLE_LINE3)
3460 && (!compl_started || found_all)) {
3461 found_all = FALSE0;
3462 while (*e_cpt == ',' || *e_cpt == ' ')
3463 e_cpt++;
3464 if (*e_cpt == '.' && !curbuf->b_scanned) {
3465 ins_buf = curbuf;
3466 first_match_pos = *ini;
3467 /* So that ^N can match word immediately after cursor */
3468 if (ctrl_x_mode == 0)
3469 dec(&first_match_pos);
3470 last_match_pos = first_match_pos;
3471 type = 0;
3472
3473 /* Remember the first match so that the loop stops when we
3474 * wrap and come back there a second time. */
3475 set_match_pos = TRUE1;
3476 } else if (vim_strchr((char_u *)"buwU", *e_cpt) != NULL((void*)0)
3477 && (ins_buf =
3478 ins_compl_next_buf(ins_buf, *e_cpt)) != curbuf) {
3479 /* Scan a buffer, but not the current one. */
3480 if (ins_buf->b_ml.ml_mfp != NULL((void*)0)) { /* loaded buffer */
3481 compl_started = TRUE1;
3482 first_match_pos.col = last_match_pos.col = 0;
3483 first_match_pos.lnum = ins_buf->b_ml.ml_line_count + 1;
3484 last_match_pos.lnum = 0;
3485 type = 0;
3486 } else { /* unloaded buffer, scan like dictionary */
3487 found_all = TRUE1;
3488 if (ins_buf->b_fname == NULL((void*)0))
3489 continue;
3490 type = CTRL_X_DICTIONARY(9 + 0x100);
3491 dict = ins_buf->b_fname;
3492 dict_f = DICT_EXACT(2);
3493 }
3494 vim_snprintf((char *)IObuff, IOSIZE(1024+1), _("Scanning: %s")gettext((char *)("Scanning: %s")),
3495 ins_buf->b_fname == NULL((void*)0)
3496 ? buf_spname(ins_buf)
3497 : ins_buf->b_sfname == NULL((void*)0)
3498 ? ins_buf->b_fname
3499 : ins_buf->b_sfname);
3500 (void)msg_trunc_attr(IObuff, TRUE1, hl_attr(HLF_R)highlight_attr[(int)(HLF_R)]);
3501 } else if (*e_cpt == NUL'\000')
3502 break;
3503 else {
3504 if (ctrl_x_mode == CTRL_X_WHOLE_LINE3)
3505 type = -1;
3506 else if (*e_cpt == 'k' || *e_cpt == 's') {
3507 if (*e_cpt == 'k')
3508 type = CTRL_X_DICTIONARY(9 + 0x100);
3509 else
3510 type = CTRL_X_THESAURUS(10 + 0x100);
3511 if (*++e_cpt != ',' && *e_cpt != NUL'\000') {
3512 dict = e_cpt;
3513 dict_f = DICT_FIRST(1);
3514 }
3515 } else if (*e_cpt == 'i')
3516 type = CTRL_X_PATH_PATTERNS(6 + 0x100);
3517 else if (*e_cpt == 'd')
3518 type = CTRL_X_PATH_DEFINES(7 + 0x100);
3519 else if (*e_cpt == ']' || *e_cpt == 't') {
3520 type = CTRL_X_TAGS(5 + 0x100);
3521 vim_snprintf((char *)IObuff, IOSIZE(1024+1), _("Scanning tags.")gettext((char *)("Scanning tags.")));
3522 (void)msg_trunc_attr(IObuff, TRUE1, hl_attr(HLF_R)highlight_attr[(int)(HLF_R)]);
3523 } else
3524 type = -1;
3525
3526 /* in any case e_cpt is advanced to the next entry */
3527 (void)copy_option_part(&e_cpt, IObuff, IOSIZE(1024+1), ",");
3528
3529 found_all = TRUE1;
3530 if (type == -1)
3531 continue;
3532 }
3533 }
3534
3535 switch (type) {
3536 case -1:
3537 break;
3538 case CTRL_X_PATH_PATTERNS(6 + 0x100):
3539 case CTRL_X_PATH_DEFINES(7 + 0x100):
3540 find_pattern_in_path(compl_pattern, compl_direction,
3541 (int)STRLEN(compl_pattern)strlen((char *)(compl_pattern)), FALSE0, FALSE0,
3542 (type == CTRL_X_PATH_DEFINES(7 + 0x100)
3543 && !(compl_cont_status & CONT_SOL16))
3544 ? FIND_DEFINE2 : FIND_ANY1, 1L, ACTION_EXPAND5,
3545 (linenr_T)1, (linenr_T)MAXLNUM(0x7fffffffL));
3546 break;
3547
3548 case CTRL_X_DICTIONARY(9 + 0x100):
3549 case CTRL_X_THESAURUS(10 + 0x100):
3550 ins_compl_dictionaries(
3551 dict != NULL((void*)0) ? dict
3552 : (type == CTRL_X_THESAURUS(10 + 0x100)
3553 ? (*curbuf->b_p_tsr == NUL'\000'
3554 ? p_tsr
3555 : curbuf->b_p_tsr)
3556 : (*curbuf->b_p_dict == NUL'\000'
3557 ? p_dict
3558 : curbuf->b_p_dict)),
3559 compl_pattern,
3560 dict != NULL((void*)0) ? dict_f
3561 : 0, type == CTRL_X_THESAURUS(10 + 0x100));
3562 dict = NULL((void*)0);
3563 break;
3564
3565 case CTRL_X_TAGS(5 + 0x100):
3566 /* set p_ic according to p_ic, p_scs and pat for find_tags(). */
3567 save_p_ic = p_ic;
3568 p_ic = ignorecase(compl_pattern);
3569
3570 /* Find up to TAG_MANY matches. Avoids that an enormous number
3571 * of matches is found when compl_pattern is empty */
3572 if (find_tags(compl_pattern, &num_matches, &matches,
3573 TAG_REGEXP4 | TAG_NAMES2 | TAG_NOIC8 |
3574 TAG_INS_COMP64 | (ctrl_x_mode ? TAG_VERBOSE32 : 0),
3575 TAG_MANY300, curbuf->b_ffname) == OK1 && num_matches > 0) {
3576 ins_compl_add_matches(num_matches, matches, p_ic);
3577 }
3578 p_ic = save_p_ic;
3579 break;
3580
3581 case CTRL_X_FILES4:
3582 if (expand_wildcards(1, &compl_pattern, &num_matches, &matches,
3583 EW_FILE0x02|EW_DIR0x01|EW_ADDSLASH0x08|EW_SILENT0x20) == OK1) {
3584
3585 /* May change home directory back to "~". */
3586 tilde_replace(compl_pattern, num_matches, matches);
3587 ins_compl_add_matches(num_matches, matches, p_fic || p_wic);
3588 }
3589 break;
3590
3591 case CTRL_X_CMDLINE11:
3592 if (expand_cmdline(&compl_xp, compl_pattern,
3593 (int)STRLEN(compl_pattern)strlen((char *)(compl_pattern)),
3594 &num_matches, &matches) == EXPAND_OK)
3595 ins_compl_add_matches(num_matches, matches, FALSE0);
3596 break;
3597
3598 case CTRL_X_FUNCTION12:
3599 case CTRL_X_OMNI13:
3600 expand_by_function(type, compl_pattern);
3601 break;
3602
3603 case CTRL_X_SPELL14:
3604 num_matches = expand_spelling(first_match_pos.lnum,
3605 compl_pattern, &matches);
3606 if (num_matches > 0)
3607 ins_compl_add_matches(num_matches, matches, p_ic);
3608 break;
3609
3610 default: /* normal ^P/^N and ^X^L */
3611 /*
3612 * If 'infercase' is set, don't use 'smartcase' here
3613 */
3614 save_p_scs = p_scs;
3615 if (ins_buf->b_p_inf)
3616 p_scs = FALSE0;
3617
3618 /* Buffers other than curbuf are scanned from the beginning or the
3619 * end but never from the middle, thus setting nowrapscan in this
3620 * buffers is a good idea, on the other hand, we always set
3621 * wrapscan for curbuf to avoid missing matches -- Acevedo,Webb */
3622 save_p_ws = p_ws;
3623 if (ins_buf != curbuf)
3624 p_ws = false0;
3625 else if (*e_cpt == '.')
3626 p_ws = true1;
3627 for (;; ) {
3628 int flags = 0;
3629
3630 ++msg_silent; /* Don't want messages for wrapscan. */
3631
3632 /* ctrl_x_mode == CTRL_X_WHOLE_LINE || word-wise search that
3633 * has added a word that was at the beginning of the line */
3634 if ( ctrl_x_mode == CTRL_X_WHOLE_LINE3
3635 || (compl_cont_status & CONT_SOL16))
3636 found_new_match = search_for_exact_line(ins_buf, pos,
3637 compl_direction, compl_pattern);
3638 else
3639 found_new_match = searchit(NULL((void*)0), ins_buf, pos,
3640 compl_direction,
3641 compl_pattern, 1L, SEARCH_KEEP0x400 + SEARCH_NFMSG0x08,
3642 RE_LAST2, (linenr_T)0, NULL((void*)0));
3643 --msg_silent;
3644 if (!compl_started || set_match_pos) {
3645 /* set "compl_started" even on fail */
3646 compl_started = TRUE1;
3647 first_match_pos = *pos;
3648 last_match_pos = *pos;
3649 set_match_pos = FALSE0;
3650 } else if (first_match_pos.lnum == last_match_pos.lnum
3651 && first_match_pos.col == last_match_pos.col)
3652 found_new_match = FAIL0;
3653 if (found_new_match == FAIL0) {
3654 if (ins_buf == curbuf)
3655 found_all = TRUE1;
3656 break;
3657 }
3658
3659 /* when ADDING, the text before the cursor matches, skip it */
3660 if ( (compl_cont_status & CONT_ADDING1) && ins_buf == curbuf
3661 && ini->lnum == pos->lnum
3662 && ini->col == pos->col)
3663 continue;
3664 ptr = ml_get_buf(ins_buf, pos->lnum, FALSE0) + pos->col;
3665 if (ctrl_x_mode == CTRL_X_WHOLE_LINE3) {
3666 if (compl_cont_status & CONT_ADDING1) {
3667 if (pos->lnum >= ins_buf->b_ml.ml_line_count)
3668 continue;
3669 ptr = ml_get_buf(ins_buf, pos->lnum + 1, FALSE0);
3670 if (!p_paste)
3671 ptr = skipwhite(ptr);
3672 }
3673 len = (int)STRLEN(ptr)strlen((char *)(ptr));
3674 } else {
3675 char_u *tmp_ptr = ptr;
3676
3677 if (compl_cont_status & CONT_ADDING1) {
3678 tmp_ptr += compl_length;
3679 /* Skip if already inside a word. */
3680 if (vim_iswordp(tmp_ptr))
3681 continue;
3682 /* Find start of next word. */
3683 tmp_ptr = find_word_start(tmp_ptr);
3684 }
3685 /* Find end of this word. */
3686 tmp_ptr = find_word_end(tmp_ptr);
3687 len = (int)(tmp_ptr - ptr);
3688
3689 if ((compl_cont_status & CONT_ADDING1)
3690 && len == compl_length) {
3691 if (pos->lnum < ins_buf->b_ml.ml_line_count) {
3692 /* Try next line, if any. the new word will be
3693 * "join" as if the normal command "J" was used.
3694 * IOSIZE is always greater than
3695 * compl_length, so the next STRNCPY always
3696 * works -- Acevedo */
3697 STRNCPY(IObuff, ptr, len)strncpy((char *)(IObuff), (char *)(ptr), (size_t)(len));
3698 ptr = ml_get_buf(ins_buf, pos->lnum + 1, FALSE0);
3699 tmp_ptr = ptr = skipwhite(ptr);
3700 /* Find start of next word. */
3701 tmp_ptr = find_word_start(tmp_ptr);
3702 /* Find end of next word. */
3703 tmp_ptr = find_word_end(tmp_ptr);
3704 if (tmp_ptr > ptr) {
3705 if (*ptr != ')' && IObuff[len - 1] != TAB'\011') {
3706 if (IObuff[len - 1] != ' ')
3707 IObuff[len++] = ' ';
3708 /* IObuf =~ "\k.* ", thus len >= 2 */
3709 if (p_js
3710 && (IObuff[len - 2] == '.'
3711 || (vim_strchr(p_cpo, CPO_JOINSP'j')
3712 == NULL((void*)0)
3713 && (IObuff[len - 2] == '?'
3714 || IObuff[len - 2] == '!'))))
3715 IObuff[len++] = ' ';
3716 }
3717 /* copy as much as possible of the new word */
3718 if (tmp_ptr - ptr >= IOSIZE(1024+1) - len)
3719 tmp_ptr = ptr + IOSIZE(1024+1) - len - 1;
3720 STRNCPY(IObuff + len, ptr, tmp_ptr - ptr)strncpy((char *)(IObuff + len), (char *)(ptr), (size_t)(tmp_ptr
- ptr));
3721 len += (int)(tmp_ptr - ptr);
3722 flags |= CONT_S_IPOS8;
3723 }
3724 IObuff[len] = NUL'\000';
3725 ptr = IObuff;
3726 }
3727 if (len == compl_length)
3728 continue;
3729 }
3730 }
3731 if (ins_compl_add_infercase(ptr, len, p_ic,
3732 ins_buf == curbuf ? NULL((void*)0) : ins_buf->b_sfname,
3733 0, flags) != NOTDONE2) {
3734 found_new_match = OK1;
3735 break;
3736 }
3737 }
3738 p_scs = save_p_scs;
3739 p_ws = save_p_ws;
3740 }
3741
3742 /* check if compl_curr_match has changed, (e.g. other type of
3743 * expansion added something) */
3744 if (type != 0 && compl_curr_match != old_match)
3745 found_new_match = OK1;
3746
3747 /* break the loop for specialized modes (use 'complete' just for the
3748 * generic ctrl_x_mode == 0) or when we've found a new match */
3749 if ((ctrl_x_mode != 0 && ctrl_x_mode != CTRL_X_WHOLE_LINE3)
3750 || found_new_match != FAIL0) {
3751 if (got_int)
3752 break;
3753 /* Fill the popup menu as soon as possible. */
3754 if (type != -1)
3755 ins_compl_check_keys(0);
3756
3757 if ((ctrl_x_mode != 0 && ctrl_x_mode != CTRL_X_WHOLE_LINE3)
3758 || compl_interrupted)
3759 break;
3760 compl_started = TRUE1;
3761 } else {
3762 /* Mark a buffer scanned when it has been scanned completely */
3763 if (type == 0 || type == CTRL_X_PATH_PATTERNS(6 + 0x100))
3764 ins_buf->b_scanned = TRUE1;
3765
3766 compl_started = FALSE0;
3767 }
3768 }
3769 compl_started = TRUE1;
3770
3771 if ((ctrl_x_mode == 0 || ctrl_x_mode == CTRL_X_WHOLE_LINE3)
3772 && *e_cpt == NUL'\000') /* Got to end of 'complete' */
3773 found_new_match = FAIL0;
3774
3775 i = -1; /* total of matches, unknown */
3776 if (found_new_match == FAIL0
3777 || (ctrl_x_mode != 0 && ctrl_x_mode != CTRL_X_WHOLE_LINE3))
3778 i = ins_compl_make_cyclic();
3779
3780 /* If several matches were added (FORWARD) or the search failed and has
3781 * just been made cyclic then we have to move compl_curr_match to the next
3782 * or previous entry (if any) -- Acevedo */
3783 compl_curr_match = compl_direction == FORWARD1 ? old_match->cp_next
3784 : old_match->cp_prev;
3785 if (compl_curr_match == NULL((void*)0))
3786 compl_curr_match = old_match;
3787 return i;
3788}
3789
3790/* Delete the old text being completed. */
3791static void ins_compl_delete(void)
3792{
3793 int i;
3794
3795 /*
3796 * In insert mode: Delete the typed part.
3797 * In replace mode: Put the old characters back, if any.
3798 */
3799 i = compl_col + (compl_cont_status & CONT_ADDING1 ? compl_length : 0);
3800 backspace_until_column(i);
3801 // TODO: is this sufficient for redrawing? Redrawing everything causes
3802 // flicker, thus we can't do that.
3803 changed_cline_bef_curs();
3804}
3805
3806/* Insert the new text being completed. */
3807static void ins_compl_insert(void)
3808{
3809 ins_bytes(compl_shown_match->cp_str + ins_compl_len());
3810 if (compl_shown_match->cp_flags & ORIGINAL_TEXT(1))
3811 compl_used_match = FALSE0;
3812 else
3813 compl_used_match = TRUE1;
3814}
3815
3816/*
3817 * Fill in the next completion in the current direction.
3818 * If "allow_get_expansion" is TRUE, then we may call ins_compl_get_exp() to
3819 * get more completions. If it is FALSE, then we just do nothing when there
3820 * are no more completions in a given direction. The latter case is used when
3821 * we are still in the middle of finding completions, to allow browsing
3822 * through the ones found so far.
3823 * Return the total number of matches, or -1 if still unknown -- webb.
3824 *
3825 * compl_curr_match is currently being used by ins_compl_get_exp(), so we use
3826 * compl_shown_match here.
3827 *
3828 * Note that this function may be called recursively once only. First with
3829 * "allow_get_expansion" TRUE, which calls ins_compl_get_exp(), which in turn
3830 * calls this function with "allow_get_expansion" FALSE.
3831 */
3832static int
3833ins_compl_next (
3834 int allow_get_expansion,
3835 int count, /* repeat completion this many times; should
3836 be at least 1 */
3837 int insert_match /* Insert the newly selected match */
3838)
3839{
3840 int num_matches = -1;
3841 int i;
3842 int todo = count;
3843 compl_T *found_compl = NULL((void*)0);
3844 int found_end = FALSE0;
3845 int advance;
3846
3847 /* When user complete function return -1 for findstart which is next
3848 * time of 'always', compl_shown_match become NULL. */
3849 if (compl_shown_match == NULL((void*)0))
3850 return -1;
3851
3852 if (compl_leader != NULL((void*)0)
3853 && (compl_shown_match->cp_flags & ORIGINAL_TEXT(1)) == 0) {
3854 /* Set "compl_shown_match" to the actually shown match, it may differ
3855 * when "compl_leader" is used to omit some of the matches. */
3856 while (!ins_compl_equal(compl_shown_match,
3857 compl_leader, (int)STRLEN(compl_leader)strlen((char *)(compl_leader)))
3858 && compl_shown_match->cp_next != NULL((void*)0)
3859 && compl_shown_match->cp_next != compl_first_match)
3860 compl_shown_match = compl_shown_match->cp_next;
3861
3862 /* If we didn't find it searching forward, and compl_shows_dir is
3863 * backward, find the last match. */
3864 if (compl_shows_dir == BACKWARD(-1)
3865 && !ins_compl_equal(compl_shown_match,
3866 compl_leader, (int)STRLEN(compl_leader)strlen((char *)(compl_leader)))
3867 && (compl_shown_match->cp_next == NULL((void*)0)
3868 || compl_shown_match->cp_next == compl_first_match)) {
3869 while (!ins_compl_equal(compl_shown_match,
3870 compl_leader, (int)STRLEN(compl_leader)strlen((char *)(compl_leader)))
3871 && compl_shown_match->cp_prev != NULL((void*)0)
3872 && compl_shown_match->cp_prev != compl_first_match)
3873 compl_shown_match = compl_shown_match->cp_prev;
3874 }
3875 }
3876
3877 if (allow_get_expansion && insert_match
3878 && (!(compl_get_longest || compl_restarting) || compl_used_match))
3879 /* Delete old text to be replaced */
3880 ins_compl_delete();
3881
3882 /* When finding the longest common text we stick at the original text,
3883 * don't let CTRL-N or CTRL-P move to the first match. */
3884 advance = count != 1 || !allow_get_expansion || !compl_get_longest;
3885
3886 /* When restarting the search don't insert the first match either. */
3887 if (compl_restarting) {
3888 advance = FALSE0;
3889 compl_restarting = FALSE0;
3890 }
3891
3892 /* Repeat this for when <PageUp> or <PageDown> is typed. But don't wrap
3893 * around. */
3894 while (--todo >= 0) {
3895 if (compl_shows_dir == FORWARD1 && compl_shown_match->cp_next != NULL((void*)0)) {
3896 compl_shown_match = compl_shown_match->cp_next;
3897 found_end = (compl_first_match != NULL((void*)0)
3898 && (compl_shown_match->cp_next == compl_first_match
3899 || compl_shown_match == compl_first_match));
3900 } else if (compl_shows_dir == BACKWARD(-1)
3901 && compl_shown_match->cp_prev != NULL((void*)0)) {
3902 found_end = (compl_shown_match == compl_first_match);
3903 compl_shown_match = compl_shown_match->cp_prev;
3904 found_end |= (compl_shown_match == compl_first_match);
3905 } else {
3906 if (!allow_get_expansion) {
3907 if (advance) {
3908 if (compl_shows_dir == BACKWARD(-1))
3909 compl_pending -= todo + 1;
3910 else
3911 compl_pending += todo + 1;
3912 }
3913 return -1;
3914 }
3915
3916 if (advance) {
3917 if (compl_shows_dir == BACKWARD(-1))
3918 --compl_pending;
3919 else
3920 ++compl_pending;
3921 }
3922
3923 /* Find matches. */
3924 num_matches = ins_compl_get_exp(&compl_startpos);
3925
3926 /* handle any pending completions */
3927 while (compl_pending != 0 && compl_direction == compl_shows_dir
3928 && advance) {
3929 if (compl_pending > 0 && compl_shown_match->cp_next != NULL((void*)0)) {
3930 compl_shown_match = compl_shown_match->cp_next;
3931 --compl_pending;
3932 }
3933 if (compl_pending < 0 && compl_shown_match->cp_prev != NULL((void*)0)) {
3934 compl_shown_match = compl_shown_match->cp_prev;
3935 ++compl_pending;
3936 } else
3937 break;
3938 }
3939 found_end = FALSE0;
3940 }
3941 if ((compl_shown_match->cp_flags & ORIGINAL_TEXT(1)) == 0
3942 && compl_leader != NULL((void*)0)
3943 && !ins_compl_equal(compl_shown_match,
3944 compl_leader, (int)STRLEN(compl_leader)strlen((char *)(compl_leader))))
3945 ++todo;
3946 else
3947 /* Remember a matching item. */
3948 found_compl = compl_shown_match;
3949
3950 /* Stop at the end of the list when we found a usable match. */
3951 if (found_end) {
3952 if (found_compl != NULL((void*)0)) {
3953 compl_shown_match = found_compl;
3954 break;
3955 }
3956 todo = 1; /* use first usable match after wrapping around */
3957 }
3958 }
3959
3960 /* Insert the text of the new completion, or the compl_leader. */
3961 if (insert_match) {
3962 if (!compl_get_longest || compl_used_match)
3963 ins_compl_insert();
3964 else
3965 ins_bytes(compl_leader + ins_compl_len());
3966 } else
3967 compl_used_match = FALSE0;
3968
3969 if (!allow_get_expansion) {
3970 /* may undisplay the popup menu first */
3971 ins_compl_upd_pum();
3972
3973 /* redraw to show the user what was inserted */
3974 update_screen(0);
3975
3976 /* display the updated popup menu */
3977 ins_compl_show_pum();
3978
3979 /* Delete old text to be replaced, since we're still searching and
3980 * don't want to match ourselves! */
3981 ins_compl_delete();
3982 }
3983
3984 /* Enter will select a match when the match wasn't inserted and the popup
3985 * menu is visible. */
3986 compl_enter_selects = !insert_match && compl_match_array != NULL((void*)0);
3987
3988 /*
3989 * Show the file name for the match (if any)
3990 * Truncate the file name to avoid a wait for return.
3991 */
3992 if (compl_shown_match->cp_fname != NULL((void*)0)) {
3993 STRCPY(IObuff, "match in file ")strcpy((char *)(IObuff), (char *)("match in file "));
3994 i = (vim_strsize(compl_shown_match->cp_fname) + 16) - sc_col;
3995 if (i <= 0)
3996 i = 0;
3997 else
3998 STRCAT(IObuff, "<")strcat((char *)(IObuff), (char *)("<"));
3999 STRCAT(IObuff, compl_shown_match->cp_fname + i)strcat((char *)(IObuff), (char *)(compl_shown_match->cp_fname
+ i));
4000 msg(IObuff);
4001 redraw_cmdline = FALSE0; /* don't overwrite! */
4002 }
4003
4004 return num_matches;
4005}
4006
4007/*
4008 * Call this while finding completions, to check whether the user has hit a key
4009 * that should change the currently displayed completion, or exit completion
4010 * mode. Also, when compl_pending is not zero, show a completion as soon as
4011 * possible. -- webb
4012 * "frequency" specifies out of how many calls we actually check.
4013 */
4014void ins_compl_check_keys(int frequency)
4015{
4016 static int count = 0;
4017
4018 int c;
4019
4020 /* Don't check when reading keys from a script. That would break the test
4021 * scripts */
4022 if (using_script())
4023 return;
4024
4025 /* Only do this at regular intervals */
4026 if (++count < frequency)
4027 return;
4028 count = 0;
4029
4030 /* Check for a typed key. Do use mappings, otherwise vim_is_ctrl_x_key()
4031 * can't do its work correctly. */
4032 c = vpeekc_any();
4033 if (c != NUL'\000') {
4034 if (vim_is_ctrl_x_key(c) && c != Ctrl_X24 && c != Ctrl_R18) {
4035 c = safe_vgetc(); /* Eat the character */
4036 compl_shows_dir = ins_compl_key2dir(c);
4037 (void)ins_compl_next(FALSE0, ins_compl_key2count(c),
4038 c != K_UP(-(('k') + ((int)('u') << 8))) && c != K_DOWN(-(('k') + ((int)('d') << 8))));
4039 } else {
4040 /* Need to get the character to have KeyTyped set. We'll put it
4041 * back with vungetc() below. But skip K_IGNORE. */
4042 c = safe_vgetc();
4043 if (c != K_IGNORE(-((253) + ((int)(KE_IGNORE) << 8)))) {
4044 /* Don't interrupt completion when the character wasn't typed,
4045 * e.g., when doing @q to replay keys. */
4046 if (c != Ctrl_R18 && KeyTyped)
4047 compl_interrupted = TRUE1;
4048
4049 vungetc(c);
4050 }
4051 }
4052 }
4053 if (compl_pending != 0 && !got_int) {
4054 int todo = compl_pending > 0 ? compl_pending : -compl_pending;
4055
4056 compl_pending = 0;
4057 (void)ins_compl_next(FALSE0, todo, TRUE1);
4058 }
4059}
4060
4061/*
4062 * Decide the direction of Insert mode complete from the key typed.
4063 * Returns BACKWARD or FORWARD.
4064 */
4065static int ins_compl_key2dir(int c)
4066{
4067 if (c == Ctrl_P16 || c == Ctrl_L12
4068 || (pum_visible() && (c == K_PAGEUP(-(('k') + ((int)('P') << 8))) || c == K_KPAGEUP(-(('K') + ((int)('3') << 8)))
4069 || c == K_S_UP(-((253) + ((int)(KE_S_UP) << 8))) || c == K_UP(-(('k') + ((int)('u') << 8))))))
4070 return BACKWARD(-1);
4071 return FORWARD1;
4072}
4073
4074/*
4075 * Return TRUE for keys that are used for completion only when the popup menu
4076 * is visible.
4077 */
4078static int ins_compl_pum_key(int c)
4079{
4080 return pum_visible() && (c == K_PAGEUP(-(('k') + ((int)('P') << 8))) || c == K_KPAGEUP(-(('K') + ((int)('3') << 8))) || c == K_S_UP(-((253) + ((int)(KE_S_UP) << 8)))
4081 || c == K_PAGEDOWN(-(('k') + ((int)('N') << 8))) || c == K_KPAGEDOWN(-(('K') + ((int)('5') << 8))) || c ==
4082 K_S_DOWN(-((253) + ((int)(KE_S_DOWN) << 8)))
4083 || c == K_UP(-(('k') + ((int)('u') << 8))) || c == K_DOWN(-(('k') + ((int)('d') << 8))));
4084}
4085
4086/*
4087 * Decide the number of completions to move forward.
4088 * Returns 1 for most keys, height of the popup menu for page-up/down keys.
4089 */
4090static int ins_compl_key2count(int c)
4091{
4092 int h;
4093
4094 if (ins_compl_pum_key(c) && c != K_UP(-(('k') + ((int)('u') << 8))) && c != K_DOWN(-(('k') + ((int)('d') << 8)))) {
4095 h = pum_get_height();
4096 if (h > 3)
4097 h -= 2; /* keep some context */
4098 return h;
4099 }
4100 return 1;
4101}
4102
4103/*
4104 * Return TRUE if completion with "c" should insert the match, FALSE if only
4105 * to change the currently selected completion.
4106 */
4107static int ins_compl_use_match(int c)
4108{
4109 switch (c) {
4110 case K_UP(-(('k') + ((int)('u') << 8))):
4111 case K_DOWN(-(('k') + ((int)('d') << 8))):
4112 case K_PAGEDOWN(-(('k') + ((int)('N') << 8))):
4113 case K_KPAGEDOWN(-(('K') + ((int)('5') << 8))):
4114 case K_S_DOWN(-((253) + ((int)(KE_S_DOWN) << 8))):
4115 case K_PAGEUP(-(('k') + ((int)('P') << 8))):
4116 case K_KPAGEUP(-(('K') + ((int)('3') << 8))):
4117 case K_S_UP(-((253) + ((int)(KE_S_UP) << 8))):
4118 return FALSE0;
4119 }
4120 return TRUE1;
4121}
4122
4123/*
4124 * Do Insert mode completion.
4125 * Called when character "c" was typed, which has a meaning for completion.
4126 * Returns OK if completion was done, FAIL if something failed (out of mem).
4127 */
4128static int ins_complete(int c)
4129{
4130 char_u *line;
4131 int startcol = 0; /* column where searched text starts */
4132 colnr_T curs_col; /* cursor column */
4133 int n;
4134 int save_w_wrow;
4135
4136 compl_direction = ins_compl_key2dir(c);
4137 if (!compl_started) {
4138 /* First time we hit ^N or ^P (in a row, I mean) */
4139
4140 did_ai = FALSE0;
4141 did_si = FALSE0;
4142 can_si = FALSE0;
4143 can_si_back = FALSE0;
4144 if (stop_arrow() == FAIL0)
4145 return FAIL0;
4146
4147 line = ml_get(curwin->w_cursor.lnum);
4148 curs_col = curwin->w_cursor.col;
4149 compl_pending = 0;
4150
4151 /* If this same ctrl_x_mode has been interrupted use the text from
4152 * "compl_startpos" to the cursor as a pattern to add a new word
4153 * instead of expand the one before the cursor, in word-wise if
4154 * "compl_startpos" is not in the same line as the cursor then fix it
4155 * (the line has been split because it was longer than 'tw'). if SOL
4156 * is set then skip the previous pattern, a word at the beginning of
4157 * the line has been inserted, we'll look for that -- Acevedo. */
4158 if ((compl_cont_status & CONT_INTRPT(2 + 4)) == CONT_INTRPT(2 + 4)
4159 && compl_cont_mode == ctrl_x_mode) {
4160 /*
4161 * it is a continued search
4162 */
4163 compl_cont_status &= ~CONT_INTRPT(2 + 4); /* remove INTRPT */
4164 if (ctrl_x_mode == 0 || ctrl_x_mode == CTRL_X_PATH_PATTERNS(6 + 0x100)
4165 || ctrl_x_mode == CTRL_X_PATH_DEFINES(7 + 0x100)) {
4166 if (compl_startpos.lnum != curwin->w_cursor.lnum) {
4167 /* line (probably) wrapped, set compl_startpos to the
4168 * first non_blank in the line, if it is not a wordchar
4169 * include it to get a better pattern, but then we don't
4170 * want the "\\<" prefix, check it bellow */
4171 compl_col = (colnr_T)(skipwhite(line) - line);
4172 compl_startpos.col = compl_col;
4173 compl_startpos.lnum = curwin->w_cursor.lnum;
4174 compl_cont_status &= ~CONT_SOL16; /* clear SOL if present */
4175 } else {
4176 /* S_IPOS was set when we inserted a word that was at the
4177 * beginning of the line, which means that we'll go to SOL
4178 * mode but first we need to redefine compl_startpos */
4179 if (compl_cont_status & CONT_S_IPOS8) {
4180 compl_cont_status |= CONT_SOL16;
4181 compl_startpos.col = (colnr_T)(skipwhite(
4182 line + compl_length
4183 + compl_startpos.col) - line);
4184 }
4185 compl_col = compl_startpos.col;
4186 }
4187 compl_length = curwin->w_cursor.col - (int)compl_col;
4188 /* IObuff is used to add a "word from the next line" would we
4189 * have enough space? just being paranoid */
4190#define MIN_SPACE75 75
4191 if (compl_length > (IOSIZE(1024+1) - MIN_SPACE75)) {
4192 compl_cont_status &= ~CONT_SOL16;
4193 compl_length = (IOSIZE(1024+1) - MIN_SPACE75);
4194 compl_col = curwin->w_cursor.col - compl_length;
4195 }
4196 compl_cont_status |= CONT_ADDING1 | CONT_N_ADDS4;
4197 if (compl_length < 1)
4198 compl_cont_status &= CONT_LOCAL32;
4199 } else if (ctrl_x_mode == CTRL_X_WHOLE_LINE3)
4200 compl_cont_status = CONT_ADDING1 | CONT_N_ADDS4;
4201 else
4202 compl_cont_status = 0;
4203 } else
4204 compl_cont_status &= CONT_LOCAL32;
4205
4206 if (!(compl_cont_status & CONT_ADDING1)) { /* normal expansion */
4207 compl_cont_mode = ctrl_x_mode;
4208 if (ctrl_x_mode != 0) /* Remove LOCAL if ctrl_x_mode != 0 */
4209 compl_cont_status = 0;
4210 compl_cont_status |= CONT_N_ADDS4;
4211 compl_startpos = curwin->w_cursor;
4212 startcol = (int)curs_col;
4213 compl_col = 0;
4214 }
4215
4216 /* Work out completion pattern and original text -- webb */
4217 if (ctrl_x_mode == 0 || (ctrl_x_mode & CTRL_X_WANT_IDENT0x100)) {
4218 if ((compl_cont_status & CONT_SOL16)
4219 || ctrl_x_mode == CTRL_X_PATH_DEFINES(7 + 0x100)) {
4220 if (!(compl_cont_status & CONT_ADDING1)) {
4221 while (--startcol >= 0 && vim_isIDc(line[startcol]))
4222 ;
4223 compl_col += ++startcol;
4224 compl_length = curs_col - startcol;
4225 }
4226 if (p_ic)
4227 compl_pattern = str_foldcase(line + compl_col,
4228 compl_length, NULL((void*)0), 0);
4229 else
4230 compl_pattern = vim_strnsave(line + compl_col,
4231 compl_length);
4232 if (compl_pattern == NULL((void*)0))
4233 return FAIL0;
4234 } else if (compl_cont_status & CONT_ADDING1) {
4235 char_u *prefix = (char_u *)"\\<";
4236
4237 /* we need up to 2 extra chars for the prefix */
4238 compl_pattern = xmalloc(quote_meta(NULL((void*)0), line + compl_col,
4239 compl_length) + 2);
4240 if (!vim_iswordp(line + compl_col)
4241 || (compl_col > 0
4242 && (
4243 vim_iswordp(mb_prevptr(line, line + compl_col))
4244 )))
4245 prefix = (char_u *)"";
4246 STRCPY((char *)compl_pattern, prefix)strcpy((char *)((char *)compl_pattern), (char *)(prefix));
4247 (void)quote_meta(compl_pattern + STRLEN(prefix)strlen((char *)(prefix)),
4248 line + compl_col, compl_length);
4249 } else if (--startcol < 0 ||
4250 !vim_iswordp(mb_prevptr(line, line + startcol + 1))
4251 ) {
4252 /* Match any word of at least two chars */
4253 compl_pattern = vim_strsave((char_u *)"\\<\\k\\k");
4254 compl_col += curs_col;
4255 compl_length = 0;
4256 } else {
4257 /* Search the point of change class of multibyte character
4258 * or not a word single byte character backward. */
4259 if (has_mbyte) {
4260 int base_class;
4261 int head_off;
4262
4263 startcol -= (*mb_head_off)(line, line + startcol);
4264 base_class = mb_get_class(line + startcol);
4265 while (--startcol >= 0) {
4266 head_off = (*mb_head_off)(line, line + startcol);
4267 if (base_class != mb_get_class(line + startcol
4268 - head_off))
4269 break;
4270 startcol -= head_off;
4271 }
4272 } else
4273 while (--startcol >= 0 && vim_iswordc(line[startcol]))
4274 ;
4275 compl_col += ++startcol;
4276 compl_length = (int)curs_col - startcol;
4277 if (compl_length == 1) {
4278 /* Only match word with at least two chars -- webb
4279 * there's no need to call quote_meta,
4280 * xmalloc(7) is enough -- Acevedo
4281 */
4282 compl_pattern = xmalloc(7);
4283 STRCPY((char *)compl_pattern, "\\<")strcpy((char *)((char *)compl_pattern), (char *)("\\<"));
4284 (void)quote_meta(compl_pattern + 2, line + compl_col, 1);
4285 STRCAT((char *)compl_pattern, "\\k")strcat((char *)((char *)compl_pattern), (char *)("\\k"));
4286 } else {
4287 compl_pattern = xmalloc(quote_meta(NULL((void*)0), line + compl_col,
4288 compl_length) + 2);
4289 STRCPY((char *)compl_pattern, "\\<")strcpy((char *)((char *)compl_pattern), (char *)("\\<"));
4290 (void)quote_meta(compl_pattern + 2, line + compl_col,
4291 compl_length);
4292 }
4293 }
4294 } else if (ctrl_x_mode == CTRL_X_WHOLE_LINE3) {
4295 compl_col = (colnr_T)(skipwhite(line) - line);
4296 compl_length = (int)curs_col - (int)compl_col;
4297 if (compl_length < 0) /* cursor in indent: empty pattern */
4298 compl_length = 0;
4299 if (p_ic)
4300 compl_pattern = str_foldcase(line + compl_col, compl_length,
4301 NULL((void*)0), 0);
4302 else
4303 compl_pattern = vim_strnsave(line + compl_col, compl_length);
4304 if (compl_pattern == NULL((void*)0))
4305 return FAIL0;
4306 } else if (ctrl_x_mode == CTRL_X_FILES4) {
4307 /* Go back to just before the first filename character. */
4308 if (startcol > 0) {
4309 char_u *p = line + startcol;
4310
4311 mb_ptr_back(line, p)p -= has_mbyte ? ((*mb_head_off)(line, p - 1) + 1) : 1;
4312 while (p > line && vim_isfilec(PTR2CHAR(p)(has_mbyte ? mb_ptr2char(p) : (int)*(p))))
4313 mb_ptr_back(line, p)p -= has_mbyte ? ((*mb_head_off)(line, p - 1) + 1) : 1;
4314 if (p == line && vim_isfilec(PTR2CHAR(p)(has_mbyte ? mb_ptr2char(p) : (int)*(p))))
4315 startcol = 0;
4316 else
4317 startcol = (int)(p - line) + 1;
4318 }
4319
4320 compl_col += startcol;
4321 compl_length = (int)curs_col - startcol;
4322 compl_pattern = addstar(line + compl_col, compl_length,
4323 EXPAND_FILES);
4324 if (compl_pattern == NULL((void*)0))
4325 return FAIL0;
4326 } else if (ctrl_x_mode == CTRL_X_CMDLINE11) {
4327 compl_pattern = vim_strnsave(line, curs_col);
4328 set_cmd_context(&compl_xp, compl_pattern,
4329 (int)STRLEN(compl_pattern)strlen((char *)(compl_pattern)), curs_col);
4330 if (compl_xp.xp_context == EXPAND_UNSUCCESSFUL
4331 || compl_xp.xp_context == EXPAND_NOTHING)
4332 /* No completion possible, use an empty pattern to get a
4333 * "pattern not found" message. */
4334 compl_col = curs_col;
4335 else
4336 compl_col = (int)(compl_xp.xp_pattern - compl_pattern);
4337 compl_length = curs_col - compl_col;
4338 } else if (ctrl_x_mode == CTRL_X_FUNCTION12 || ctrl_x_mode ==
4339 CTRL_X_OMNI13) {
4340 /*
4341 * Call user defined function 'completefunc' with "a:findstart"
4342 * set to 1 to obtain the length of text to use for completion.
4343 */
4344 char_u *args[2];
4345 int col;
4346 char_u *funcname;
4347 pos_T pos;
4348 win_T *curwin_save;
4349 buf_T *curbuf_save;
4350
4351 /* Call 'completefunc' or 'omnifunc' and get pattern length as a
4352 * string */
4353 funcname = ctrl_x_mode == CTRL_X_FUNCTION12
4354 ? curbuf->b_p_cfu : curbuf->b_p_ofu;
4355 if (*funcname == NUL'\000') {
4356 EMSG2(_(e_notset), ctrl_x_mode == CTRL_X_FUNCTIONemsg2((char_u *)(gettext((char *)(e_notset))), (char_u *)(ctrl_x_mode
== 12 ? "completefunc" : "omnifunc"))
4357 ? "completefunc" : "omnifunc")emsg2((char_u *)(gettext((char *)(e_notset))), (char_u *)(ctrl_x_mode
== 12 ? "completefunc" : "omnifunc"));
4358 return FAIL0;
4359 }
4360
4361 args[0] = (char_u *)"1";
4362 args[1] = NULL((void*)0);
4363 pos = curwin->w_cursor;
4364 curwin_save = curwin;
4365 curbuf_save = curbuf;
4366 col = call_func_retnr(funcname, 2, args, FALSE0);
4367 if (curwin_save != curwin || curbuf_save != curbuf) {
4368 EMSG(_(e_complwin))emsg((char_u *)(gettext((char *)(e_complwin))));
4369 return FAIL0;
4370 }
4371 curwin->w_cursor = pos; /* restore the cursor position */
4372 check_cursor();
4373 if (!equalpos(curwin->w_cursor, pos)(((curwin->w_cursor).lnum == (pos).lnum) && ((curwin
->w_cursor).col == (pos).col) && ((curwin->w_cursor
).coladd == (pos).coladd))) {
4374 EMSG(_(e_compldel))emsg((char_u *)(gettext((char *)(e_compldel))));
4375 return FAIL0;
4376 }
4377
4378 /* Return value -2 means the user complete function wants to
4379 * cancel the complete without an error.
4380 * Return value -3 does the same as -2 and leaves CTRL-X mode.*/
4381 if (col == -2)
4382 return FAIL0;
4383 if (col == -3) {
4384 ctrl_x_mode = 0;
4385 edit_submode = NULL((void*)0);
4386 if (!shortmess(SHM_COMPLETIONMENU'c')) {
4387 msg_clr_cmdline();
4388 }
4389 return FAIL0;
4390 }
4391
4392 /*
4393 * Reset extended parameters of completion, when start new
4394 * completion.
4395 */
4396 compl_opt_refresh_always = FALSE0;
4397
4398 if (col < 0)
4399 col = curs_col;
4400 compl_col = col;
4401 if (compl_col > curs_col)
4402 compl_col = curs_col;
4403
4404 /* Setup variables for completion. Need to obtain "line" again,
4405 * it may have become invalid. */
4406 line = ml_get(curwin->w_cursor.lnum);
4407 compl_length = curs_col - compl_col;
4408 compl_pattern = vim_strnsave(line + compl_col, compl_length);
4409 } else if (ctrl_x_mode == CTRL_X_SPELL14) {
4410 if (spell_bad_len > 0)
4411 compl_col = curs_col - spell_bad_len;
4412 else
4413 compl_col = spell_word_start(startcol);
4414 if (compl_col >= (colnr_T)startcol) {
4415 compl_length = 0;
4416 compl_col = curs_col;
4417 } else {
4418 spell_expand_check_cap(compl_col);
4419 compl_length = (int)curs_col - compl_col;
4420 }
4421 /* Need to obtain "line" again, it may have become invalid. */
4422 line = ml_get(curwin->w_cursor.lnum);
4423 compl_pattern = vim_strnsave(line + compl_col, compl_length);
4424 } else {
4425 EMSG2(_(e_intern2), "ins_complete()")emsg2((char_u *)(gettext((char *)(e_intern2))), (char_u *)("ins_complete()"
));
4426 return FAIL0;
4427 }
4428
4429 if (compl_cont_status & CONT_ADDING1) {
4430 edit_submode_pre = (char_u *)_(" Adding")gettext((char *)(" Adding"));
4431 if (ctrl_x_mode == CTRL_X_WHOLE_LINE3) {
4432 /* Insert a new line, keep indentation but ignore 'comments' */
4433 char_u *old = curbuf->b_p_com;
4434
4435 curbuf->b_p_com = (char_u *)"";
4436 compl_startpos.lnum = curwin->w_cursor.lnum;
4437 compl_startpos.col = compl_col;
4438 ins_eol('\r');
4439 curbuf->b_p_com = old;
4440 compl_length = 0;
4441 compl_col = curwin->w_cursor.col;
4442 }
4443 } else {
4444 edit_submode_pre = NULL((void*)0);
4445 compl_startpos.col = compl_col;
4446 }
4447
4448 if (compl_cont_status & CONT_LOCAL32)
4449 edit_submode = (char_u *)_(ctrl_x_msgs[CTRL_X_LOCAL_MSG])gettext((char *)(ctrl_x_msgs[15]));
4450 else
4451 edit_submode = (char_u *)_(CTRL_X_MSG(ctrl_x_mode))gettext((char *)(ctrl_x_msgs[(ctrl_x_mode) & ~0x100]));
4452
4453 /* If any of the original typed text has been changed we need to fix
4454 * the redo buffer. */
4455 ins_compl_fixRedoBufForLeader(NULL((void*)0));
4456
4457 /* Always add completion for the original text. */
4458 free(compl_orig_text);
4459 compl_orig_text = vim_strnsave(line + compl_col, compl_length);
4460 if (ins_compl_add(compl_orig_text, -1, p_ic, NULL((void*)0), NULL((void*)0), 0,
4461 ORIGINAL_TEXT(1), FALSE0) != OK1) {
4462 free(compl_pattern);
4463 compl_pattern = NULL((void*)0);
4464 free(compl_orig_text);
4465 compl_orig_text = NULL((void*)0);
4466 return FAIL0;
4467 }
4468
4469 /* showmode might reset the internal line pointers, so it must
4470 * be called before line = ml_get(), or when this address is no
4471 * longer needed. -- Acevedo.
4472 */
4473 edit_submode_extra = (char_u *)_("-- Searching...")gettext((char *)("-- Searching..."));
4474 edit_submode_highl = HLF_COUNT;
4475 showmode();
4476 edit_submode_extra = NULL((void*)0);
4477 out_flush();
4478 }
4479
4480 compl_shown_match = compl_curr_match;
4481 compl_shows_dir = compl_direction;
4482
4483 /*
4484 * Find next match (and following matches).
4485 */
4486 save_w_wrow = curwin->w_wrow;
4487 n = ins_compl_next(TRUE1, ins_compl_key2count(c), ins_compl_use_match(c));
4488
4489 /* may undisplay the popup menu */
4490 ins_compl_upd_pum();
4491
4492 if (n > 1) /* all matches have been found */
4493 compl_matches = n;
4494 compl_curr_match = compl_shown_match;
4495 compl_direction = compl_shows_dir;
4496
4497 /* Eat the ESC that vgetc() returns after a CTRL-C to avoid leaving Insert
4498 * mode. */
4499 if (got_int && !global_busy) {
4500 (void)vgetc();
4501 got_int = FALSE0;
4502 }
4503
4504 /* we found no match if the list has only the "compl_orig_text"-entry */
4505 if (compl_first_match == compl_first_match->cp_next) {
4506 edit_submode_extra = (compl_cont_status & CONT_ADDING1)
4507 && compl_length > 1
4508 ? (char_u *)_(e_hitend)gettext((char *)(e_hitend)) : (char_u *)_(e_patnotf)gettext((char *)(e_patnotf));
4509 edit_submode_highl = HLF_E;
4510 /* remove N_ADDS flag, so next ^X<> won't try to go to ADDING mode,
4511 * because we couldn't expand anything at first place, but if we used
4512 * ^P, ^N, ^X^I or ^X^D we might want to add-expand a single-char-word
4513 * (such as M in M'exico) if not tried already. -- Acevedo */
4514 if ( compl_length > 1
4515 || (compl_cont_status & CONT_ADDING1)
4516 || (ctrl_x_mode != 0
4517 && ctrl_x_mode != CTRL_X_PATH_PATTERNS(6 + 0x100)
4518 && ctrl_x_mode != CTRL_X_PATH_DEFINES(7 + 0x100)))
4519 compl_cont_status &= ~CONT_N_ADDS4;
4520 }
4521
4522 if (compl_curr_match->cp_flags & CONT_S_IPOS8)
4523 compl_cont_status |= CONT_S_IPOS8;
4524 else
4525 compl_cont_status &= ~CONT_S_IPOS8;
4526
4527 if (edit_submode_extra == NULL((void*)0)) {
4528 if (compl_curr_match->cp_flags & ORIGINAL_TEXT(1)) {
4529 edit_submode_extra = (char_u *)_("Back at original")gettext((char *)("Back at original"));
4530 edit_submode_highl = HLF_W;
4531 } else if (compl_cont_status & CONT_S_IPOS8) {
4532 edit_submode_extra = (char_u *)_("Word from other line")gettext((char *)("Word from other line"));
4533 edit_submode_highl = HLF_COUNT;
4534 } else if (compl_curr_match->cp_next == compl_curr_match->cp_prev) {
4535 edit_submode_extra = (char_u *)_("The only match")gettext((char *)("The only match"));
4536 edit_submode_highl = HLF_COUNT;
4537 } else {
4538 /* Update completion sequence number when needed. */
4539 if (compl_curr_match->cp_number == -1) {
4540 int number = 0;
4541 compl_T *match;
4542
4543 if (compl_direction == FORWARD1) {
4544 /* search backwards for the first valid (!= -1) number.
4545 * This should normally succeed already at the first loop
4546 * cycle, so it's fast! */
4547 for (match = compl_curr_match->cp_prev; match != NULL((void*)0)
4548 && match != compl_first_match;
4549 match = match->cp_prev)
4550 if (match->cp_number != -1) {
4551 number = match->cp_number;
4552 break;
4553 }
4554 if (match != NULL((void*)0))
4555 /* go up and assign all numbers which are not assigned
4556 * yet */
4557 for (match = match->cp_next;
4558 match != NULL((void*)0) && match->cp_number == -1;
4559 match = match->cp_next)
4560 match->cp_number = ++number;
4561 } else { /* BACKWARD */
4562 /* search forwards (upwards) for the first valid (!= -1)
4563 * number. This should normally succeed already at the
4564 * first loop cycle, so it's fast! */
4565 for (match = compl_curr_match->cp_next; match != NULL((void*)0)
4566 && match != compl_first_match;
4567 match = match->cp_next)
4568 if (match->cp_number != -1) {
4569 number = match->cp_number;
4570 break;
4571 }
4572 if (match != NULL((void*)0))
4573 /* go down and assign all numbers which are not
4574 * assigned yet */
4575 for (match = match->cp_prev; match
4576 && match->cp_number == -1;
4577 match = match->cp_prev)
4578 match->cp_number = ++number;
4579 }
4580 }
4581
4582 /* The match should always have a sequence number now, this is
4583 * just a safety check. */
4584 if (compl_curr_match->cp_number != -1) {
4585 /* Space for 10 text chars. + 2x10-digit no.s = 31.
4586 * Translations may need more than twice that. */
4587 static char_u match_ref[81];
4588
4589 if (compl_matches > 0)
4590 vim_snprintf((char *)match_ref, sizeof(match_ref),
4591 _("match %d of %d")gettext((char *)("match %d of %d")),
4592 compl_curr_match->cp_number, compl_matches);
4593 else
4594 vim_snprintf((char *)match_ref, sizeof(match_ref),
4595 _("match %d")gettext((char *)("match %d")),
4596 compl_curr_match->cp_number);
4597 edit_submode_extra = match_ref;
4598 edit_submode_highl = HLF_R;
4599 if (dollar_vcol >= 0)
4600 curs_columns(FALSE0);
4601 }
4602 }
4603 }
4604
4605 /* Show a message about what (completion) mode we're in. */
4606 showmode();
4607 if (!shortmess(SHM_COMPLETIONMENU'c')) {
4608 if (edit_submode_extra != NULL((void*)0)) {
4609 if (!p_smd) {
4610 msg_attr(edit_submode_extra,
4611 edit_submode_highl < HLF_COUNT
4612 ? hl_attr(edit_submode_highl)highlight_attr[(int)(edit_submode_highl)] : 0);
4613 }
4614 } else {
4615 msg_clr_cmdline(); // necessary for "noshowmode"
4616 }
4617 }
4618
4619 /* Show the popup menu, unless we got interrupted. */
4620 if (!compl_interrupted) {
4621 /* RedrawingDisabled may be set when invoked through complete(). */
4622 n = RedrawingDisabled;
4623 RedrawingDisabled = 0;
4624
4625 /* If the cursor moved we need to remove the pum first. */
4626 setcursor();
4627 if (save_w_wrow != curwin->w_wrow)
4628 ins_compl_del_pum();
4629
4630 ins_compl_show_pum();
4631 setcursor();
4632 RedrawingDisabled = n;
4633 }
4634 compl_was_interrupted = compl_interrupted;
4635 compl_interrupted = FALSE0;
4636
4637 return OK1;
4638}
4639
4640/*
4641 * Looks in the first "len" chars. of "src" for search-metachars.
4642 * If dest is not NULL the chars. are copied there quoting (with
4643 * a backslash) the metachars, and dest would be NUL terminated.
4644 * Returns the length (needed) of dest
4645 */
4646static unsigned quote_meta(char_u *dest, char_u *src, int len)
4647{
4648 unsigned m = (unsigned)len + 1; /* one extra for the NUL */
4649
4650 for (; --len >= 0; src++) {
4651 switch (*src) {
4652 case '.':
4653 case '*':
4654 case '[':
4655 if (ctrl_x_mode == CTRL_X_DICTIONARY(9 + 0x100)
4656 || ctrl_x_mode == CTRL_X_THESAURUS(10 + 0x100))
4657 break;
4658 case '~':
4659 if (!p_magic) /* quote these only if magic is set */
4660 break;
4661 case '\\':
4662 if (ctrl_x_mode == CTRL_X_DICTIONARY(9 + 0x100)
4663 || ctrl_x_mode == CTRL_X_THESAURUS(10 + 0x100))
4664 break;
4665 case '^': /* currently it's not needed. */
4666 case '$':
4667 m++;
4668 if (dest != NULL((void*)0))
4669 *dest++ = '\\';
4670 break;
4671 }
4672 if (dest != NULL((void*)0))
4673 *dest++ = *src;
4674 /* Copy remaining bytes of a multibyte character. */
4675 if (has_mbyte) {
4676 int i, mb_len;
4677
4678 mb_len = (*mb_ptr2len)(src) - 1;
4679 if (mb_len > 0 && len >= mb_len)
4680 for (i = 0; i < mb_len; ++i) {
4681 --len;
4682 ++src;
4683 if (dest != NULL((void*)0))
4684 *dest++ = *src;
4685 }
4686 }
4687 }
4688 if (dest != NULL((void*)0))
4689 *dest = NUL'\000';
4690
4691 return m;
4692}
4693
4694/*
4695 * Next character is interpreted literally.
4696 * A one, two or three digit decimal number is interpreted as its byte value.
4697 * If one or two digits are entered, the next character is given to vungetc().
4698 * For Unicode a character > 255 may be returned.
4699 */
4700int get_literal(void)
4701{
4702 int cc;
4703 int nc;
4704 int i;
4705 int hex = FALSE0;
4706 int octal = FALSE0;
4707 int unicode = 0;
4708
4709 if (got_int)
4710 return Ctrl_C3;
4711
4712#ifdef USE_ON_FLY_SCROLL
4713 dont_scroll = TRUE1; /* disallow scrolling here */
4714#endif
4715 ++no_mapping; /* don't map the next key hits */
4716 cc = 0;
4717 i = 0;
4718 for (;; ) {
4719 nc = plain_vgetc();
4720 if (!(State & CMDLINE0x08)
4721 && MB_BYTE2LEN_CHECK(nc)(((nc) < 0 || (nc) > 255) ? 1 : mb_bytelen_tab[nc]) == 1
4722 )
4723 add_to_showcmd(nc);
4724 if (nc == 'x' || nc == 'X')
4725 hex = TRUE1;
4726 else if (nc == 'o' || nc == 'O')
4727 octal = TRUE1;
4728 else if (nc == 'u' || nc == 'U')
4729 unicode = nc;
4730 else {
4731 if (hex
4732 || unicode != 0
4733 ) {
4734 if (!vim_isxdigit(nc))
4735 break;
4736 cc = cc * 16 + hex2nr(nc);
4737 } else if (octal) {
4738 if (nc < '0' || nc > '7')
4739 break;
4740 cc = cc * 8 + nc - '0';
4741 } else {
4742 if (!VIM_ISDIGIT(nc)((unsigned)(nc) - '0' < 10))
4743 break;
4744 cc = cc * 10 + nc - '0';
4745 }
4746
4747 ++i;
4748 }
4749
4750 if (cc > 255
4751 && unicode == 0
4752 )
4753 cc = 255; /* limit range to 0-255 */
4754 nc = 0;
4755
4756 if (hex) { /* hex: up to two chars */
4757 if (i >= 2)
4758 break;
4759 } else if (unicode) { /* Unicode: up to four or eight chars */
4760 if ((unicode == 'u' && i >= 4) || (unicode == 'U' && i >= 8))
4761 break;
4762 } else if (i >= 3) /* decimal or octal: up to three chars */
4763 break;
4764 }
4765 if (i == 0) { /* no number entered */
4766 if (nc == K_ZERO(-((255) + ((int)(('X')) << 8)))) { /* NUL is stored as NL */
4767 cc = '\n';
4768 nc = 0;
4769 } else {
4770 cc = nc;
4771 nc = 0;
4772 }
4773 }
4774
4775 if (cc == 0) /* NUL is stored as NL */
4776 cc = '\n';
4777 if (enc_dbcs && (cc & 0xff) == 0)
4778 cc = '?'; /* don't accept an illegal DBCS char, the NUL in the
4779 second byte will cause trouble! */
4780
4781 --no_mapping;
4782 if (nc)
4783 vungetc(nc);
4784 got_int = FALSE0; /* CTRL-C typed after CTRL-V is not an interrupt */
4785 return cc;
4786}
4787
4788/*
4789 * Insert character, taking care of special keys and mod_mask
4790 */
4791static void
4792insert_special (
4793 int c,
4794 int allow_modmask,
4795 int ctrlv /* c was typed after CTRL-V */
4796)
4797{
4798 char_u *p;
4799 int len;
4800
4801 /*
4802 * Special function key, translate into "<Key>". Up to the last '>' is
4803 * inserted with ins_str(), so as not to replace characters in replace
4804 * mode.
4805 * Only use mod_mask for special keys, to avoid things like <S-Space>,
4806 * unless 'allow_modmask' is TRUE.
4807 */
4808 if (IS_SPECIAL(c)((c) < 0) || (mod_mask && allow_modmask)) {
4809 p = get_special_key_name(c, mod_mask);
4810 len = (int)STRLEN(p)strlen((char *)(p));
4811 c = p[len - 1];
4812 if (len > 2) {
4813 if (stop_arrow() == FAIL0)
4814 return;
4815 p[len - 1] = NUL'\000';
4816 ins_str(p);
4817 AppendToRedobuffLit(p, -1);
4818 ctrlv = FALSE0;
4819 }
4820 }
4821 if (stop_arrow() == OK1)
4822 insertchar(c, ctrlv ? INSCHAR_CTRLV4 : 0, -1);
4823}
4824
4825/*
4826 * Special characters in this context are those that need processing other
4827 * than the simple insertion that can be performed here. This includes ESC
4828 * which terminates the insert, and CR/NL which need special processing to
4829 * open up a new line. This routine tries to optimize insertions performed by
4830 * the "redo", "undo" or "put" commands, so it needs to know when it should
4831 * stop and defer processing to the "normal" mechanism.
