4832 * '0' and '^' are special, because they can be followed by CTRL-D.
4833 */
4834# define ISSPECIAL(c)((c) < ' ' || (c) >= 0x7f || (c) == '0' || (c) == '^') ((c) < ' ' || (c) >= DEL0x7f || (c) == '0' || (c) == '^')
4835
4836# define WHITECHAR(cc)(((cc) == ' ' || (cc) == '\t') && (!enc_utf8 || !utf_iscomposing
( utf_ptr2char(get_cursor_pos_ptr() + 1)))) (vim_iswhite(cc)((cc) == ' ' || (cc) == '\t') && \
4837 (!enc_utf8 || \
4838 !utf_iscomposing( \
4839 utf_ptr2char(get_cursor_pos_ptr() + 1))))
4840
4841/*
4842 * "flags": INSCHAR_FORMAT - force formatting
4843 * INSCHAR_CTRLV - char typed just after CTRL-V
4844 * INSCHAR_NO_FEX - don't use 'formatexpr'
4845 *
4846 * NOTE: passes the flags value straight through to internal_format() which,
4847 * beside INSCHAR_FORMAT (above), is also looking for these:
4848 * INSCHAR_DO_COM - format comments
4849 * INSCHAR_COM_LIST - format comments with num list or 2nd line indent
4850 */
4851void
4852insertchar (
4853 int c, /* character to insert or NUL */
4854 int flags, /* INSCHAR_FORMAT, etc. */
4855 int second_indent /* indent for second line if >= 0 */
4856)
4857{
4858 int textwidth;
4859 char_u *p;
4860 int fo_ins_blank;
4861
4862 textwidth = comp_textwidth(flags & INSCHAR_FORMAT1);
4863 fo_ins_blank = has_format_option(FO_INS_BLANK'b');
4864
4865 /*
4866 * Try to break the line in two or more pieces when:
4867 * - Always do this if we have been called to do formatting only.
4868 * - Always do this when 'formatoptions' has the 'a' flag and the line
4869 * ends in white space.
4870 * - Otherwise:
4871 * - Don't do this if inserting a blank
4872 * - Don't do this if an existing character is being replaced, unless
4873 * we're in VREPLACE mode.
4874 * - Do this if the cursor is not on the line where insert started
4875 * or - 'formatoptions' doesn't have 'l' or the line was not too long
4876 * before the insert.
4877 * - 'formatoptions' doesn't have 'b' or a blank was inserted at or
4878 * before 'textwidth'
4879 */
4880 if (textwidth > 0
4881 && ((flags & INSCHAR_FORMAT1)
4882 || (!vim_iswhite(c)((c) == ' ' || (c) == '\t')
4883 && !((State & REPLACE_FLAG0x40)
4884 && !(State & VREPLACE_FLAG0x80)
4885 && *get_cursor_pos_ptr() != NUL'\000')
4886 && (curwin->w_cursor.lnum != Insstart.lnum
4887 || ((!has_format_option(FO_INS_LONG'l')
4888 || Insstart_textlen <= (colnr_T)textwidth)
4889 && (!fo_ins_blank
4890 || Insstart_blank_vcol <= (colnr_T)textwidth
4891 )))))) {
4892 /* Format with 'formatexpr' when it's set. Use internal formatting
4893 * when 'formatexpr' isn't set or it returns non-zero. */
4894 int do_internal = TRUE1;
4895
4896 if (*curbuf->b_p_fex != NUL'\000' && (flags & INSCHAR_NO_FEX8) == 0) {
4897 do_internal = (fex_format(curwin->w_cursor.lnum, 1L, c) != 0);
4898 /* It may be required to save for undo again, e.g. when setline()
4899 * was called. */
4900 ins_need_undo = TRUE1;
4901 }
4902 if (do_internal)
4903 internal_format(textwidth, second_indent, flags, c == NUL'\000', c);
4904 }
4905
4906 if (c == NUL'\000') /* only formatting was wanted */
4907 return;
4908
4909 /* Check whether this character should end a comment. */
4910 if (did_ai && (int)c == end_comment_pending) {
4911 char_u *line;
4912 char_u lead_end[COM_MAX_LEN50]; /* end-comment string */
4913 int middle_len, end_len;
4914 int i;
4915
4916 /*
4917 * Need to remove existing (middle) comment leader and insert end
4918 * comment leader. First, check what comment leader we can find.
4919 */
4920 i = get_leader_len(line = get_cursor_line_ptr(), &p, FALSE0, TRUE1);
4921 if (i > 0 && vim_strchr(p, COM_MIDDLE'm') != NULL((void*)0)) { /* Just checking */
4922 /* Skip middle-comment string */
4923 while (*p && p[-1] != ':') /* find end of middle flags */
4924 ++p;
4925 middle_len = copy_option_part(&p, lead_end, COM_MAX_LEN50, ",");
4926 /* Don't count trailing white space for middle_len */
4927 while (middle_len > 0 && vim_iswhite(lead_end[middle_len - 1])((lead_end[middle_len - 1]) == ' ' || (lead_end[middle_len - 1
]) == '\t'))
4928 --middle_len;
4929
4930 /* Find the end-comment string */
4931 while (*p && p[-1] != ':') /* find end of end flags */
4932 ++p;
4933 end_len = copy_option_part(&p, lead_end, COM_MAX_LEN50, ",");
4934
4935 /* Skip white space before the cursor */
4936 i = curwin->w_cursor.col;
4937 while (--i >= 0 && vim_iswhite(line[i])((line[i]) == ' ' || (line[i]) == '\t'))
4938 ;
4939 i++;
4940
4941 /* Skip to before the middle leader */
4942 i -= middle_len;
4943
4944 /* Check some expected things before we go on */
4945 if (i >= 0 && lead_end[end_len - 1] == end_comment_pending) {
4946 /* Backspace over all the stuff we want to replace */
4947 backspace_until_column(i);
4948
4949 /*
4950 * Insert the end-comment string, except for the last
4951 * character, which will get inserted as normal later.
4952 */
4953 ins_bytes_len(lead_end, end_len - 1);
4954 }
4955 }
4956 }
4957 end_comment_pending = NUL'\000';
4958
4959 did_ai = FALSE0;
4960 did_si = FALSE0;
4961 can_si = FALSE0;
4962 can_si_back = FALSE0;
4963
4964 /*
4965 * If there's any pending input, grab up to INPUT_BUFLEN at once.
4966 * This speeds up normal text input considerably.
4967 * Don't do this when 'cindent' or 'indentexpr' is set, because we might
4968 * need to re-indent at a ':', or any other character (but not what
4969 * 'paste' is set)..
4970 * Don't do this when there an InsertCharPre autocommand is defined,
4971 * because we need to fire the event for every character.
4972 */
4973#ifdef USE_ON_FLY_SCROLL
4974 dont_scroll = FALSE0; /* allow scrolling here */
4975#endif
4976
4977 if ( !ISSPECIAL(c)((c) < ' ' || (c) >= 0x7f || (c) == '0' || (c) == '^')
4978 && (!has_mbyte || (*mb_char2len)(c) == 1)
4979 && vpeekc() != NUL'\000'
4980 && !(State & REPLACE_FLAG0x40)
4981 && !cindent_on()
4982 && !p_ri
4983 && !has_insertcharpre()
4984 ) {
4985#define INPUT_BUFLEN100 100
4986 char_u buf[INPUT_BUFLEN100 + 1];
4987 int i;
4988 colnr_T virtcol = 0;
4989
4990 buf[0] = c;
4991 i = 1;
4992 if (textwidth > 0)
4993 virtcol = get_nolist_virtcol();
4994 /*
4995 * Stop the string when:
4996 * - no more chars available
4997 * - finding a special character (command key)
4998 * - buffer is full
4999 * - running into the 'textwidth' boundary
5000 * - need to check for abbreviation: A non-word char after a word-char
5001 */
5002 while ( (c = vpeekc()) != NUL'\000'
5003 && !ISSPECIAL(c)((c) < ' ' || (c) >= 0x7f || (c) == '0' || (c) == '^')
5004 && (!has_mbyte || MB_BYTE2LEN_CHECK(c)(((c) < 0 || (c) > 255) ? 1 : mb_bytelen_tab[c]) == 1)
5005 && i < INPUT_BUFLEN100
5006 && (textwidth == 0
5007 || (virtcol += byte2cells(buf[i - 1])) < (colnr_T)textwidth)
5008 && !(!no_abbr && !vim_iswordc(c) && vim_iswordc(buf[i - 1]))) {
5009 c = vgetc();
5010 if (p_hkmap && KeyTyped)
5011 c = hkmap(c); /* Hebrew mode mapping */
5012 if (p_fkmap && KeyTyped)
5013 c = fkmap(c); /* Farsi mode mapping */
5014 buf[i++] = c;
5015 }
5016
5017 do_digraph(-1); /* clear digraphs */
5018 do_digraph(buf[i-1]); /* may be the start of a digraph */
5019 buf[i] = NUL'\000';
5020 ins_str(buf);
5021 if (flags & INSCHAR_CTRLV4) {
5022 redo_literal(*buf);
5023 i = 1;
5024 } else
5025 i = 0;
5026 if (buf[i] != NUL'\000')
5027 AppendToRedobuffLit(buf + i, -1);
5028 } else {
5029 int cc;
5030
5031 if (has_mbyte && (cc = (*mb_char2len)(c)) > 1) {
5032 char_u buf[MB_MAXBYTES21 + 1];
5033
5034 (*mb_char2bytes)(c, buf);
5035 buf[cc] = NUL'\000';
5036 ins_char_bytes(buf, cc);
5037 AppendCharToRedobuff(c);
5038 } else {
5039 ins_char(c);
5040 if (flags & INSCHAR_CTRLV4)
5041 redo_literal(c);
5042 else
5043 AppendCharToRedobuff(c);
5044 }
5045 }
5046}
5047
5048/*
5049 * Format text at the current insert position.
5050 *
5051 * If the INSCHAR_COM_LIST flag is present, then the value of second_indent
5052 * will be the comment leader length sent to open_line().
5053 */
5054static void
5055internal_format (
5056 int textwidth,
5057 int second_indent,
5058 int flags,
5059 int format_only,
5060 int c /* character to be inserted (can be NUL) */
5061)
5062{
5063 int cc;
5064 int save_char = NUL'\000';
5065 int haveto_redraw = FALSE0;
5066 int fo_ins_blank = has_format_option(FO_INS_BLANK'b');
5067 int fo_multibyte = has_format_option(FO_MBYTE_BREAK'm');
5068 int fo_white_par = has_format_option(FO_WHITE_PAR'w');
5069 int first_line = TRUE1;
5070 colnr_T leader_len;
5071 int no_leader = FALSE0;
5072 int do_comments = (flags & INSCHAR_DO_COM2);
5073
5074 /*
5075 * When 'ai' is off we don't want a space under the cursor to be
5076 * deleted. Replace it with an 'x' temporarily.
5077 */
5078 if (!curbuf->b_p_ai
5079 && !(State & VREPLACE_FLAG0x80)
5080 ) {
5081 cc = gchar_cursor();
5082 if (vim_iswhite(cc)((cc) == ' ' || (cc) == '\t')) {
5083 save_char = cc;
5084 pchar_cursor('x');
5085 }
5086 }
5087
5088 /*
5089 * Repeat breaking lines, until the current line is not too long.
5090 */
5091 while (!got_int) {
5092 int startcol; /* Cursor column at entry */
5093 int wantcol; /* column at textwidth border */
5094 int foundcol; /* column for start of spaces */
5095 int end_foundcol = 0; /* column for start of word */
5096 colnr_T len;
5097 colnr_T virtcol;
5098 int orig_col = 0;
5099 char_u *saved_text = NULL((void*)0);
5100 colnr_T col;
5101 colnr_T end_col;
5102
5103 virtcol = get_nolist_virtcol()
5104 + char2cells(c != NUL'\000' ? c : gchar_cursor());
5105 if (virtcol <= (colnr_T)textwidth)
5106 break;
5107
5108 if (no_leader)
5109 do_comments = FALSE0;
5110 else if (!(flags & INSCHAR_FORMAT1)
5111 && has_format_option(FO_WRAP_COMS'c'))
5112 do_comments = TRUE1;
5113
5114 /* Don't break until after the comment leader */
5115 if (do_comments)
5116 leader_len = get_leader_len(get_cursor_line_ptr(), NULL((void*)0), FALSE0, TRUE1);
5117 else
5118 leader_len = 0;
5119
5120 /* If the line doesn't start with a comment leader, then don't
5121 * start one in a following broken line. Avoids that a %word
5122 * moved to the start of the next line causes all following lines
5123 * to start with %. */
5124 if (leader_len == 0)
5125 no_leader = TRUE1;
5126 if (!(flags & INSCHAR_FORMAT1)
5127 && leader_len == 0
5128 && !has_format_option(FO_WRAP't'))
5129
5130 break;
5131 if ((startcol = curwin->w_cursor.col) == 0)
5132 break;
5133
5134 /* find column of textwidth border */
5135 coladvance((colnr_T)textwidth);
5136 wantcol = curwin->w_cursor.col;
5137
5138 curwin->w_cursor.col = startcol;
5139 foundcol = 0;
5140
5141 /*
5142 * Find position to break at.
5143 * Stop at first entered white when 'formatoptions' has 'v'
5144 */
5145 while ((!fo_ins_blank && !has_format_option(FO_INS_VI'v'))
5146 || (flags & INSCHAR_FORMAT1)
5147 || curwin->w_cursor.lnum != Insstart.lnum
5148 || curwin->w_cursor.col >= Insstart.col) {
5149 if (curwin->w_cursor.col == startcol && c != NUL'\000')
5150 cc = c;
5151 else
5152 cc = gchar_cursor();
5153 if (WHITECHAR(cc)(((cc) == ' ' || (cc) == '\t') && (!enc_utf8 || !utf_iscomposing
( utf_ptr2char(get_cursor_pos_ptr() + 1))))) {
5154 /* remember position of blank just before text */
5155 end_col = curwin->w_cursor.col;
5156
5157 /* find start of sequence of blanks */
5158 while (curwin->w_cursor.col > 0 && WHITECHAR(cc)(((cc) == ' ' || (cc) == '\t') && (!enc_utf8 || !utf_iscomposing
( utf_ptr2char(get_cursor_pos_ptr() + 1))))) {
5159 dec_cursor();
5160 cc = gchar_cursor();
5161 }
5162 if (curwin->w_cursor.col == 0 && WHITECHAR(cc)(((cc) == ' ' || (cc) == '\t') && (!enc_utf8 || !utf_iscomposing
( utf_ptr2char(get_cursor_pos_ptr() + 1)))))
5163 break; /* only spaces in front of text */
5164 /* Don't break until after the comment leader */
5165 if (curwin->w_cursor.col < leader_len)
5166 break;
5167 if (has_format_option(FO_ONE_LETTER'1')) {
5168 /* do not break after one-letter words */
5169 if (curwin->w_cursor.col == 0)
5170 break; /* one-letter word at begin */
5171 /* do not break "#a b" when 'tw' is 2 */
5172 if (curwin->w_cursor.col <= leader_len)
5173 break;
5174 col = curwin->w_cursor.col;
5175 dec_cursor();
5176 cc = gchar_cursor();
5177
5178 if (WHITECHAR(cc)(((cc) == ' ' || (cc) == '\t') && (!enc_utf8 || !utf_iscomposing
( utf_ptr2char(get_cursor_pos_ptr() + 1)))))
5179 continue; /* one-letter, continue */
5180 curwin->w_cursor.col = col;
5181 }
5182
5183 inc_cursor();
5184
5185 end_foundcol = end_col + 1;
5186 foundcol = curwin->w_cursor.col;
5187 if (curwin->w_cursor.col <= (colnr_T)wantcol)
5188 break;
5189 } else if (cc >= 0x100 && fo_multibyte) {
5190 /* Break after or before a multi-byte character. */
5191 if (curwin->w_cursor.col != startcol) {
5192 /* Don't break until after the comment leader */
5193 if (curwin->w_cursor.col < leader_len)
5194 break;
5195 col = curwin->w_cursor.col;
5196 inc_cursor();
5197 /* Don't change end_foundcol if already set. */
5198 if (foundcol != curwin->w_cursor.col) {
5199 foundcol = curwin->w_cursor.col;
5200 end_foundcol = foundcol;
5201 if (curwin->w_cursor.col <= (colnr_T)wantcol)
5202 break;
5203 }
5204 curwin->w_cursor.col = col;
5205 }
5206
5207 if (curwin->w_cursor.col == 0)
5208 break;
5209
5210 col = curwin->w_cursor.col;
5211
5212 dec_cursor();
5213 cc = gchar_cursor();
5214
5215 if (WHITECHAR(cc)(((cc) == ' ' || (cc) == '\t') && (!enc_utf8 || !utf_iscomposing
( utf_ptr2char(get_cursor_pos_ptr() + 1)))))
5216 continue; /* break with space */
5217 /* Don't break until after the comment leader */
5218 if (curwin->w_cursor.col < leader_len)
5219 break;
5220
5221 curwin->w_cursor.col = col;
5222
5223 foundcol = curwin->w_cursor.col;
5224 end_foundcol = foundcol;
5225 if (curwin->w_cursor.col <= (colnr_T)wantcol)
5226 break;
5227 }
5228 if (curwin->w_cursor.col == 0)
5229 break;
5230 dec_cursor();
5231 }
5232
5233 if (foundcol == 0) { /* no spaces, cannot break line */
5234 curwin->w_cursor.col = startcol;
5235 break;
5236 }
5237
5238 /* Going to break the line, remove any "$" now. */
5239 undisplay_dollar();
5240
5241 /*
5242 * Offset between cursor position and line break is used by replace
5243 * stack functions. VREPLACE does not use this, and backspaces
5244 * over the text instead.
5245 */
5246 if (State & VREPLACE_FLAG0x80)
5247 orig_col = startcol; /* Will start backspacing from here */
5248 else
5249 replace_offset = startcol - end_foundcol;
5250
5251 /*
5252 * adjust startcol for spaces that will be deleted and
5253 * characters that will remain on top line
5254 */
5255 curwin->w_cursor.col = foundcol;
5256 while ((cc = gchar_cursor(), WHITECHAR(cc)(((cc) == ' ' || (cc) == '\t') && (!enc_utf8 || !utf_iscomposing
( utf_ptr2char(get_cursor_pos_ptr() + 1)))))
5257 && (!fo_white_par || curwin->w_cursor.col < startcol))
5258 inc_cursor();
5259 startcol -= curwin->w_cursor.col;
5260 if (startcol < 0)
5261 startcol = 0;
5262
5263 if (State & VREPLACE_FLAG0x80) {
5264 /*
5265 * In VREPLACE mode, we will backspace over the text to be
5266 * wrapped, so save a copy now to put on the next line.
5267 */
5268 saved_text = vim_strsave(get_cursor_pos_ptr());
5269 curwin->w_cursor.col = orig_col;
5270 saved_text[startcol] = NUL'\000';
5271
5272 /* Backspace over characters that will move to the next line */
5273 if (!fo_white_par)
5274 backspace_until_column(foundcol);
5275 } else {
5276 /* put cursor after pos. to break line */
5277 if (!fo_white_par)
5278 curwin->w_cursor.col = foundcol;
5279 }
5280
5281 /*
5282 * Split the line just before the margin.
5283 * Only insert/delete lines, but don't really redraw the window.
5284 */
5285 open_line(FORWARD1, OPENLINE_DELSPACES1 + OPENLINE_MARKFIX8
5286 + (fo_white_par ? OPENLINE_KEEPTRAIL4 : 0)
5287 + (do_comments ? OPENLINE_DO_COM2 : 0)
5288 + ((flags & INSCHAR_COM_LIST16) ? OPENLINE_COM_LIST16 : 0)
5289 , ((flags & INSCHAR_COM_LIST16) ? second_indent : old_indent));
5290 if (!(flags & INSCHAR_COM_LIST16))
5291 old_indent = 0;
5292
5293 replace_offset = 0;
5294 if (first_line) {
5295 if (!(flags & INSCHAR_COM_LIST16)) {
5296 /*
5297 * This section is for auto-wrap of numeric lists. When not
5298 * in insert mode (i.e. format_lines()), the INSCHAR_COM_LIST
5299 * flag will be set and open_line() will handle it (as seen
5300 * above). The code here (and in get_number_indent()) will
5301 * recognize comments if needed...
5302 */
5303 if (second_indent < 0 && has_format_option(FO_Q_NUMBER'n'))
5304 second_indent =
5305 get_number_indent(curwin->w_cursor.lnum - 1);
5306 if (second_indent >= 0) {
5307 if (State & VREPLACE_FLAG0x80)
5308 change_indent(INDENT_SET1, second_indent,
5309 FALSE0, NUL'\000', TRUE1);
5310 else if (leader_len > 0 && second_indent - leader_len > 0) {
5311 int i;
5312 int padding = second_indent - leader_len;
5313
5314 /* We started at the first_line of a numbered list
5315 * that has a comment. the open_line() function has
5316 * inserted the proper comment leader and positioned
5317 * the cursor at the end of the split line. Now we
5318 * add the additional whitespace needed after the
5319 * comment leader for the numbered list. */
5320 for (i = 0; i < padding; i++)
5321 ins_str((char_u *)" ");
5322 changed_bytes(curwin->w_cursor.lnum, leader_len);
5323 } else {
5324 (void)set_indent(second_indent, SIN_CHANGED1);
5325 }
5326 }
5327 }
5328 first_line = FALSE0;
5329 }
5330
5331 if (State & VREPLACE_FLAG0x80) {
5332 /*
5333 * In VREPLACE mode we have backspaced over the text to be
5334 * moved, now we re-insert it into the new line.
5335 */
5336 ins_bytes(saved_text);
5337 free(saved_text);
5338 } else {
5339 /*
5340 * Check if cursor is not past the NUL off the line, cindent
5341 * may have added or removed indent.
5342 */
5343 curwin->w_cursor.col += startcol;
5344 len = (colnr_T)STRLEN(get_cursor_line_ptr())strlen((char *)(get_cursor_line_ptr()));
5345 if (curwin->w_cursor.col > len)
5346 curwin->w_cursor.col = len;
5347 }
5348
5349 haveto_redraw = TRUE1;
5350 can_cindent = TRUE1;
5351 /* moved the cursor, don't autoindent or cindent now */
5352 did_ai = FALSE0;
5353 did_si = FALSE0;
5354 can_si = FALSE0;
5355 can_si_back = FALSE0;
5356 line_breakcheck();
5357 }
5358
5359 if (save_char != NUL'\000') /* put back space after cursor */
5360 pchar_cursor(save_char);
5361
5362 if (!format_only && haveto_redraw) {
5363 update_topline();
5364 redraw_curbuf_later(VALID10);
5365 }
5366}
5367
5368/*
5369 * Called after inserting or deleting text: When 'formatoptions' includes the
5370 * 'a' flag format from the current line until the end of the paragraph.
5371 * Keep the cursor at the same position relative to the text.
5372 * The caller must have saved the cursor line for undo, following ones will be
5373 * saved here.
5374 */
5375void
5376auto_format (
5377 int trailblank, /* when TRUE also format with trailing blank */
5378 int prev_line /* may start in previous line */
5379)
5380{
5381 pos_T pos;
5382 colnr_T len;
5383 char_u *old;
5384 char_u *new, *pnew;
5385 int wasatend;
5386 int cc;
5387
5388 if (!has_format_option(FO_AUTO'a'))
5389 return;
5390
5391 pos = curwin->w_cursor;
5392 old = get_cursor_line_ptr();
5393
5394 /* may remove added space */
5395 check_auto_format(FALSE0);
5396
5397 /* Don't format in Insert mode when the cursor is on a trailing blank, the
5398 * user might insert normal text next. Also skip formatting when "1" is
5399 * in 'formatoptions' and there is a single character before the cursor.
5400 * Otherwise the line would be broken and when typing another non-white
5401 * next they are not joined back together. */
5402 wasatend = (pos.col == (colnr_T)STRLEN(old)strlen((char *)(old)));
5403 if (*old != NUL'\000' && !trailblank && wasatend) {
5404 dec_cursor();
5405 cc = gchar_cursor();
5406 if (!WHITECHAR(cc)(((cc) == ' ' || (cc) == '\t') && (!enc_utf8 || !utf_iscomposing
( utf_ptr2char(get_cursor_pos_ptr() + 1)))) && curwin->w_cursor.col > 0
5407 && has_format_option(FO_ONE_LETTER'1'))
5408 dec_cursor();
5409 cc = gchar_cursor();
5410 if (WHITECHAR(cc)(((cc) == ' ' || (cc) == '\t') && (!enc_utf8 || !utf_iscomposing
( utf_ptr2char(get_cursor_pos_ptr() + 1))))) {
5411 curwin->w_cursor = pos;
5412 return;
5413 }
5414 curwin->w_cursor = pos;
5415 }
5416
5417 /* With the 'c' flag in 'formatoptions' and 't' missing: only format
5418 * comments. */
5419 if (has_format_option(FO_WRAP_COMS'c') && !has_format_option(FO_WRAP't')
5420 && get_leader_len(old, NULL((void*)0), FALSE0, TRUE1) == 0)
5421 return;
5422
5423 /*
5424 * May start formatting in a previous line, so that after "x" a word is
5425 * moved to the previous line if it fits there now. Only when this is not
5426 * the start of a paragraph.
5427 */
5428 if (prev_line && !paragraph_start(curwin->w_cursor.lnum)) {
5429 --curwin->w_cursor.lnum;
5430 if (u_save_cursor() == FAIL0)
5431 return;
5432 }
5433
5434 /*
5435 * Do the formatting and restore the cursor position. "saved_cursor" will
5436 * be adjusted for the text formatting.
5437 */
5438 saved_cursor = pos;
5439 format_lines((linenr_T)-1, FALSE0);
5440 curwin->w_cursor = saved_cursor;
5441 saved_cursor.lnum = 0;
5442
5443 if (curwin->w_cursor.lnum > curbuf->b_ml.ml_line_count) {
5444 /* "cannot happen" */
5445 curwin->w_cursor.lnum = curbuf->b_ml.ml_line_count;
5446 coladvance((colnr_T)MAXCOL(0x7fffffffL));
5447 } else
5448 check_cursor_col();
5449
5450 /* Insert mode: If the cursor is now after the end of the line while it
5451 * previously wasn't, the line was broken. Because of the rule above we
5452 * need to add a space when 'w' is in 'formatoptions' to keep a paragraph
5453 * formatted. */
5454 if (!wasatend && has_format_option(FO_WHITE_PAR'w')) {
5455 new = get_cursor_line_ptr();
5456 len = (colnr_T)STRLEN(new)strlen((char *)(new));
5457 if (curwin->w_cursor.col == len) {
5458 pnew = vim_strnsave(new, len + 2);
5459 pnew[len] = ' ';
5460 pnew[len + 1] = NUL'\000';
5461 ml_replace(curwin->w_cursor.lnum, pnew, FALSE0);
5462 /* remove the space later */
5463 did_add_space = TRUE1;
5464 } else
5465 /* may remove added space */
5466 check_auto_format(FALSE0);
5467 }
5468
5469 check_cursor();
5470}
5471
5472/*
5473 * When an extra space was added to continue a paragraph for auto-formatting,
5474 * delete it now. The space must be under the cursor, just after the insert
5475 * position.
5476 */
5477static void
5478check_auto_format (
5479 int end_insert /* TRUE when ending Insert mode */
5480)
5481{
5482 int c = ' ';
5483 int cc;
5484
5485 if (did_add_space) {
5486 cc = gchar_cursor();
5487 if (!WHITECHAR(cc)(((cc) == ' ' || (cc) == '\t') && (!enc_utf8 || !utf_iscomposing
( utf_ptr2char(get_cursor_pos_ptr() + 1)))))
5488 /* Somehow the space was removed already. */
5489 did_add_space = FALSE0;
5490 else {
5491 if (!end_insert) {
5492 inc_cursor();
5493 c = gchar_cursor();
5494 dec_cursor();
5495 }
5496 if (c != NUL'\000') {
5497 /* The space is no longer at the end of the line, delete it. */
5498 del_char(FALSE0);
5499 did_add_space = FALSE0;
5500 }
5501 }
5502 }
5503}
5504
5505/*
5506 * Find out textwidth to be used for formatting:
5507 * if 'textwidth' option is set, use it
5508 * else if 'wrapmargin' option is set, use curwin->w_width - 'wrapmargin'
5509 * if invalid value, use 0.
5510 * Set default to window width (maximum 79) for "gq" operator.
5511 */
5512int
5513comp_textwidth (
5514 int ff /* force formatting (for "gq" command) */
5515)
5516{
5517 int textwidth;
5518
5519 textwidth = curbuf->b_p_tw;
5520 if (textwidth == 0 && curbuf->b_p_wm) {
5521 /* The width is the window width minus 'wrapmargin' minus all the
5522 * things that add to the margin. */
5523 textwidth = curwin->w_width - curbuf->b_p_wm;
5524 if (cmdwin_type != 0)
5525 textwidth -= 1;
5526 textwidth -= curwin->w_p_fdcw_onebuf_opt.wo_fdc;
5527
5528 if (curwin->w_buffer->b_signlist != NULL((void*)0)) {
5529 textwidth -= 1;
5530 }
5531
5532 if (curwin->w_p_nuw_onebuf_opt.wo_nu || curwin->w_p_rnuw_onebuf_opt.wo_rnu)
5533 textwidth -= 8;
5534 }
5535 if (textwidth < 0)
5536 textwidth = 0;
5537 if (ff && textwidth == 0) {
5538 textwidth = curwin->w_width - 1;
5539 if (textwidth > 79)
5540 textwidth = 79;
5541 }
5542 return textwidth;
5543}
5544
5545/*
5546 * Put a character in the redo buffer, for when just after a CTRL-V.
5547 */
5548static void redo_literal(int c)
5549{
5550 char_u buf[10];
5551
5552 /* Only digits need special treatment. Translate them into a string of
5553 * three digits. */
5554 if (VIM_ISDIGIT(c)((unsigned)(c) - '0' < 10)) {
5555 vim_snprintf((char *)buf, sizeof(buf), "%03d", c);
5556 AppendToRedobuff(buf);
5557 } else
5558 AppendCharToRedobuff(c);
5559}
5560
5561/*
5562 * start_arrow() is called when an arrow key is used in insert mode.
5563 * For undo/redo it resembles hitting the <ESC> key.
5564 */
5565static void
5566start_arrow (
5567 pos_T *end_insert_pos /* can be NULL */
5568)
5569{
5570 if (!arrow_used) { /* something has been inserted */
5571 AppendToRedobuff(ESC_STR(char_u *)"\033");
5572 stop_insert(end_insert_pos, FALSE0, FALSE0);
5573 arrow_used = TRUE1; /* this means we stopped the current insert */
5574 }
5575 check_spell_redraw();
5576}
5577
5578/*
5579 * If we skipped highlighting word at cursor, do it now.
5580 * It may be skipped again, thus reset spell_redraw_lnum first.
5581 */
5582static void check_spell_redraw(void)
5583{
5584 if (spell_redraw_lnum != 0) {
5585 linenr_T lnum = spell_redraw_lnum;
5586
5587 spell_redraw_lnum = 0;
5588 redrawWinline(lnum, FALSE0);
5589 }
5590}
5591
5592/*
5593 * Called when starting CTRL_X_SPELL mode: Move backwards to a previous badly
5594 * spelled word, if there is one.
5595 */
5596static void spell_back_to_badword(void)
5597{
5598 pos_T tpos = curwin->w_cursor;
5599
5600 spell_bad_len = spell_move_to(curwin, BACKWARD(-1), TRUE1, TRUE1, NULL((void*)0));
5601 if (curwin->w_cursor.col != tpos.col)
5602 start_arrow(&tpos);
5603}
5604
5605/*
5606 * stop_arrow() is called before a change is made in insert mode.
5607 * If an arrow key has been used, start a new insertion.
5608 * Returns FAIL if undo is impossible, shouldn't insert then.
5609 */
5610int stop_arrow(void)
5611{
5612 if (arrow_used) {
5613 Insstart = curwin->w_cursor; //new insertion starts here
5614 if (Insstart.col > Insstart_orig.col && !ins_need_undo) {
5615 // Don't update the original insert position when moved to the
5616 // right, except when nothing was inserted yet.
5617 update_Insstart_orig = FALSE0;
5618 }
5619 Insstart_textlen = (colnr_T)linetabsize(get_cursor_line_ptr());
5620
5621 if (u_save_cursor() == OK1) {
5622 arrow_used = FALSE0;
5623 ins_need_undo = FALSE0;
5624 }
5625 ai_col = 0;
5626 if (State & VREPLACE_FLAG0x80) {
5627 orig_line_count = curbuf->b_ml.ml_line_count;
5628 vr_lines_changed = 1;
5629 }
5630 ResetRedobuff();
5631 AppendToRedobuff((char_u *)"1i"); /* pretend we start an insertion */
5632 new_insert_skip = 2;
5633 } else if (ins_need_undo) {
5634 if (u_save_cursor() == OK1)
5635 ins_need_undo = FALSE0;
5636 }
5637
5638 /* Always open fold at the cursor line when inserting something. */
5639 foldOpenCursor();
5640
5641 return arrow_used || ins_need_undo ? FAIL0 : OK1;
5642}
5643
5644/*
5645 * Do a few things to stop inserting.
5646 * "end_insert_pos" is where insert ended. It is NULL when we already jumped
5647 * to another window/buffer.
5648 */
5649static void
5650stop_insert (
5651 pos_T *end_insert_pos,
5652 int esc, /* called by ins_esc() */
5653 int nomove /* <c-\><c-o>, don't move cursor */
5654)
5655{
5656 int cc;
5657 char_u *ptr;
5658
5659 stop_redo_ins();
5660 replace_flush(); /* abandon replace stack */
5661
5662 /*
5663 * Save the inserted text for later redo with ^@ and CTRL-A.
5664 * Don't do it when "restart_edit" was set and nothing was inserted,
5665 * otherwise CTRL-O w and then <Left> will clear "last_insert".
5666 */
5667 ptr = get_inserted();
5668 if (did_restart_edit == 0 || (ptr != NULL((void*)0)
5669 && (int)STRLEN(ptr)strlen((char *)(ptr)) > new_insert_skip)) {
5670 free(last_insert);
5671 last_insert = ptr;
5672 last_insert_skip = new_insert_skip;
5673 } else
5674 free(ptr);
5675
5676 if (!arrow_used && end_insert_pos != NULL((void*)0)) {
5677 /* Auto-format now. It may seem strange to do this when stopping an
5678 * insertion (or moving the cursor), but it's required when appending
5679 * a line and having it end in a space. But only do it when something
5680 * was actually inserted, otherwise undo won't work. */
5681 if (!ins_need_undo && has_format_option(FO_AUTO'a')) {
5682 pos_T tpos = curwin->w_cursor;
5683
5684 /* When the cursor is at the end of the line after a space the
5685 * formatting will move it to the following word. Avoid that by
5686 * moving the cursor onto the space. */
5687 cc = 'x';
5688 if (curwin->w_cursor.col > 0 && gchar_cursor() == NUL'\000') {
5689 dec_cursor();
5690 cc = gchar_cursor();
5691 if (!vim_iswhite(cc)((cc) == ' ' || (cc) == '\t'))
5692 curwin->w_cursor = tpos;
5693 }
5694
5695 auto_format(TRUE1, FALSE0);
5696
5697 if (vim_iswhite(cc)((cc) == ' ' || (cc) == '\t')) {
5698 if (gchar_cursor() != NUL'\000')
5699 inc_cursor();
5700 /* If the cursor is still at the same character, also keep
5701 * the "coladd". */
5702 if (gchar_cursor() == NUL'\000'
5703 && curwin->w_cursor.lnum == tpos.lnum
5704 && curwin->w_cursor.col == tpos.col)
5705 curwin->w_cursor.coladd = tpos.coladd;
5706 }
5707 }
5708
5709 /* If a space was inserted for auto-formatting, remove it now. */
5710 check_auto_format(TRUE1);
5711
5712 /* If we just did an auto-indent, remove the white space from the end
5713 * of the line, and put the cursor back.
5714 * Do this when ESC was used or moving the cursor up/down.
5715 * Check for the old position still being valid, just in case the text
5716 * got changed unexpectedly. */
5717 if (!nomove && did_ai && (esc || (vim_strchr(p_cpo, CPO_INDENT'I') == NULL((void*)0)
5718 && curwin->w_cursor.lnum !=
5719 end_insert_pos->lnum))
5720 && end_insert_pos->lnum <= curbuf->b_ml.ml_line_count) {
5721 pos_T tpos = curwin->w_cursor;
5722
5723 curwin->w_cursor = *end_insert_pos;
5724 check_cursor_col(); /* make sure it is not past the line */
5725 for (;; ) {
5726 if (gchar_cursor() == NUL'\000' && curwin->w_cursor.col > 0)
5727 --curwin->w_cursor.col;
5728 cc = gchar_cursor();
5729 if (!vim_iswhite(cc)((cc) == ' ' || (cc) == '\t'))
5730 break;
5731 if (del_char(TRUE1) == FAIL0)
5732 break; /* should not happen */
5733 }
5734 if (curwin->w_cursor.lnum != tpos.lnum)
5735 curwin->w_cursor = tpos;
5736 else if (cc != NUL'\000')
5737 ++curwin->w_cursor.col; /* put cursor back on the NUL */
5738
5739 /* <C-S-Right> may have started Visual mode, adjust the position for
5740 * deleted characters. */
5741 if (VIsual_active && VIsual.lnum == curwin->w_cursor.lnum) {
5742 int len = (int)STRLEN(get_cursor_line_ptr())strlen((char *)(get_cursor_line_ptr()));
5743
5744 if (VIsual.col > len) {
5745 VIsual.col = len;
5746 VIsual.coladd = 0;
5747 }
5748 }
5749 }
5750 }
5751 did_ai = FALSE0;
5752 did_si = FALSE0;
5753 can_si = FALSE0;
5754 can_si_back = FALSE0;
5755
5756 /* Set '[ and '] to the inserted text. When end_insert_pos is NULL we are
5757 * now in a different buffer. */
5758 if (end_insert_pos != NULL((void*)0)) {
5759 curbuf->b_op_start = Insstart;
5760 curbuf->b_op_start_orig = Insstart_orig;
5761 curbuf->b_op_end = *end_insert_pos;
5762 }
5763}
5764
5765/*
5766 * Set the last inserted text to a single character.
5767 * Used for the replace command.
5768 */
5769void set_last_insert(int c)
5770{
5771 char_u *s;
5772
5773 free(last_insert);
5774 last_insert = xmalloc(MB_MAXBYTES21 * 3 + 5);
5775 s = last_insert;
5776 /* Use the CTRL-V only when entering a special char */
5777 if (c < ' ' || c == DEL0x7f)
5778 *s++ = Ctrl_V22;
5779 s = add_char2buf(c, s);
5780 *s++ = ESC'\033';
5781 *s++ = NUL'\000';
5782 last_insert_skip = 0;
5783}
5784
5785#if defined(EXITFREE) || defined(PROTO)
5786void free_last_insert(void)
5787{
5788 free(last_insert);
5789 last_insert = NULL((void*)0);
5790 free(compl_orig_text);
5791 compl_orig_text = NULL((void*)0);
5792}
5793
5794#endif
5795
5796/*
5797 * Add character "c" to buffer "s". Escape the special meaning of K_SPECIAL
5798 * and CSI. Handle multi-byte characters.
5799 * Returns a pointer to after the added bytes.
5800 */
5801char_u *add_char2buf(int c, char_u *s)
5802{
5803 char_u temp[MB_MAXBYTES21 + 1];
5804 int i;
5805 int len;
5806
5807 len = (*mb_char2bytes)(c, temp);
5808 for (i = 0; i < len; ++i) {
5809 c = temp[i];
5810 /* Need to escape K_SPECIAL and CSI like in the typeahead buffer. */
5811 if (c == K_SPECIAL(0x80)) {
5812 *s++ = K_SPECIAL(0x80);
5813 *s++ = KS_SPECIAL254;
5814 *s++ = KE_FILLER('X');
5815 } else
5816 *s++ = c;
5817 }
5818 return s;
5819}
5820
5821/*
5822 * move cursor to start of line
5823 * if flags & BL_WHITE move to first non-white
5824 * if flags & BL_SOL move to first non-white if startofline is set,
5825 * otherwise keep "curswant" column
5826 * if flags & BL_FIX don't leave the cursor on a NUL.
5827 */
5828void beginline(int flags)
5829{
5830 if ((flags & BL_SOL2) && !p_sol)
5831 coladvance(curwin->w_curswant);
5832 else {
5833 curwin->w_cursor.col = 0;
5834 curwin->w_cursor.coladd = 0;
5835
5836 if (flags & (BL_WHITE1 | BL_SOL2)) {
5837 char_u *ptr;
5838
5839 for (ptr = get_cursor_line_ptr(); vim_iswhite(*ptr)((*ptr) == ' ' || (*ptr) == '\t')
5840 && !((flags & BL_FIX4) && ptr[1] == NUL'\000'); ++ptr)
5841 ++curwin->w_cursor.col;
5842 }
5843 curwin->w_set_curswant = TRUE1;
5844 }
5845}
5846
5847/*
5848 * oneright oneleft cursor_down cursor_up
5849 *
5850 * Move one char {right,left,down,up}.
5851 * Doesn't move onto the NUL past the end of the line, unless it is allowed.
5852 * Return OK when successful, FAIL when we hit a line of file boundary.
5853 */
5854
5855int oneright(void)
5856{
5857 char_u *ptr;
5858 int l;
5859
5860 if (virtual_active()) {
5861 pos_T prevpos = curwin->w_cursor;
5862
5863 /* Adjust for multi-wide char (excluding TAB) */
5864 ptr = get_cursor_pos_ptr();
5865 coladvance(getviscol() + ((*ptr != TAB'\011' && vim_isprintc(
5866 (*mb_ptr2char)(ptr)
5867 ))
5868 ? ptr2cells(ptr) : 1));
5869 curwin->w_set_curswant = TRUE1;
5870 /* Return OK if the cursor moved, FAIL otherwise (at window edge). */
5871 return (prevpos.col != curwin->w_cursor.col
5872 || prevpos.coladd != curwin->w_cursor.coladd) ? OK1 : FAIL0;
5873 }
5874
5875 ptr = get_cursor_pos_ptr();
5876 if (*ptr == NUL'\000')
5877 return FAIL0; /* already at the very end */
5878
5879 if (has_mbyte)
5880 l = (*mb_ptr2len)(ptr);
5881 else
5882 l = 1;
5883
5884 /* move "l" bytes right, but don't end up on the NUL, unless 'virtualedit'
5885 * contains "onemore". */
5886 if (ptr[l] == NUL'\000'
5887 && (ve_flags & VE_ONEMORE8) == 0
5888 )
5889 return FAIL0;
5890 curwin->w_cursor.col += l;
5891
5892 curwin->w_set_curswant = TRUE1;
5893 return OK1;
5894}
5895
5896int oneleft(void)
5897{
5898 if (virtual_active()) {
5899 int width;
5900 int v = getviscol();
5901
5902 if (v == 0)
5903 return FAIL0;
5904
5905 /* We might get stuck on 'showbreak', skip over it. */
5906 width = 1;
5907 for (;; ) {
5908 coladvance(v - width);
5909 /* getviscol() is slow, skip it when 'showbreak' is empty,
5910 'breakindent' is not set and there are no multi-byte
5911 characters */
5912 if ((*p_sbr == NUL'\000'
5913 && !curwin->w_p_briw_onebuf_opt.wo_bri
5914 && !has_mbyte
5915 ) || getviscol() < v)
5916 break;
5917 ++width;
5918 }
5919
5920 if (curwin->w_cursor.coladd == 1) {
5921 char_u *ptr;
5922
5923 /* Adjust for multi-wide char (not a TAB) */
5924 ptr = get_cursor_pos_ptr();
5925 if (*ptr != TAB'\011' && vim_isprintc(
5926 (*mb_ptr2char)(ptr)
5927 ) && ptr2cells(ptr) > 1)
5928 curwin->w_cursor.coladd = 0;
5929 }
5930
5931 curwin->w_set_curswant = TRUE1;
5932 return OK1;
5933 }
5934
5935 if (curwin->w_cursor.col == 0)
5936 return FAIL0;
5937
5938 curwin->w_set_curswant = TRUE1;
5939 --curwin->w_cursor.col;
5940
5941 /* if the character on the left of the current cursor is a multi-byte
5942 * character, move to its first byte */
5943 if (has_mbyte)
5944 mb_adjust_cursor();
5945 return OK1;
5946}
5947
5948int
5949cursor_up (
5950 long n,
5951 int upd_topline /* When TRUE: update topline */
5952)
5953{
5954 linenr_T lnum;
5955
5956 if (n > 0) {
5957 lnum = curwin->w_cursor.lnum;
5958 /* This fails if the cursor is already in the first line or the count
5959 * is larger than the line number and '-' is in 'cpoptions' */
5960 if (lnum <= 1 || (n >= lnum && vim_strchr(p_cpo, CPO_MINUS'-') != NULL((void*)0)))
5961 return FAIL0;
5962 if (n >= lnum)
5963 lnum = 1;
5964 else if (hasAnyFolding(curwin)) {
5965 /*
5966 * Count each sequence of folded lines as one logical line.
5967 */
5968 /* go to the start of the current fold */
5969 (void)hasFolding(lnum, &lnum, NULL((void*)0));
5970
5971 while (n--) {
5972 /* move up one line */
5973 --lnum;
5974 if (lnum <= 1)
5975 break;
5976 /* If we entered a fold, move to the beginning, unless in
5977 * Insert mode or when 'foldopen' contains "all": it will open
5978 * in a moment. */
5979 if (n > 0 || !((State & INSERT0x10) || (fdo_flags & FDO_ALL0x001)))
5980 (void)hasFolding(lnum, &lnum, NULL((void*)0));
5981 }
5982 if (lnum < 1)
5983 lnum = 1;
5984 } else
5985 lnum -= n;
5986 curwin->w_cursor.lnum = lnum;
5987 }
5988
5989 /* try to advance to the column we want to be at */
5990 coladvance(curwin->w_curswant);
5991
5992 if (upd_topline)
5993 update_topline(); /* make sure curwin->w_topline is valid */
5994
5995 return OK1;
5996}
5997
5998/*
5999 * Cursor down a number of logical lines.
6000 */
6001int
6002cursor_down (
6003 long n,
6004 int upd_topline /* When TRUE: update topline */
6005)
6006{
6007 linenr_T lnum;
6008
6009 if (n > 0) {
6010 lnum = curwin->w_cursor.lnum;
6011 /* Move to last line of fold, will fail if it's the end-of-file. */
6012 (void)hasFolding(lnum, NULL((void*)0), &lnum);
6013 /* This fails if the cursor is already in the last line or would move
6014 * beyond the last line and '-' is in 'cpoptions' */
6015 if (lnum >= curbuf->b_ml.ml_line_count
6016 || (lnum + n > curbuf->b_ml.ml_line_count
6017 && vim_strchr(p_cpo, CPO_MINUS'-') != NULL((void*)0)))
6018 return FAIL0;
6019 if (lnum + n >= curbuf->b_ml.ml_line_count)
6020 lnum = curbuf->b_ml.ml_line_count;
6021 else if (hasAnyFolding(curwin)) {
6022 linenr_T last;
6023
6024 /* count each sequence of folded lines as one logical line */
6025 while (n--) {
6026 if (hasFolding(lnum, NULL((void*)0), &last))
6027 lnum = last + 1;
6028 else
6029 ++lnum;
6030 if (lnum >= curbuf->b_ml.ml_line_count)
6031 break;
6032 }
6033 if (lnum > curbuf->b_ml.ml_line_count)
6034 lnum = curbuf->b_ml.ml_line_count;
6035 } else
6036 lnum += n;
6037 curwin->w_cursor.lnum = lnum;
6038 }
6039
6040 /* try to advance to the column we want to be at */
6041 coladvance(curwin->w_curswant);
6042
6043 if (upd_topline)
6044 update_topline(); /* make sure curwin->w_topline is valid */
6045
6046 return OK1;
6047}
6048
6049/*
6050 * Stuff the last inserted text in the read buffer.
6051 * Last_insert actually is a copy of the redo buffer, so we
6052 * first have to remove the command.
6053 */
6054int
6055stuff_inserted (
6056 int c, /* Command character to be inserted */
6057 long count, /* Repeat this many times */
6058 int no_esc /* Don't add an ESC at the end */
6059)
6060{
6061 char_u *esc_ptr;
6062 char_u *ptr;
6063 char_u *last_ptr;
6064 char_u last = NUL'\000';
6065
6066 ptr = get_last_insert();
6067 if (ptr == NULL((void*)0)) {
6068 EMSG(_(e_noinstext))emsg((char_u *)(gettext((char *)(e_noinstext))));
6069 return FAIL0;
6070 }
6071
6072 /* may want to stuff the command character, to start Insert mode */
6073 if (c != NUL'\000')
6074 stuffcharReadbuff(c);
6075 if ((esc_ptr = (char_u *)vim_strrchr(ptr, ESC'\033')) != NULL((void*)0))
6076 *esc_ptr = NUL'\000'; /* remove the ESC */
6077
6078 /* when the last char is either "0" or "^" it will be quoted if no ESC
6079 * comes after it OR if it will inserted more than once and "ptr"
6080 * starts with ^D. -- Acevedo
6081 */
6082 last_ptr = (esc_ptr ? esc_ptr : ptr + STRLEN(ptr)strlen((char *)(ptr))) - 1;
6083 if (last_ptr >= ptr && (*last_ptr == '0' || *last_ptr == '^')
6084 && (no_esc || (*ptr == Ctrl_D4 && count > 1))) {
6085 last = *last_ptr;
6086 *last_ptr = NUL'\000';
6087 }
6088
6089 do {
6090 stuffReadbuff(ptr);
6091 /* a trailing "0" is inserted as "<C-V>048", "^" as "<C-V>^" */
6092 if (last)
6093 stuffReadbuff((char_u *)(last == '0'
6094 ? "\026\060\064\070"
6095 : "\026^"));
6096 } while (--count > 0);
6097
6098 if (last)
6099 *last_ptr = last;
6100
6101 if (esc_ptr != NULL((void*)0))
6102 *esc_ptr = ESC'\033'; /* put the ESC back */
6103
6104 /* may want to stuff a trailing ESC, to get out of Insert mode */
6105 if (!no_esc)
6106 stuffcharReadbuff(ESC'\033');
6107
6108 return OK1;
6109}
6110
6111char_u *get_last_insert(void)
6112{
6113 if (last_insert == NULL((void*)0))
6114 return NULL((void*)0);
6115 return last_insert + last_insert_skip;
6116}
6117
6118/*
6119 * Get last inserted string, and remove trailing <Esc>.
6120 * Returns pointer to allocated memory (must be freed) or NULL.
6121 */
6122char_u *get_last_insert_save(void)
6123{
6124 char_u *s;
6125 int len;
6126
6127 if (last_insert == NULL((void*)0))
6128 return NULL((void*)0);
6129 s = vim_strsave(last_insert + last_insert_skip);
6130 len = (int)STRLEN(s)strlen((char *)(s));
6131 if (len > 0 && s[len - 1] == ESC'\033') /* remove trailing ESC */
6132 s[len - 1] = NUL'\000';
6133
6134 return s;
6135}
6136
6137/*
6138 * Check the word in front of the cursor for an abbreviation.
6139 * Called when the non-id character "c" has been entered.
6140 * When an abbreviation is recognized it is removed from the text and
6141 * the replacement string is inserted in typebuf.tb_buf[], followed by "c".
6142 */
6143static int echeck_abbr(int c)
6144{
6145 /* Don't check for abbreviation in paste mode, when disabled and just
6146 * after moving around with cursor keys. */
6147 if (p_paste || no_abbr || arrow_used)
6148 return FALSE0;
6149
6150 return check_abbr(c, get_cursor_line_ptr(), curwin->w_cursor.col,
6151 curwin->w_cursor.lnum == Insstart.lnum ? Insstart.col : 0);
6152}
6153
6154/*
6155 * replace-stack functions
6156 *
6157 * When replacing characters, the replaced characters are remembered for each
6158 * new character. This is used to re-insert the old text when backspacing.
6159 *
6160 * There is a NUL headed list of characters for each character that is
6161 * currently in the file after the insertion point. When BS is used, one NUL
6162 * headed list is put back for the deleted character.
6163 *
6164 * For a newline, there are two NUL headed lists. One contains the characters
6165 * that the NL replaced. The extra one stores the characters after the cursor
6166 * that were deleted (always white space).
6167 */
6168
6169static char_u *replace_stack = NULL((void*)0);
6170static ssize_t replace_stack_nr = 0; /* next entry in replace stack */
6171static ssize_t replace_stack_len = 0; /* max. number of entries */
6172
6173/// Push character that is replaced onto the the replace stack.
6174///
6175/// replace_offset is normally 0, in which case replace_push will add a new
6176/// character at the end of the stack. If replace_offset is not 0, that many
6177/// characters will be left on the stack above the newly inserted character.
6178///
6179/// @param c character that is replaced (NUL is none)
6180void replace_push(int c)
6181{
6182 if (replace_stack_nr < replace_offset) { // nothing to do
6183 return;
6184 }
6185
6186 if (replace_stack_len <= replace_stack_nr) {
6187 replace_stack_len += 50;
6188 replace_stack = xrealloc(replace_stack, replace_stack_len);
6189 }
6190 char_u *p = replace_stack + replace_stack_nr - replace_offset;
6191 if (replace_offset) {
6192 memmove(p + 1, p, replace_offset);
6193 }
6194 *p = (char_u)c;
6195 ++replace_stack_nr;
6196}
6197
6198/*
6199 * Push a character onto the replace stack. Handles a multi-byte character in
6200 * reverse byte order, so that the first byte is popped off first.
6201 * Return the number of bytes done (includes composing characters).
6202 */
6203int replace_push_mb(char_u *p)
6204{
6205 int l = (*mb_ptr2len)(p);
6206 int j;
6207
6208 for (j = l - 1; j >= 0; --j)
6209 replace_push(p[j]);
6210 return l;
6211}
6212
6213/// Pop one item from the replace stack.
6214///
6215/// @return -1 if stack is empty, replaced character or NUL otherwise
6216static int replace_pop(void)
6217{
6218 return (replace_stack_nr == 0) ? -1 : (int)replace_stack[--replace_stack_nr];
6219}
6220
6221/*
6222 * Join the top two items on the replace stack. This removes to "off"'th NUL
6223 * encountered.
6224 */
6225static void
6226replace_join (
6227 int off /* offset for which NUL to remove */
6228)
6229{
6230 int i;
6231
6232 for (i = replace_stack_nr; --i >= 0; )
6233 if (replace_stack[i] == NUL'\000' && off-- <= 0) {
6234 --replace_stack_nr;
6235 memmove(replace_stack + i, replace_stack + i + 1,
6236 (size_t)(replace_stack_nr - i));
6237 return;
6238 }
6239}
6240
6241/*
6242 * Pop bytes from the replace stack until a NUL is found, and insert them
6243 * before the cursor. Can only be used in REPLACE or VREPLACE mode.
6244 */
6245static void replace_pop_ins(void)
6246{
6247 int cc;
6248 int oldState = State;
6249
6250 State = NORMAL0x01; /* don't want REPLACE here */
6251 while ((cc = replace_pop()) > 0) {
6252 mb_replace_pop_ins(cc);
6253 dec_cursor();
6254 }
6255 State = oldState;
6256}
6257
6258/*
6259 * Insert bytes popped from the replace stack. "cc" is the first byte. If it
6260 * indicates a multi-byte char, pop the other bytes too.
6261 */
6262static void mb_replace_pop_ins(int cc)
6263{
6264 int n;
6265 char_u buf[MB_MAXBYTES21 + 1];
6266 int i;
6267 int c;
6268
6269 if (has_mbyte && (n = MB_BYTE2LEN(cc)mb_bytelen_tab[cc]) > 1) {
6270 buf[0] = cc;
6271 for (i = 1; i < n; ++i)
6272 buf[i] = replace_pop();
6273 ins_bytes_len(buf, n);
6274 } else
6275 ins_char(cc);
6276
6277 if (enc_utf8)
6278 /* Handle composing chars. */
6279 for (;; ) {
6280 c = replace_pop();
6281 if (c == -1) /* stack empty */
6282 break;
6283 if ((n = MB_BYTE2LEN(c)mb_bytelen_tab[c]) == 1) {
6284 /* Not a multi-byte char, put it back. */
6285 replace_push(c);
6286 break;
6287 } else {
6288 buf[0] = c;
6289 for (i = 1; i < n; ++i)
6290 buf[i] = replace_pop();
6291 if (utf_iscomposing(utf_ptr2char(buf)))
6292 ins_bytes_len(buf, n);
6293 else {
6294 /* Not a composing char, put it back. */
6295 for (i = n - 1; i >= 0; --i)
6296 replace_push(buf[i]);
6297 break;
6298 }
6299 }
6300 }
6301}
6302
6303/*
6304 * make the replace stack empty
6305 * (called when exiting replace mode)
6306 */
6307static void replace_flush(void)
6308{
6309 free(replace_stack);
6310 replace_stack = NULL((void*)0);
6311 replace_stack_len = 0;
6312 replace_stack_nr = 0;
6313}
6314
6315/*
6316 * Handle doing a BS for one character.
6317 * cc < 0: replace stack empty, just move cursor
6318 * cc == 0: character was inserted, delete it
6319 * cc > 0: character was replaced, put cc (first byte of original char) back
6320 * and check for more characters to be put back
6321 * When "limit_col" is >= 0, don't delete before this column. Matters when
6322 * using composing characters, use del_char_after_col() instead of del_char().
6323 */
6324static void replace_do_bs(int limit_col)
6325{
6326 int cc;
6327 int orig_len = 0;
6328 int ins_len;
6329 int orig_vcols = 0;
6330 colnr_T start_vcol;
6331 char_u *p;
6332 int i;
6333 int vcol;
6334
6335 cc = replace_pop();
6336 if (cc > 0) {
6337 if (State & VREPLACE_FLAG0x80) {
6338 /* Get the number of screen cells used by the character we are
6339 * going to delete. */
6340 getvcol(curwin, &curwin->w_cursor, NULL((void*)0), &start_vcol, NULL((void*)0));
6341 orig_vcols = chartabsize(get_cursor_pos_ptr(), start_vcol);
6342 }
6343 if (has_mbyte) {
6344 (void)del_char_after_col(limit_col);
6345 if (State & VREPLACE_FLAG0x80)
6346 orig_len = (int)STRLEN(get_cursor_pos_ptr())strlen((char *)(get_cursor_pos_ptr()));
6347 replace_push(cc);
6348 } else {
6349 pchar_cursor(cc);
6350 if (State & VREPLACE_FLAG0x80)
6351 orig_len = (int)STRLEN(get_cursor_pos_ptr())strlen((char *)(get_cursor_pos_ptr())) - 1;
6352 }
6353 replace_pop_ins();
6354
6355 if (State & VREPLACE_FLAG0x80) {
6356 /* Get the number of screen cells used by the inserted characters */
6357 p = get_cursor_pos_ptr();
6358 ins_len = (int)STRLEN(p)strlen((char *)(p)) - orig_len;
6359 vcol = start_vcol;
6360 for (i = 0; i < ins_len; ++i) {
6361 vcol += chartabsize(p + i, vcol);
6362 i += (*mb_ptr2len)(p) - 1;
6363 }
6364 vcol -= start_vcol;
6365
6366 /* Delete spaces that were inserted after the cursor to keep the
6367 * text aligned. */
6368 curwin->w_cursor.col += ins_len;
6369 while (vcol > orig_vcols && gchar_cursor() == ' ') {
6370 del_char(FALSE0);
6371 ++orig_vcols;
6372 }
6373 curwin->w_cursor.col -= ins_len;
6374 }
6375
6376 /* mark the buffer as changed and prepare for displaying */
6377 changed_bytes(curwin->w_cursor.lnum, curwin->w_cursor.col);
6378 } else if (cc == 0)
6379 (void)del_char_after_col(limit_col);
6380}
6381
6382/*
6383 * Return TRUE if C-indenting is on.
6384 */
6385static int cindent_on(void) {
6386 return !p_paste && (curbuf->b_p_cin
6387 || *curbuf->b_p_inde != NUL'\000'
6388 );
6389}
6390
6391/*
6392 * Re-indent the current line, based on the current contents of it and the
6393 * surrounding lines. Fixing the cursor position seems really easy -- I'm very
6394 * confused what all the part that handles Control-T is doing that I'm not.
6395 * "get_the_indent" should be get_c_indent, get_expr_indent or get_lisp_indent.
6396 */
6397void fixthisline(IndentGetter get_the_indent)
6398{
6399 change_indent(INDENT_SET1, get_the_indent(), FALSE0, 0, TRUE1);
6400 if (linewhite(curwin->w_cursor.lnum))
6401 did_ai = TRUE1; /* delete the indent if the line stays empty */
6402}
6403
6404void fix_indent(void) {
6405 if (p_paste)
6406 return;
6407 if (curbuf->b_p_lisp && curbuf->b_p_ai)
6408 fixthisline(get_lisp_indent);
6409 else if (cindent_on())
6410 do_c_expr_indent();
6411}
6412
6413/*
6414 * return TRUE if 'cinkeys' contains the key "keytyped",
6415 * when == '*': Only if key is preceded with '*' (indent before insert)
6416 * when == '!': Only if key is preceded with '!' (don't insert)
6417 * when == ' ': Only if key is not preceded with '*'(indent afterwards)
6418 *
6419 * "keytyped" can have a few special values:
6420 * KEY_OPEN_FORW
6421 * KEY_OPEN_BACK
6422 * KEY_COMPLETE just finished completion.
6423 *
6424 * If line_is_empty is TRUE accept keys with '0' before them.
6425 */
6426int in_cinkeys(int keytyped, int when, int line_is_empty)
6427{
6428 char_u *look;
6429 int try_match;
6430 int try_match_word;
6431 char_u *p;
6432 char_u *line;
6433 int icase;
6434 int i;
6435
6436 if (keytyped == NUL'\000')
6437 /* Can happen with CTRL-Y and CTRL-E on a short line. */
6438 return FALSE0;
6439
6440 if (*curbuf->b_p_inde != NUL'\000')
6441 look = curbuf->b_p_indk; /* 'indentexpr' set: use 'indentkeys' */
6442 else
6443 look = curbuf->b_p_cink; /* 'indentexpr' empty: use 'cinkeys' */
6444 while (*look) {
6445 /*
6446 * Find out if we want to try a match with this key, depending on
6447 * 'when' and a '*' or '!' before the key.
6448 */
6449 switch (when) {
6450 case '*': try_match = (*look == '*'); break;
6451 case '!': try_match = (*look == '!'); break;
6452 default: try_match = (*look != '*'); break;
6453 }
6454 if (*look == '*' || *look == '!')
6455 ++look;
6456
6457 /*
6458 * If there is a '0', only accept a match if the line is empty.
6459 * But may still match when typing last char of a word.
6460 */
6461 if (*look == '0') {
6462 try_match_word = try_match;
6463 if (!line_is_empty)
6464 try_match = FALSE0;
6465 ++look;
6466 } else
6467 try_match_word = FALSE0;
6468
6469 /*
6470 * does it look like a control character?
6471 */
6472 if (*look == '^'
6473 && look[1] >= '?' && look[1] <= '_'
6474 ) {
6475 if (try_match && keytyped == Ctrl_chr(look[1])((((look[1]) < 'a' || (look[1]) > 'z') ? (look[1]) : (look
[1]) - ('a' - 'A')) ^ 0x40))
6476 return TRUE1;
6477 look += 2;
6478 }
6479 /*
6480 * 'o' means "o" command, open forward.
6481 * 'O' means "O" command, open backward.
6482 */
6483 else if (*look == 'o') {
6484 if (try_match && keytyped == KEY_OPEN_FORW0x101)
6485 return TRUE1;
6486 ++look;
6487 } else if (*look == 'O') {
6488 if (try_match && keytyped == KEY_OPEN_BACK0x102)
6489 return TRUE1;
6490 ++look;
6491 }
6492 /*
6493 * 'e' means to check for "else" at start of line and just before the
6494 * cursor.
6495 */
6496 else if (*look == 'e') {
6497 if (try_match && keytyped == 'e' && curwin->w_cursor.col >= 4) {
6498 p = get_cursor_line_ptr();
6499 if (skipwhite(p) == p + curwin->w_cursor.col - 4 &&
6500 STRNCMP(p + curwin->w_cursor.col - 4, "else", 4)strncmp((char *)(p + curwin->w_cursor.col - 4), (char *)("else"
), (size_t)(4)) == 0)
6501 return TRUE1;
6502 }
6503 ++look;
6504 }
6505 /*
6506 * ':' only causes an indent if it is at the end of a label or case
6507 * statement, or when it was before typing the ':' (to fix
6508 * class::method for C++).
6509 */
6510 else if (*look == ':') {
6511 if (try_match && keytyped == ':') {
6512 p = get_cursor_line_ptr();
6513 if (cin_iscase(p, FALSE0) || cin_isscopedecl(p) || cin_islabel())
6514 return TRUE1;
6515 /* Need to get the line again after cin_islabel(). */
6516 p = get_cursor_line_ptr();
6517 if (curwin->w_cursor.col > 2
6518 && p[curwin->w_cursor.col - 1] == ':'
6519 && p[curwin->w_cursor.col - 2] == ':') {
6520 p[curwin->w_cursor.col - 1] = ' ';
6521 i = (cin_iscase(p, FALSE0) || cin_isscopedecl(p)
6522 || cin_islabel());
6523 p = get_cursor_line_ptr();
6524 p[curwin->w_cursor.col - 1] = ':';
6525 if (i)
6526 return TRUE1;
6527 }
6528 }
6529 ++look;
6530 }
6531 /*
6532 * Is it a key in <>, maybe?
6533 */
6534 else if (*look == '<') {
6535 if (try_match) {
6536 /*
6537 * make up some named keys <o>, <O>, <e>, <0>, <>>, <<>, <*>,
6538 * <:> and <!> so that people can re-indent on o, O, e, 0, <,
6539 * >, *, : and ! keys if they really really want to.
6540 */
6541 if (vim_strchr((char_u *)"<>!*oOe0:", look[1]) != NULL((void*)0)
6542 && keytyped == look[1])
6543 return TRUE1;
6544
6545 if (keytyped == get_special_key_code(look + 1))
6546 return TRUE1;
6547 }
6548 while (*look && *look != '>')
6549 look++;
6550 while (*look == '>')
6551 look++;
6552 }
6553 /*
6554 * Is it a word: "=word"?
6555 */
6556 else if (*look == '=' && look[1] != ',' && look[1] != NUL'\000') {
6557 ++look;
6558 if (*look == '~') {
6559 icase = TRUE1;
6560 ++look;
6561 } else
6562 icase = FALSE0;
6563 p = vim_strchr(look, ',');
6564 if (p == NULL((void*)0))
6565 p = look + STRLEN(look)strlen((char *)(look));
6566 if ((try_match || try_match_word)
6567 && curwin->w_cursor.col >= (colnr_T)(p - look)) {
6568 int match = FALSE0;
6569
6570 if (keytyped == KEY_COMPLETE0x103) {
6571 char_u *s;
6572
6573 /* Just completed a word, check if it starts with "look".
6574 * search back for the start of a word. */
6575 line = get_cursor_line_ptr();
6576 if (has_mbyte) {
6577 char_u *n;
6578
6579 for (s = line + curwin->w_cursor.col; s > line; s = n) {
6580 n = mb_prevptr(line, s);
6581 if (!vim_iswordp(n))
6582 break;
6583 }
6584 } else
6585 for (s = line + curwin->w_cursor.col; s > line; --s)
6586 if (!vim_iswordc(s[-1]))
6587 break;
6588 if (s + (p - look) <= line + curwin->w_cursor.col
6589 && (icase
6590 ? MB_STRNICMP(s, look, p - look)mb_strnicmp((char_u *)(s), (char_u *)(look), (int)(p - look))
6591 : STRNCMP(s, look, p - look)strncmp((char *)(s), (char *)(look), (size_t)(p - look))) == 0)
6592 match = TRUE1;
6593 } else
6594 /* TODO: multi-byte */
6595 if (keytyped == (int)p[-1] || (icase && keytyped < 256
6596 && TOLOWER_LOCtolower(keytyped) ==
6597 TOLOWER_LOCtolower((int)p[-1]))) {
6598 line = get_cursor_pos_ptr();
6599 if ((curwin->w_cursor.col == (colnr_T)(p - look)
6600 || !vim_iswordc(line[-(p - look) - 1]))
6601 && (icase
6602 ? MB_STRNICMP(line - (p - look), look, p - look)mb_strnicmp((char_u *)(line - (p - look)), (char_u *)(look), (
int)(p - look))
6603 : STRNCMP(line - (p - look), look, p - look)strncmp((char *)(line - (p - look)), (char *)(look), (size_t)
(p - look)))
6604 == 0)
6605 match = TRUE1;
6606 }
6607 if (match && try_match_word && !try_match) {
6608 /* "0=word": Check if there are only blanks before the
6609 * word. */
6610 line = get_cursor_line_ptr();
6611 if ((int)(skipwhite(line) - line) !=
6612 (int)(curwin->w_cursor.col - (p - look)))
6613 match = FALSE0;
6614 }
6615 if (match)
6616 return TRUE1;
6617 }
6618 look = p;
6619 }
6620 /*
6621 * ok, it's a boring generic character.
6622 */
6623 else {
6624 if (try_match && *look == keytyped)
6625 return TRUE1;
6626 ++look;
6627 }
6628
6629 /*
6630 * Skip over ", ".
6631 */
6632 look = skip_to_option_part(look);
6633 }
6634 return FALSE0;
6635}
6636
6637/*
6638 * Map Hebrew keyboard when in hkmap mode.
6639 */
6640int hkmap(int c)
6641{
6642 if (p_hkmapp) { /* phonetic mapping, by Ilya Dogolazky */
6643 enum {hALEF=0, BET, GIMEL, DALET, HEI, VAV, ZAIN, HET, TET, IUD,
6644 KAFsofit, hKAF, LAMED, MEMsofit, MEM, NUNsofit, NUN, SAMEH, AIN,
6645 PEIsofit, PEI, ZADIsofit, ZADI, KOF, RESH, hSHIN, TAV};
6646 static char_u map[26] =
6647 {(char_u)hALEF /*a*/, (char_u)BET /*b*/, (char_u)hKAF /*c*/,
6648 (char_u)DALET /*d*/, (char_u)-1 /*e*/, (char_u)PEIsofit /*f*/,
6649 (char_u)GIMEL /*g*/, (char_u)HEI /*h*/, (char_u)IUD /*i*/,
6650 (char_u)HET /*j*/, (char_u)KOF /*k*/, (char_u)LAMED /*l*/,
6651 (char_u)MEM /*m*/, (char_u)NUN /*n*/, (char_u)SAMEH /*o*/,
6652 (char_u)PEI /*p*/, (char_u)-1 /*q*/, (char_u)RESH /*r*/,
6653 (char_u)ZAIN /*s*/, (char_u)TAV /*t*/, (char_u)TET /*u*/,
6654 (char_u)VAV /*v*/, (char_u)hSHIN /*w*/, (char_u)-1 /*x*/,
6655 (char_u)AIN /*y*/, (char_u)ZADI /*z*/};
6656
6657 if (c == 'N' || c == 'M' || c == 'P' || c == 'C' || c == 'Z')
6658 return (int)(map[CharOrd(c)((c) < 'a' ? (c) - 'A' : (c) - 'a')] - 1 + p_aleph);
6659 /* '-1'='sofit' */
6660 else if (c == 'x')
6661 return 'X';
6662 else if (c == 'q')
6663 return '\''; /* {geresh}={'} */
6664 else if (c == 246)
6665 return ' '; /* \"o --> ' ' for a german keyboard */
6666 else if (c == 228)
6667 return ' '; /* \"a --> ' ' -- / -- */
6668 else if (c == 252)
6669 return ' '; /* \"u --> ' ' -- / -- */
6670 /* NOTE: islower() does not do the right thing for us on Linux so we
6671 * do this the same was as 5.7 and previous, so it works correctly on
6672 * all systems. Specifically, the e.g. Delete and Arrow keys are
6673 * munged and won't work if e.g. searching for Hebrew text.
6674 */
6675 else if (c >= 'a' && c <= 'z')
6676 return (int)(map[CharOrdLow(c)((c) - 'a')] + p_aleph);
6677 else
6678 return c;
6679 } else {
6680 switch (c) {
6681 case '`': return ';';
6682 case '/': return '.';
6683 case '\'': return ',';
6684 case 'q': return '/';
6685 case 'w': return '\'';
6686
6687 /* Hebrew letters - set offset from 'a' */
6688 case ',': c = '{'; break;
6689 case '.': c = 'v'; break;
6690 case ';': c = 't'; break;
6691 default: {
6692 static char str[] = "zqbcxlsjphmkwonu ydafe rig";
6693
6694 if (c < 'a' || c > 'z')
6695 return c;
6696 c = str[CharOrdLow(c)((c) - 'a')];
6697 break;
6698 }
6699 }
6700
6701 return (int)(CharOrdLow(c)((c) - 'a') + p_aleph);
6702 }
6703}
6704
6705static void ins_reg(void)
6706{
6707 int need_redraw = FALSE0;
6708 int regname;
6709 int literally = 0;
6710 int vis_active = VIsual_active;
6711
6712 /*
6713 * If we are going to wait for a character, show a '"'.
6714 */
6715 pc_status = PC_STATUS_UNSET0;
6716 if (redrawing() && !char_avail()) {
6717 /* may need to redraw when no more chars available now */
6718 ins_redraw(FALSE0);
6719
6720 edit_putchar('"', TRUE1);
6721 add_to_showcmd_c(Ctrl_R18);
6722 }
6723
6724#ifdef USE_ON_FLY_SCROLL
6725 dont_scroll = TRUE1; /* disallow scrolling here */
6726#endif
6727
6728 /*
6729 * Don't map the register name. This also prevents the mode message to be
6730 * deleted when ESC is hit.
6731 */
6732 ++no_mapping;
6733 regname = plain_vgetc();
6734 LANGMAP_ADJUST(regname, TRUE)do { if (*p_langmap && (1) && !KeyStuffed &&
(regname) >= 0) { if ((regname) < 256) regname = langmap_mapchar
[regname]; else regname = langmap_adjust_mb(regname); } } while
(0);
6735 if (regname == Ctrl_R18 || regname == Ctrl_O15 || regname == Ctrl_P16) {
6736 /* Get a third key for literal register insertion */
6737 literally = regname;
6738 add_to_showcmd_c(literally);
6739 regname = plain_vgetc();
6740 LANGMAP_ADJUST(regname, TRUE)do { if (*p_langmap && (1) && !KeyStuffed &&
(regname) >= 0) { if ((regname) < 256) regname = langmap_mapchar
[regname]; else regname = langmap_adjust_mb(regname); } } while
(0);
6741 }
6742 --no_mapping;
6743
6744 /* Don't call u_sync() while typing the expression or giving an error
6745 * message for it. Only call it explicitly. */
6746 ++no_u_sync;
6747 if (regname == '=') {
6748# ifdef USE_IM_CONTROL
6749 int im_on = im_get_status();
6750# endif
6751 /* Sync undo when evaluating the expression calls setline() or
6752 * append(), so that it can be undone separately. */
6753 u_sync_once = 2;
6754
6755 regname = get_expr_register();
6756# ifdef USE_IM_CONTROL
6757 /* Restore the Input Method. */
6758 if (im_on)
6759 im_set_active(TRUE1);
6760# endif
6761 }
6762 if (regname == NUL'\000' || !valid_yank_reg(regname, FALSE0)) {
6763 vim_beep();
6764 need_redraw = TRUE1; /* remove the '"' */
6765 } else {
6766 if (literally == Ctrl_O15 || literally == Ctrl_P16) {
6767 /* Append the command to the redo buffer. */
6768 AppendCharToRedobuff(Ctrl_R18);
6769 AppendCharToRedobuff(literally);
6770 AppendCharToRedobuff(regname);
6771
6772 do_put(regname, BACKWARD(-1), 1L,
6773 (literally == Ctrl_P16 ? PUT_FIXINDENT1 : 0) | PUT_CURSEND2);
6774 } else if (insert_reg(regname, literally) == FAIL0) {
6775 vim_beep();
6776 need_redraw = TRUE1; /* remove the '"' */
6777 } else if (stop_insert_mode)
6778 /* When the '=' register was used and a function was invoked that
6779 * did ":stopinsert" then stuff_empty() returns FALSE but we won't
6780 * insert anything, need to remove the '"' */
6781 need_redraw = TRUE1;
6782
6783 }
6784 --no_u_sync;
6785 if (u_sync_once == 1)
6786 ins_need_undo = TRUE1;
6787 u_sync_once = 0;
6788 clear_showcmd();
6789
6790 /* If the inserted register is empty, we need to remove the '"' */
6791 if (need_redraw || stuff_empty())
6792 edit_unputchar();
6793
6794 /* Disallow starting Visual mode here, would get a weird mode. */
6795 if (!vis_active && VIsual_active)
6796 end_visual_mode();
6797}
6798
6799/*
6800 * CTRL-G commands in Insert mode.
6801 */
6802static void ins_ctrl_g(void)
6803{
6804 int c;
6805
6806 /* Right after CTRL-X the cursor will be after the ruler. */
6807 setcursor();
6808
6809 /*
6810 * Don't map the second key. This also prevents the mode message to be
6811 * deleted when ESC is hit.
6812 */
6813 ++no_mapping;
6814 c = plain_vgetc();
6815 --no_mapping;
6816 switch (c) {
6817 /* CTRL-G k and CTRL-G <Up>: cursor up to Insstart.col */
6818 case K_UP(-(('k') + ((int)('u') << 8))):
6819 case Ctrl_K11:
6820 case 'k': ins_up(TRUE1);
6821 break;
6822
6823 /* CTRL-G j and CTRL-G <Down>: cursor down to Insstart.col */
6824 case K_DOWN(-(('k') + ((int)('d') << 8))):
6825 case Ctrl_J10:
6826 case 'j': ins_down(TRUE1);
6827 break;
6828
6829 /* CTRL-G u: start new undoable edit */
6830 case 'u': u_sync(TRUE1);
6831 ins_need_undo = TRUE1;
6832
6833 /* Need to reset Insstart, esp. because a BS that joins
6834 * a line to the previous one must save for undo. */
6835 update_Insstart_orig = false0;
6836 Insstart = curwin->w_cursor;
6837 break;
6838
6839 /* Unknown CTRL-G command, reserved for future expansion. */
6840 default: vim_beep();
6841 }
6842}
6843
6844/*
6845 * CTRL-^ in Insert mode.
6846 */
6847static void ins_ctrl_hat(void)
6848{
6849 if (map_to_exists_mode((char_u *)"", LANGMAP0x20, FALSE0)) {
6850 /* ":lmap" mappings exists, Toggle use of ":lmap" mappings. */
6851 if (State & LANGMAP0x20) {
6852 curbuf->b_p_iminsert = B_IMODE_NONE0;
6853 State &= ~LANGMAP0x20;
6854 } else {
6855 curbuf->b_p_iminsert = B_IMODE_LMAP1;
6856 State |= LANGMAP0x20;
6857#ifdef USE_IM_CONTROL
6858 im_set_active(FALSE0);
6859#endif
6860 }
6861 }
6862#ifdef USE_IM_CONTROL
6863 else {
6864 /* There are no ":lmap" mappings, toggle IM */
6865 if (im_get_status()) {
6866 curbuf->b_p_iminsert = B_IMODE_NONE0;
6867 im_set_active(FALSE0);
6868 } else {
6869 curbuf->b_p_iminsert = B_IMODE_IM;
6870 State &= ~LANGMAP0x20;
6871 im_set_active(TRUE1);
6872 }
6873 }
6874#endif
6875 set_iminsert_global();
6876 showmode();
6877 /* Show/unshow value of 'keymap' in status lines. */
6878 status_redraw_curbuf();
6879}
6880
6881/*
6882 * Handle ESC in insert mode.
6883 * Returns TRUE when leaving insert mode, FALSE when going to repeat the
6884 * insert.
6885 */
6886static int
6887ins_esc (
6888 long *count,
6889 int cmdchar,
6890 int nomove /* don't move cursor */
6891)
6892{
6893 int temp;
6894 static int disabled_redraw = FALSE0;
6895
6896 check_spell_redraw();
6897
6898 temp = curwin->w_cursor.col;
6899 if (disabled_redraw) {
6900 --RedrawingDisabled;
6901 disabled_redraw = FALSE0;
6902 }
6903 if (!arrow_used) {
6904 /*
6905 * Don't append the ESC for "r<CR>" and "grx".
6906 * When 'insertmode' is set only CTRL-L stops Insert mode. Needed for
6907 * when "count" is non-zero.
6908 */
6909 if (cmdchar != 'r' && cmdchar != 'v')
6910 AppendToRedobuff(p_im ? (char_u *)"\014" : ESC_STR(char_u *)"\033");
6911
6912 /*
6913 * Repeating insert may take a long time. Check for
6914 * interrupt now and then.
6915 */
6916 if (*count > 0) {
6917 line_breakcheck();
6918 if (got_int)
6919 *count = 0;
6920 }
6921
6922 if (--*count > 0) { /* repeat what was typed */
6923 /* Vi repeats the insert without replacing characters. */
6924 if (vim_strchr(p_cpo, CPO_REPLCNT'X') != NULL((void*)0))
6925 State &= ~REPLACE_FLAG0x40;
6926
6927 (void)start_redo_ins();
6928 if (cmdchar == 'r' || cmdchar == 'v') {
6929 stuffRedoReadbuff(ESC_STR(char_u *)"\033"); // No ESC in redo buffer
6930 }
6931 ++RedrawingDisabled;
6932 disabled_redraw = TRUE1;
6933 return FALSE0; /* repeat the insert */
6934 }
6935 stop_insert(&curwin->w_cursor, TRUE1, nomove);
6936 undisplay_dollar();
6937 }
6938
6939 /* When an autoindent was removed, curswant stays after the
6940 * indent */
6941 if (restart_edit == NUL'\000' && (colnr_T)temp == curwin->w_cursor.col)
6942 curwin->w_set_curswant = TRUE1;
6943
6944 /* Remember the last Insert position in the '^ mark. */
6945 if (!cmdmod.keepjumps)
6946 curbuf->b_last_insert = curwin->w_cursor;
6947
6948 /*
6949 * The cursor should end up on the last inserted character.
6950 * Don't do it for CTRL-O, unless past the end of the line.
6951 */
6952 if (!nomove
6953 && (curwin->w_cursor.col != 0
6954 || curwin->w_cursor.coladd > 0
6955 )
6956 && (restart_edit == NUL'\000'
6957 || (gchar_cursor() == NUL'\000'
6958 && !VIsual_active
6959 ))
6960 && !revins_on
6961 ) {
6962 if (curwin->w_cursor.coladd > 0 || ve_flags == VE_ALL4) {
6963 oneleft();
6964 if (restart_edit != NUL'\000')
6965 ++curwin->w_cursor.coladd;
6966 } else {
6967 --curwin->w_cursor.col;
6968 /* Correct cursor for multi-byte character. */
6969 if (has_mbyte)
6970 mb_adjust_cursor();
6971 }
6972 }
6973
6974#ifdef USE_IM_CONTROL
6975 /* Disable IM to allow typing English directly for Normal mode commands.
6976 * When ":lmap" is enabled don't change 'iminsert' (IM can be enabled as
6977 * well). */
6978 if (!(State & LANGMAP0x20))
6979 im_save_status(&curbuf->b_p_iminsert);
6980 im_set_active(FALSE0);
6981#endif
6982
6983 State = NORMAL0x01;
6984 /* need to position cursor again (e.g. when on a TAB ) */
6985 changed_cline_bef_curs();
6986
6987 setmouse();
6988 ui_cursor_shape(); /* may show different cursor shape */
6989
6990 /*
6991 * When recording or for CTRL-O, need to display the new mode.
6992 * Otherwise remove the mode message.
6993 */
6994 if (Recording || restart_edit != NUL'\000')
6995 showmode();
6996 else if (p_smd)
6997 MSG("")msg((char_u *)(""));
6998
6999 return TRUE1; /* exit Insert mode */
7000}
7001
7002/*
7003 * Toggle language: hkmap and revins_on.
7004 * Move to end of reverse inserted text.
7005 */
7006static void ins_ctrl_(void)
7007{
7008 if (revins_on && revins_chars && revins_scol >= 0) {
7009 while (gchar_cursor() != NUL'\000' && revins_chars--)
7010 ++curwin->w_cursor.col;
7011 }
7012 p_ri = !p_ri;
7013 revins_on = (State == INSERT0x10 && p_ri);
7014 if (revins_on) {
7015 revins_scol = curwin->w_cursor.col;
7016 revins_legal++;
7017 revins_chars = 0;
7018 undisplay_dollar();
7019 } else
7020 revins_scol = -1;
7021 if (p_altkeymap) {
7022 /*
7023 * to be consistent also for redo command, using '.'
7024 * set arrow_used to true and stop it - causing to redo
7025 * characters entered in one mode (normal/reverse insert).
7026 */
7027 arrow_used = TRUE1;
7028 (void)stop_arrow();
7029 p_fkmap = curwin->w_p_rlw_onebuf_opt.wo_rl ^ p_ri;
7030 if (p_fkmap && p_ri)
7031 State = INSERT0x10;
7032 } else
7033 p_hkmap = curwin->w_p_rlw_onebuf_opt.wo_rl ^ p_ri; /* be consistent! */
7034 showmode();
7035}
7036
7037/*
7038 * If 'keymodel' contains "startsel", may start selection.
7039 * Returns TRUE when a CTRL-O and other keys stuffed.
7040 */
7041static int ins_start_select(int c)
7042{
7043 if (km_startsel)
7044 switch (c) {
7045 case K_KHOME(-(('K') + ((int)('1') << 8))):
7046 case K_KEND(-(('K') + ((int)('4') << 8))):
7047 case K_PAGEUP(-(('k') + ((int)('P') << 8))):
7048 case K_KPAGEUP(-(('K') + ((int)('3') << 8))):
7049 case K_PAGEDOWN(-(('k') + ((int)('N') << 8))):
7050 case K_KPAGEDOWN(-(('K') + ((int)('5') << 8))):
7051 if (!(mod_mask & MOD_MASK_SHIFT0x02))
7052 break;
7053 /* FALLTHROUGH */
7054 case K_S_LEFT(-(('#') + ((int)('4') << 8))):
7055 case K_S_RIGHT(-(('%') + ((int)('i') << 8))):
7056 case K_S_UP(-((253) + ((int)(KE_S_UP) << 8))):
7057 case K_S_DOWN(-((253) + ((int)(KE_S_DOWN) << 8))):
7058 case K_S_END(-(('*') + ((int)('7') << 8))):
7059 case K_S_HOME(-(('#') + ((int)('2') << 8))):
7060 /* Start selection right away, the cursor can move with
7061 * CTRL-O when beyond the end of the line. */
7062 start_selection();
7063
7064 /* Execute the key in (insert) Select mode. */
7065 stuffcharReadbuff(Ctrl_O15);
7066 if (mod_mask) {
7067 char_u buf[4];
7068
7069 buf[0] = K_SPECIAL(0x80);
7070 buf[1] = KS_MODIFIER252;
7071 buf[2] = mod_mask;
7072 buf[3] = NUL'\000';
7073 stuffReadbuff(buf);
7074 }
7075 stuffcharReadbuff(c);
7076 return TRUE1;
7077 }
7078 return FALSE0;
7079}
7080
7081/*
7082 * <Insert> key in Insert mode: toggle insert/replace mode.
7083 */
7084static void ins_insert(int replaceState)
7085{
7086 if (p_fkmap && p_ri) {
7087 beep_flush();
7088 EMSG(farsi_text_3)emsg((char_u *)(farsi_text_3)); /* encoded in Farsi */
7089 return;
7090 }
7091
7092 set_vim_var_string(VV_INSERTMODE,
7093 (char_u *)((State & REPLACE_FLAG0x40) ? "i" :
7094 replaceState == VREPLACE(0x40 + 0x80 + 0x10) ? "v" :
7095 "r"), 1);
7096 apply_autocmds(EVENT_INSERTCHANGE, NULL((void*)0), NULL((void*)0), FALSE0, curbuf);
7097 if (State & REPLACE_FLAG0x40)
7098 State = INSERT0x10 | (State & LANGMAP0x20);
7099 else
7100 State = replaceState | (State & LANGMAP0x20);
7101 AppendCharToRedobuff(K_INS(-(('k') + ((int)('I') << 8))));
7102 showmode();
7103 ui_cursor_shape(); /* may show different cursor shape */
7104}
7105
7106/*
7107 * Pressed CTRL-O in Insert mode.
7108 */
7109static void ins_ctrl_o(void)
7110{
7111 if (State & VREPLACE_FLAG0x80)
7112 restart_edit = 'V';
7113 else if (State & REPLACE_FLAG0x40)
7114 restart_edit = 'R';
7115 else
7116 restart_edit = 'I';
7117 if (virtual_active())
7118 ins_at_eol = FALSE0; /* cursor always keeps its column */
7119 else
7120 ins_at_eol = (gchar_cursor() == NUL'\000');
7121}
7122
7123/*
7124 * If the cursor is on an indent, ^T/^D insert/delete one
7125 * shiftwidth. Otherwise ^T/^D behave like a "<<" or ">>".
7126 * Always round the indent to 'shiftwidth', this is compatible
7127 * with vi. But vi only supports ^T and ^D after an
7128 * autoindent, we support it everywhere.
7129 */
7130static void ins_shift(int c, int lastc)
7131{
7132 if (stop_arrow() == FAIL0)
7133 return;
7134 AppendCharToRedobuff(c);
7135
7136 /*
7137 * 0^D and ^^D: remove all indent.
7138 */
7139 if (c == Ctrl_D4 && (lastc == '0' || lastc == '^')
7140 && curwin->w_cursor.col > 0) {
7141 --curwin->w_cursor.col;
7142 (void)del_char(FALSE0); /* delete the '^' or '0' */
7143 /* In Replace mode, restore the characters that '^' or '0' replaced. */
7144 if (State & REPLACE_FLAG0x40)
7145 replace_pop_ins();
7146 if (lastc == '^')
7147 old_indent = get_indent(); /* remember curr. indent */
7148 change_indent(INDENT_SET1, 0, TRUE1, 0, TRUE1);
7149 } else
7150 change_indent(c == Ctrl_D4 ? INDENT_DEC3 : INDENT_INC2, 0, TRUE1, 0, TRUE1);
7151
7152 if (did_ai && *skipwhite(get_cursor_line_ptr()) != NUL'\000')
7153 did_ai = FALSE0;
7154 did_si = FALSE0;
7155 can_si = FALSE0;
7156 can_si_back = FALSE0;
7157 can_cindent = FALSE0; /* no cindenting after ^D or ^T */
7158}
7159
7160static void ins_del(void)
7161{
7162 int temp;
7163
7164 if (stop_arrow() == FAIL0)
7165 return;
7166 if (gchar_cursor() == NUL'\000') { /* delete newline */
7167 temp = curwin->w_cursor.col;
7168 if (!can_bs(BS_EOL'o') // only if "eol" included
7169 || do_join(2, FALSE0, TRUE1, FALSE0, false0) == FAIL0) {
7170 vim_beep();
7171 } else {
7172 curwin->w_cursor.col = temp;
7173 }
7174 } else if (del_char(FALSE0) == FAIL0) /* delete char under cursor */
7175 vim_beep();
7176 did_ai = FALSE0;
7177 did_si = FALSE0;
7178 can_si = FALSE0;
7179 can_si_back = FALSE0;
7180 AppendCharToRedobuff(K_DEL(-(('k') + ((int)('D') << 8))));
7181}
7182
7183
7184/*
7185 * Delete one character for ins_bs().
7186 */
7187static void ins_bs_one(colnr_T *vcolp)
7188{
7189 dec_cursor();
7190 getvcol(curwin, &curwin->w_cursor, vcolp, NULL((void*)0), NULL((void*)0));
7191 if (State & REPLACE_FLAG0x40) {
7192 /* Don't delete characters before the insert point when in
7193 * Replace mode */
7194 if (curwin->w_cursor.lnum != Insstart.lnum
7195 || curwin->w_cursor.col >= Insstart.col)
7196 replace_do_bs(-1);
7197 } else
7198 (void)del_char(FALSE0);
7199}
7200
7201/*
7202 * Handle Backspace, delete-word and delete-line in Insert mode.
7203 * Return TRUE when backspace was actually used.
7204 */
7205static int ins_bs(int c, int mode, int *inserted_space_p)
7206{
7207 linenr_T lnum;
7208 int cc;
7209 int temp = 0; /* init for GCC */
7210 colnr_T save_col;
7211 colnr_T mincol;
7212 int did_backspace = FALSE0;
7213 int in_indent;
7214 int oldState;
7215 int cpc[MAX_MCO6]; /* composing characters */
7216
7217 /*
7218 * can't delete anything in an empty file
7219 * can't backup past first character in buffer
7220 * can't backup past starting point unless 'backspace' > 1
7221 * can backup to a previous line if 'backspace' == 0
7222 */
7223 if ( bufempty()(curbuf->b_ml.ml_line_count == 1 && *ml_get((linenr_T
)1) == '\000')
7224 || (
7225 !revins_on &&
7226 ((curwin->w_cursor.lnum == 1 && curwin->w_cursor.col == 0)
7227 || (!can_bs(BS_START's')
7228 && (arrow_used
7229 || (curwin->w_cursor.lnum == Insstart_orig.lnum
7230 && curwin->w_cursor.col <= Insstart_orig.col)))
7231 || (!can_bs(BS_INDENT'i') && !arrow_used && ai_col > 0
7232 && curwin->w_cursor.col <= ai_col)
7233 || (!can_bs(BS_EOL'o') && curwin->w_cursor.col == 0)))) {
7234 vim_beep();
7235 return FALSE0;
7236 }
7237
7238 if (stop_arrow() == FAIL0)
7239 return FALSE0;
7240 in_indent = inindent(0);
7241 if (in_indent)
7242 can_cindent = FALSE0;
7243 end_comment_pending = NUL'\000'; /* After BS, don't auto-end comment */
7244 if (revins_on) /* put cursor after last inserted char */
7245 inc_cursor();
7246
7247 /* Virtualedit:
7248 * BACKSPACE_CHAR eats a virtual space
7249 * BACKSPACE_WORD eats all coladd
7250 * BACKSPACE_LINE eats all coladd and keeps going
7251 */
7252 if (curwin->w_cursor.coladd > 0) {
7253 if (mode == BACKSPACE_CHAR1) {
7254 --curwin->w_cursor.coladd;
7255 return TRUE1;
7256 }
7257 if (mode == BACKSPACE_WORD2) {
7258 curwin->w_cursor.coladd = 0;
7259 return TRUE1;
7260 }
7261 curwin->w_cursor.coladd = 0;
7262 }
7263
7264 /*
7265 * delete newline!
7266 */
7267 if (curwin->w_cursor.col == 0) {
7268 lnum = Insstart_orig.lnum;
7269 if (curwin->w_cursor.lnum == lnum || revins_on) {
7270 if (u_save((linenr_T)(curwin->w_cursor.lnum - 2),
7271 (linenr_T)(curwin->w_cursor.lnum + 1)) == FAIL0) {
7272 return FALSE0;
7273 }
7274 --Insstart_orig.lnum;
7275 Insstart_orig.col = MAXCOL(0x7fffffffL);
7276 Insstart = Insstart_orig;
7277 }
7278 /*
7279 * In replace mode:
7280 * cc < 0: NL was inserted, delete it
7281 * cc >= 0: NL was replaced, put original characters back
7282 */
7283 cc = -1;
7284 if (State & REPLACE_FLAG0x40)
7285 cc = replace_pop(); /* returns -1 if NL was inserted */
7286 /*
7287 * In replace mode, in the line we started replacing, we only move the
7288 * cursor.
7289 */
7290 if ((State & REPLACE_FLAG0x40) && curwin->w_cursor.lnum <= lnum) {
7291 dec_cursor();
7292 } else {
7293 if (!(State & VREPLACE_FLAG0x80)
7294 || curwin->w_cursor.lnum > orig_line_count) {
7295 temp = gchar_cursor(); /* remember current char */
7296 --curwin->w_cursor.lnum;
7297
7298 /* When "aw" is in 'formatoptions' we must delete the space at
7299 * the end of the line, otherwise the line will be broken
7300 * again when auto-formatting. */
7301 if (has_format_option(FO_AUTO'a')
7302 && has_format_option(FO_WHITE_PAR'w')) {
7303 char_u *ptr = ml_get_buf(curbuf, curwin->w_cursor.lnum,
7304 TRUE1);
7305 int len;
7306
7307 len = (int)STRLEN(ptr)strlen((char *)(ptr));
7308 if (len > 0 && ptr[len - 1] == ' ')
7309 ptr[len - 1] = NUL'\000';
7310 }
7311
7312 do_join(2, FALSE0, FALSE0, FALSE0, false0);
7313 if (temp == NUL'\000' && gchar_cursor() != NUL'\000')
7314 inc_cursor();
7315 } else
7316 dec_cursor();
7317
7318 /*
7319 * In REPLACE mode we have to put back the text that was replaced
7320 * by the NL. On the replace stack is first a NUL-terminated
7321 * sequence of characters that were deleted and then the
7322 * characters that NL replaced.
7323 */
7324 if (State & REPLACE_FLAG0x40) {
7325 /*
7326 * Do the next ins_char() in NORMAL state, to
7327 * prevent ins_char() from replacing characters and
7328 * avoiding showmatch().
7329 */
7330 oldState = State;
7331 State = NORMAL0x01;
7332 /*
7333 * restore characters (blanks) deleted after cursor
7334 */
7335 while (cc > 0) {
7336 save_col = curwin->w_cursor.col;
7337 mb_replace_pop_ins(cc);
7338 curwin->w_cursor.col = save_col;
7339 cc = replace_pop();
7340 }
7341 /* restore the characters that NL replaced */
7342 replace_pop_ins();
7343 State = oldState;
7344 }
7345 }
7346 did_ai = FALSE0;
7347 } else {
7348 /*
7349 * Delete character(s) before the cursor.
7350 */
7351 if (revins_on) /* put cursor on last inserted char */
7352 dec_cursor();
7353 mincol = 0;
7354 /* keep indent */
7355 if (mode == BACKSPACE_LINE4
7356 && (curbuf->b_p_ai
7357 || cindent_on()
7358 )
7359 && !revins_on
7360 ) {
7361 save_col = curwin->w_cursor.col;
7362 beginline(BL_WHITE1);
7363 if (curwin->w_cursor.col < save_col)
7364 mincol = curwin->w_cursor.col;
7365 curwin->w_cursor.col = save_col;
7366 }
7367
7368 /*
7369 * Handle deleting one 'shiftwidth' or 'softtabstop'.
7370 */
7371 if ( mode == BACKSPACE_CHAR1
7372 && ((p_sta && in_indent)
7373 || (get_sts_value() != 0
7374 && curwin->w_cursor.col > 0
7375 && (*(get_cursor_pos_ptr() - 1) == TAB'\011'
7376 || (*(get_cursor_pos_ptr() - 1) == ' '
7377 && (!*inserted_space_p
7378 || arrow_used)))))) {
7379 int ts;
7380 colnr_T vcol;
7381 colnr_T want_vcol;
7382 colnr_T start_vcol;
7383
7384 *inserted_space_p = FALSE0;
7385 if (p_sta && in_indent)
7386 ts = (int)get_sw_value(curbuf);
7387 else
7388 ts = (int)get_sts_value();
7389 /* Compute the virtual column where we want to be. Since
7390 * 'showbreak' may get in the way, need to get the last column of
7391 * the previous character. */
7392 getvcol(curwin, &curwin->w_cursor, &vcol, NULL((void*)0), NULL((void*)0));
7393 start_vcol = vcol;
7394 dec_cursor();
7395 getvcol(curwin, &curwin->w_cursor, NULL((void*)0), NULL((void*)0), &want_vcol);
7396 inc_cursor();
