7397 want_vcol = (want_vcol / ts) * ts;
7398
7399 /* delete characters until we are at or before want_vcol */
7400 while (vcol > want_vcol
7401 && (cc = *(get_cursor_pos_ptr() - 1), vim_iswhite(cc)((cc) == ' ' || (cc) == '\t')))
7402 ins_bs_one(&vcol);
7403
7404 /* insert extra spaces until we are at want_vcol */
7405 while (vcol < want_vcol) {
7406 /* Remember the first char we inserted */
7407 if (curwin->w_cursor.lnum == Insstart_orig.lnum
7408 && curwin->w_cursor.col < Insstart_orig.col) {
7409 Insstart_orig.col = curwin->w_cursor.col;
7410 }
7411
7412 if (State & VREPLACE_FLAG0x80)
7413 ins_char(' ');
7414 else {
7415 ins_str((char_u *)" ");
7416 if ((State & REPLACE_FLAG0x40))
7417 replace_push(NUL'\000');
7418 }
7419 getvcol(curwin, &curwin->w_cursor, &vcol, NULL((void*)0), NULL((void*)0));
7420 }
7421
7422 /* If we are now back where we started delete one character. Can
7423 * happen when using 'sts' and 'linebreak'. */
7424 if (vcol >= start_vcol)
7425 ins_bs_one(&vcol);
7426 }
7427 /*
7428 * Delete upto starting point, start of line or previous word.
7429 */
7430 else do {
7431 if (!revins_on) /* put cursor on char to be deleted */
7432 dec_cursor();
7433
7434 /* start of word? */
7435 if (mode == BACKSPACE_WORD2 && !vim_isspace(gchar_cursor())) {
7436 mode = BACKSPACE_WORD_NOT_SPACE3;
7437 temp = vim_iswordc(gchar_cursor());
7438 }
7439 /* end of word? */
7440 else if (mode == BACKSPACE_WORD_NOT_SPACE3
7441 && (vim_isspace(cc = gchar_cursor())
7442 || vim_iswordc(cc) != temp)) {
7443 if (!revins_on)
7444 inc_cursor();
7445 else if (State & REPLACE_FLAG0x40)
7446 dec_cursor();
7447 break;
7448 }
7449 if (State & REPLACE_FLAG0x40)
7450 replace_do_bs(-1);
7451 else {
7452 if (enc_utf8 && p_deco)
7453 (void)utfc_ptr2char(get_cursor_pos_ptr(), cpc);
7454 (void)del_char(FALSE0);
7455 /*
7456 * If there are combining characters and 'delcombine' is set
7457 * move the cursor back. Don't back up before the base
7458 * character.
7459 */
7460 if (enc_utf8 && p_deco && cpc[0] != NUL'\000')
7461 inc_cursor();
7462 if (revins_chars) {
7463 revins_chars--;
7464 revins_legal++;
7465 }
7466 if (revins_on && gchar_cursor() == NUL'\000')
7467 break;
7468 }
7469 /* Just a single backspace?: */
7470 if (mode == BACKSPACE_CHAR1)
7471 break;
7472 } while (
7473 revins_on ||
7474 (curwin->w_cursor.col > mincol
7475 && (curwin->w_cursor.lnum != Insstart_orig.lnum
7476 || curwin->w_cursor.col != Insstart_orig.col)));
7477 did_backspace = TRUE1;
7478 }
7479 did_si = FALSE0;
7480 can_si = FALSE0;
7481 can_si_back = FALSE0;
7482 if (curwin->w_cursor.col <= 1)
7483 did_ai = FALSE0;
7484 /*
7485 * It's a little strange to put backspaces into the redo
7486 * buffer, but it makes auto-indent a lot easier to deal
7487 * with.
7488 */
7489 AppendCharToRedobuff(c);
7490
7491 /* If deleted before the insertion point, adjust it */
7492 if (curwin->w_cursor.lnum == Insstart_orig.lnum
7493 && curwin->w_cursor.col < Insstart_orig.col) {
7494 Insstart_orig.col = curwin->w_cursor.col;
7495 }
7496
7497 /* vi behaviour: the cursor moves backward but the character that
7498 * was there remains visible
7499 * Vim behaviour: the cursor moves backward and the character that
7500 * was there is erased from the screen.
7501 * We can emulate the vi behaviour by pretending there is a dollar
7502 * displayed even when there isn't.
7503 * --pkv Sun Jan 19 01:56:40 EST 2003 */
7504 if (vim_strchr(p_cpo, CPO_BACKSPACE'v') != NULL((void*)0) && dollar_vcol == -1)
7505 dollar_vcol = curwin->w_virtcol;
7506
7507 /* When deleting a char the cursor line must never be in a closed fold.
7508 * E.g., when 'foldmethod' is indent and deleting the first non-white
7509 * char before a Tab. */
7510 if (did_backspace)
7511 foldOpenCursor();
7512
7513 return did_backspace;
7514}
7515
7516static void ins_mouse(int c)
7517{
7518 pos_T tpos;
7519 win_T *old_curwin = curwin;
7520
7521 if (!mouse_has(MOUSE_INSERT'i'))
7522 return;
7523
7524 undisplay_dollar();
7525 tpos = curwin->w_cursor;
7526 if (do_mouse(NULL((void*)0), c, BACKWARD(-1), 1L, 0)) {
7527 win_T *new_curwin = curwin;
7528
7529 if (curwin != old_curwin && win_valid(old_curwin)) {
7530 /* Mouse took us to another window. We need to go back to the
7531 * previous one to stop insert there properly. */
7532 curwin = old_curwin;
7533 curbuf = curwin->w_buffer;
7534 }
7535 start_arrow(curwin == old_curwin ? &tpos : NULL((void*)0));
7536 if (curwin != new_curwin && win_valid(new_curwin)) {
7537 curwin = new_curwin;
7538 curbuf = curwin->w_buffer;
7539 }
7540 can_cindent = TRUE1;
7541 }
7542
7543 /* redraw status lines (in case another window became active) */
7544 redraw_statuslines();
7545}
7546
7547static void ins_mousescroll(int dir)
7548{
7549 pos_T tpos;
7550 win_T *old_curwin = curwin;
7551 int did_scroll = FALSE0;
7552
7553 tpos = curwin->w_cursor;
7554
7555 if (mouse_row >= 0 && mouse_col >= 0) {
7556 int row, col;
7557
7558 row = mouse_row;
7559 col = mouse_col;
7560
7561 /* find the window at the pointer coordinates */
7562 curwin = mouse_find_win(&row, &col);
7563 curbuf = curwin->w_buffer;
7564 }
7565 if (curwin == old_curwin)
7566 undisplay_dollar();
7567
7568 /* Don't scroll the window in which completion is being done. */
7569 if (!pum_visible()
7570 || curwin != old_curwin
7571 ) {
7572 if (dir == MSCR_DOWN0 || dir == MSCR_UP1) {
7573 if (mod_mask & (MOD_MASK_SHIFT0x02 | MOD_MASK_CTRL0x04))
7574 scroll_redraw(dir,
7575 (long)(curwin->w_botline - curwin->w_topline));
7576 else
7577 scroll_redraw(dir, 3L);
7578 }
7579 did_scroll = TRUE1;
7580 }
7581
7582 curwin->w_redr_status = TRUE1;
7583
7584 curwin = old_curwin;
7585 curbuf = curwin->w_buffer;
7586
7587 /* The popup menu may overlay the window, need to redraw it.
7588 * TODO: Would be more efficient to only redraw the windows that are
7589 * overlapped by the popup menu. */
7590 if (pum_visible() && did_scroll) {
7591 redraw_all_later(NOT_VALID40);
7592 ins_compl_show_pum();
7593 }
7594
7595 if (!equalpos(curwin->w_cursor, tpos)(((curwin->w_cursor).lnum == (tpos).lnum) && ((curwin
->w_cursor).col == (tpos).col) && ((curwin->w_cursor
).coladd == (tpos).coladd))) {
7596 start_arrow(&tpos);
7597 can_cindent = TRUE1;
7598 }
7599}
7600
7601
7602
7603static void ins_left(void)
7604{
7605 pos_T tpos;
7606
7607 if ((fdo_flags & FDO_HOR0x004) && KeyTyped)
7608 foldOpenCursor();
7609 undisplay_dollar();
7610 tpos = curwin->w_cursor;
7611 if (oneleft() == OK1) {
7612 start_arrow(&tpos);
7613 /* If exit reversed string, position is fixed */
7614 if (revins_scol != -1 && (int)curwin->w_cursor.col >= revins_scol)
7615 revins_legal++;
7616 revins_chars++;
7617 }
7618 /*
7619 * if 'whichwrap' set for cursor in insert mode may go to
7620 * previous line
7621 */
7622 else if (vim_strchr(p_ww, '[') != NULL((void*)0) && curwin->w_cursor.lnum > 1) {
7623 start_arrow(&tpos);
7624 --(curwin->w_cursor.lnum);
7625 coladvance((colnr_T)MAXCOL(0x7fffffffL));
7626 curwin->w_set_curswant = TRUE1; /* so we stay at the end */
7627 } else
7628 vim_beep();
7629}
7630
7631static void ins_home(int c)
7632{
7633 pos_T tpos;
7634
7635 if ((fdo_flags & FDO_HOR0x004) && KeyTyped)
7636 foldOpenCursor();
7637 undisplay_dollar();
7638 tpos = curwin->w_cursor;
7639 if (c == K_C_HOME(-((253) + ((int)(KE_C_HOME) << 8))))
7640 curwin->w_cursor.lnum = 1;
7641 curwin->w_cursor.col = 0;
7642 curwin->w_cursor.coladd = 0;
7643 curwin->w_curswant = 0;
7644 start_arrow(&tpos);
7645}
7646
7647static void ins_end(int c)
7648{
7649 pos_T tpos;
7650
7651 if ((fdo_flags & FDO_HOR0x004) && KeyTyped)
7652 foldOpenCursor();
7653 undisplay_dollar();
7654 tpos = curwin->w_cursor;
7655 if (c == K_C_END(-((253) + ((int)(KE_C_END) << 8))))
7656 curwin->w_cursor.lnum = curbuf->b_ml.ml_line_count;
7657 coladvance((colnr_T)MAXCOL(0x7fffffffL));
7658 curwin->w_curswant = MAXCOL(0x7fffffffL);
7659
7660 start_arrow(&tpos);
7661}
7662
7663static void ins_s_left(void)
7664{
7665 if ((fdo_flags & FDO_HOR0x004) && KeyTyped)
7666 foldOpenCursor();
7667 undisplay_dollar();
7668 if (curwin->w_cursor.lnum > 1 || curwin->w_cursor.col > 0) {
7669 start_arrow(&curwin->w_cursor);
7670 (void)bck_word(1L, FALSE0, FALSE0);
7671 curwin->w_set_curswant = TRUE1;
7672 } else
7673 vim_beep();
7674}
7675
7676static void ins_right(void)
7677{
7678 if ((fdo_flags & FDO_HOR0x004) && KeyTyped)
7679 foldOpenCursor();
7680 undisplay_dollar();
7681 if (gchar_cursor() != NUL'\000'
7682 || virtual_active()
7683 ) {
7684 start_arrow(&curwin->w_cursor);
7685 curwin->w_set_curswant = TRUE1;
7686 if (virtual_active())
7687 oneright();
7688 else {
7689 if (has_mbyte)
7690 curwin->w_cursor.col += (*mb_ptr2len)(get_cursor_pos_ptr());
7691 else
7692 ++curwin->w_cursor.col;
7693 }
7694
7695 revins_legal++;
7696 if (revins_chars)
7697 revins_chars--;
7698 }
7699 /* if 'whichwrap' set for cursor in insert mode, may move the
7700 * cursor to the next line */
7701 else if (vim_strchr(p_ww, ']') != NULL((void*)0)
7702 && curwin->w_cursor.lnum < curbuf->b_ml.ml_line_count) {
7703 start_arrow(&curwin->w_cursor);
7704 curwin->w_set_curswant = TRUE1;
7705 ++curwin->w_cursor.lnum;
7706 curwin->w_cursor.col = 0;
7707 } else
7708 vim_beep();
7709}
7710
7711static void ins_s_right(void)
7712{
7713 if ((fdo_flags & FDO_HOR0x004) && KeyTyped)
7714 foldOpenCursor();
7715 undisplay_dollar();
7716 if (curwin->w_cursor.lnum < curbuf->b_ml.ml_line_count
7717 || gchar_cursor() != NUL'\000') {
7718 start_arrow(&curwin->w_cursor);
7719 (void)fwd_word(1L, FALSE0, 0);
7720 curwin->w_set_curswant = TRUE1;
7721 } else
7722 vim_beep();
7723}
7724
7725static void
7726ins_up (
7727 int startcol /* when TRUE move to Insstart.col */
7728)
7729{
7730 pos_T tpos;
7731 linenr_T old_topline = curwin->w_topline;
7732 int old_topfill = curwin->w_topfill;
7733
7734 undisplay_dollar();
7735 tpos = curwin->w_cursor;
7736 if (cursor_up(1L, TRUE1) == OK1) {
7737 if (startcol)
7738 coladvance(getvcol_nolist(&Insstart));
7739 if (old_topline != curwin->w_topline
7740 || old_topfill != curwin->w_topfill
7741 )
7742 redraw_later(VALID10);
7743 start_arrow(&tpos);
7744 can_cindent = TRUE1;
7745 } else
7746 vim_beep();
7747}
7748
7749static void ins_pageup(void)
7750{
7751 pos_T tpos;
7752
7753 undisplay_dollar();
7754
7755 if (mod_mask & MOD_MASK_CTRL0x04) {
7756 /* <C-PageUp>: tab page back */
7757 if (first_tabpage->tp_next != NULL((void*)0)) {
7758 start_arrow(&curwin->w_cursor);
7759 goto_tabpage(-1);
7760 }
7761 return;
7762 }
7763
7764 tpos = curwin->w_cursor;
7765 if (onepage(BACKWARD(-1), 1L) == OK1) {
7766 start_arrow(&tpos);
7767 can_cindent = TRUE1;
7768 } else
7769 vim_beep();
7770}
7771
7772static void
7773ins_down (
7774 int startcol /* when TRUE move to Insstart.col */
7775)
7776{
7777 pos_T tpos;
7778 linenr_T old_topline = curwin->w_topline;
7779 int old_topfill = curwin->w_topfill;
7780
7781 undisplay_dollar();
7782 tpos = curwin->w_cursor;
7783 if (cursor_down(1L, TRUE1) == OK1) {
7784 if (startcol)
7785 coladvance(getvcol_nolist(&Insstart));
7786 if (old_topline != curwin->w_topline
7787 || old_topfill != curwin->w_topfill
7788 )
7789 redraw_later(VALID10);
7790 start_arrow(&tpos);
7791 can_cindent = TRUE1;
7792 } else
7793 vim_beep();
7794}
7795
7796static void ins_pagedown(void)
7797{
7798 pos_T tpos;
7799
7800 undisplay_dollar();
7801
7802 if (mod_mask & MOD_MASK_CTRL0x04) {
7803 /* <C-PageDown>: tab page forward */
7804 if (first_tabpage->tp_next != NULL((void*)0)) {
7805 start_arrow(&curwin->w_cursor);
7806 goto_tabpage(0);
7807 }
7808 return;
7809 }
7810
7811 tpos = curwin->w_cursor;
7812 if (onepage(FORWARD1, 1L) == OK1) {
7813 start_arrow(&tpos);
7814 can_cindent = TRUE1;
7815 } else
7816 vim_beep();
7817}
7818
7819/*
7820 * Handle TAB in Insert or Replace mode.
7821 * Return TRUE when the TAB needs to be inserted like a normal character.
7822 */
7823static int ins_tab(void)
7824{
7825 int ind;
7826 int i;
7827 int temp;
7828
7829 if (Insstart_blank_vcol == MAXCOL(0x7fffffffL) && curwin->w_cursor.lnum == Insstart.lnum)
7830 Insstart_blank_vcol = get_nolist_virtcol();
7831 if (echeck_abbr(TAB'\011' + ABBR_OFF0x100))
7832 return FALSE0;
7833
7834 ind = inindent(0);
7835 if (ind)
7836 can_cindent = FALSE0;
7837
7838 /*
7839 * When nothing special, insert TAB like a normal character
7840 */
7841 if (!curbuf->b_p_et
7842 && !(p_sta && ind && curbuf->b_p_ts != get_sw_value(curbuf))
7843 && get_sts_value() == 0)
7844 return TRUE1;
7845
7846 if (stop_arrow() == FAIL0)
7847 return TRUE1;
7848
7849 did_ai = FALSE0;
7850 did_si = FALSE0;
7851 can_si = FALSE0;
7852 can_si_back = FALSE0;
7853 AppendToRedobuff((char_u *)"\t");
7854
7855 if (p_sta && ind) /* insert tab in indent, use 'shiftwidth' */
7856 temp = (int)get_sw_value(curbuf);
7857 else if (curbuf->b_p_sts != 0) /* use 'softtabstop' when set */
7858 temp = (int)get_sts_value();
7859 else /* otherwise use 'tabstop' */
7860 temp = (int)curbuf->b_p_ts;
7861 temp -= get_nolist_virtcol() % temp;
7862
7863 /*
7864 * Insert the first space with ins_char(). It will delete one char in
7865 * replace mode. Insert the rest with ins_str(); it will not delete any
7866 * chars. For VREPLACE mode, we use ins_char() for all characters.
7867 */
7868 ins_char(' ');
7869 while (--temp > 0) {
7870 if (State & VREPLACE_FLAG0x80)
7871 ins_char(' ');
7872 else {
7873 ins_str((char_u *)" ");
7874 if (State & REPLACE_FLAG0x40) /* no char replaced */
7875 replace_push(NUL'\000');
7876 }
7877 }
7878
7879 /*
7880 * When 'expandtab' not set: Replace spaces by TABs where possible.
7881 */
7882 if (!curbuf->b_p_et && (get_sts_value() || (p_sta && ind))) {
7883 char_u *ptr;
7884 char_u *saved_line = NULL((void*)0); /* init for GCC */
7885 pos_T pos;
7886 pos_T fpos;
7887 pos_T *cursor;
7888 colnr_T want_vcol, vcol;
7889 int change_col = -1;
7890 int save_list = curwin->w_p_listw_onebuf_opt.wo_list;
7891
7892 /*
7893 * Get the current line. For VREPLACE mode, don't make real changes
7894 * yet, just work on a copy of the line.
7895 */
7896 if (State & VREPLACE_FLAG0x80) {
7897 pos = curwin->w_cursor;
7898 cursor = &pos;
7899 saved_line = vim_strsave(get_cursor_line_ptr());
7900 ptr = saved_line + pos.col;
7901 } else {
7902 ptr = get_cursor_pos_ptr();
7903 cursor = &curwin->w_cursor;
7904 }
7905
7906 /* When 'L' is not in 'cpoptions' a tab always takes up 'ts' spaces. */
7907 if (vim_strchr(p_cpo, CPO_LISTWM'L') == NULL((void*)0))
7908 curwin->w_p_listw_onebuf_opt.wo_list = FALSE0;
7909
7910 /* Find first white before the cursor */
7911 fpos = curwin->w_cursor;
7912 while (fpos.col > 0 && vim_iswhite(ptr[-1])((ptr[-1]) == ' ' || (ptr[-1]) == '\t')) {
7913 --fpos.col;
7914 --ptr;
7915 }
7916
7917 /* In Replace mode, don't change characters before the insert point. */
7918 if ((State & REPLACE_FLAG0x40)
7919 && fpos.lnum == Insstart.lnum
7920 && fpos.col < Insstart.col) {
7921 ptr += Insstart.col - fpos.col;
7922 fpos.col = Insstart.col;
7923 }
7924
7925 /* compute virtual column numbers of first white and cursor */
7926 getvcol(curwin, &fpos, &vcol, NULL((void*)0), NULL((void*)0));
7927 getvcol(curwin, cursor, &want_vcol, NULL((void*)0), NULL((void*)0));
7928
7929 /* Use as many TABs as possible. Beware of 'breakindent', 'showbreak'
7930 and 'linebreak' adding extra virtual columns. */
7931 while (vim_iswhite(*ptr)((*ptr) == ' ' || (*ptr) == '\t')) {
7932 i = lbr_chartabsize(NULL((void*)0), (char_u *)"\t", vcol);
7933 if (vcol + i > want_vcol)
7934 break;
7935 if (*ptr != TAB'\011') {
7936 *ptr = TAB'\011';
7937 if (change_col < 0) {
7938 change_col = fpos.col; /* Column of first change */
7939 /* May have to adjust Insstart */
7940 if (fpos.lnum == Insstart.lnum && fpos.col < Insstart.col)
7941 Insstart.col = fpos.col;
7942 }
7943 }
7944 ++fpos.col;
7945 ++ptr;
7946 vcol += i;
7947 }
7948
7949 if (change_col >= 0) {
7950 int repl_off = 0;
7951 char_u *line = ptr;
7952
7953 /* Skip over the spaces we need. */
7954 while (vcol < want_vcol && *ptr == ' ') {
7955 vcol += lbr_chartabsize(line, ptr, vcol);
7956 ++ptr;
7957 ++repl_off;
7958 }
7959 if (vcol > want_vcol) {
7960 /* Must have a char with 'showbreak' just before it. */
7961 --ptr;
7962 --repl_off;
7963 }
7964 fpos.col += repl_off;
7965
7966 /* Delete following spaces. */
7967 i = cursor->col - fpos.col;
7968 if (i > 0) {
7969 STRMOVE(ptr, ptr + i)memmove((ptr), (ptr + i), strlen((char *)(ptr + i)) + 1);
7970 /* correct replace stack. */
7971 if ((State & REPLACE_FLAG0x40)
7972 && !(State & VREPLACE_FLAG0x80)
7973 )
7974 for (temp = i; --temp >= 0; )
7975 replace_join(repl_off);
7976 }
7977 cursor->col -= i;
7978
7979 /*
7980 * In VREPLACE mode, we haven't changed anything yet. Do it now by
7981 * backspacing over the changed spacing and then inserting the new
7982 * spacing.
7983 */
7984 if (State & VREPLACE_FLAG0x80) {
7985 /* Backspace from real cursor to change_col */
7986 backspace_until_column(change_col);
7987
7988 /* Insert each char in saved_line from changed_col to
7989 * ptr-cursor */
7990 ins_bytes_len(saved_line + change_col,
7991 cursor->col - change_col);
7992 }
7993 }
7994
7995 if (State & VREPLACE_FLAG0x80)
7996 free(saved_line);
7997 curwin->w_p_listw_onebuf_opt.wo_list = save_list;
7998 }
7999
8000 return FALSE0;
8001}
8002
8003/*
8004 * Handle CR or NL in insert mode.
8005 * Return TRUE when it can't undo.
8006 */
8007static int ins_eol(int c)
8008{
8009 int i;
8010
8011 if (echeck_abbr(c + ABBR_OFF0x100))
8012 return FALSE0;
8013 if (stop_arrow() == FAIL0)
8014 return TRUE1;
8015 undisplay_dollar();
8016
8017 /*
8018 * Strange Vi behaviour: In Replace mode, typing a NL will not delete the
8019 * character under the cursor. Only push a NUL on the replace stack,
8020 * nothing to put back when the NL is deleted.
8021 */
8022 if ((State & REPLACE_FLAG0x40)
8023 && !(State & VREPLACE_FLAG0x80)
8024 )
8025 replace_push(NUL'\000');
8026
8027 /*
8028 * In VREPLACE mode, a NL replaces the rest of the line, and starts
8029 * replacing the next line, so we push all of the characters left on the
8030 * line onto the replace stack. This is not done here though, it is done
8031 * in open_line().
8032 */
8033
8034 /* Put cursor on NUL if on the last char and coladd is 1 (happens after
8035 * CTRL-O). */
8036 if (virtual_active() && curwin->w_cursor.coladd > 0)
8037 coladvance(getviscol());
8038
8039 if (p_altkeymap && p_fkmap)
8040 fkmap(NL'\012');
8041 /* NL in reverse insert will always start in the end of
8042 * current line. */
8043 if (revins_on)
8044 curwin->w_cursor.col += (colnr_T)STRLEN(get_cursor_pos_ptr())strlen((char *)(get_cursor_pos_ptr()));
8045
8046 AppendToRedobuff(NL_STR(char_u *)"\012");
8047 i = open_line(FORWARD1,
8048 has_format_option(FO_RET_COMS'r') ? OPENLINE_DO_COM2 :
8049 0, old_indent);
8050 old_indent = 0;
8051 can_cindent = TRUE1;
8052 /* When inserting a line the cursor line must never be in a closed fold. */
8053 foldOpenCursor();
8054
8055 return !i;
8056}
8057
8058/*
8059 * Handle digraph in insert mode.
8060 * Returns character still to be inserted, or NUL when nothing remaining to be
8061 * done.
8062 */
8063static int ins_digraph(void)
8064{
8065 int c;
8066 int cc;
8067 int did_putchar = FALSE0;
8068
8069 pc_status = PC_STATUS_UNSET0;
8070 if (redrawing() && !char_avail()) {
8071 /* may need to redraw when no more chars available now */
8072 ins_redraw(FALSE0);
8073
8074 edit_putchar('?', TRUE1);
8075 did_putchar = TRUE1;
8076 add_to_showcmd_c(Ctrl_K11);
8077 }
8078
8079#ifdef USE_ON_FLY_SCROLL
8080 dont_scroll = TRUE1; /* disallow scrolling here */
8081#endif
8082
8083 /* don't map the digraph chars. This also prevents the
8084 * mode message to be deleted when ESC is hit */
8085 ++no_mapping;
8086 ++allow_keys;
8087 c = plain_vgetc();
8088 --no_mapping;
8089 --allow_keys;
8090 if (did_putchar)
8091 /* when the line fits in 'columns' the '?' is at the start of the next
8092 * line and will not be removed by the redraw */
8093 edit_unputchar();
8094
8095 if (IS_SPECIAL(c)((c) < 0) || mod_mask) { /* special key */
8096 clear_showcmd();
8097 insert_special(c, TRUE1, FALSE0);
8098 return NUL'\000';
8099 }
8100 if (c != ESC'\033') {
8101 did_putchar = FALSE0;
8102 if (redrawing() && !char_avail()) {
8103 /* may need to redraw when no more chars available now */
8104 ins_redraw(FALSE0);
8105
8106 if (char2cells(c) == 1) {
8107 ins_redraw(FALSE0);
8108 edit_putchar(c, TRUE1);
8109 did_putchar = TRUE1;
8110 }
8111 add_to_showcmd_c(c);
8112 }
8113 ++no_mapping;
8114 ++allow_keys;
8115 cc = plain_vgetc();
8116 --no_mapping;
8117 --allow_keys;
8118 if (did_putchar)
8119 /* when the line fits in 'columns' the '?' is at the start of the
8120 * next line and will not be removed by a redraw */
8121 edit_unputchar();
8122 if (cc != ESC'\033') {
8123 AppendToRedobuff((char_u *)CTRL_V_STR"\026");
8124 c = getdigraph(c, cc, TRUE1);
8125 clear_showcmd();
8126 return c;
8127 }
8128 }
8129 clear_showcmd();
8130 return NUL'\000';
8131}
8132
8133/*
8134 * Handle CTRL-E and CTRL-Y in Insert mode: copy char from other line.
8135 * Returns the char to be inserted, or NUL if none found.
8136 */
8137int ins_copychar(linenr_T lnum)
8138{
8139 int c;
8140 int temp;
8141 char_u *ptr, *prev_ptr;
8142 char_u *line;
8143
8144 if (lnum < 1 || lnum > curbuf->b_ml.ml_line_count) {
8145 vim_beep();
8146 return NUL'\000';
8147 }
8148
8149 /* try to advance to the cursor column */
8150 temp = 0;
8151 line = ptr = ml_get(lnum);
8152 prev_ptr = ptr;
8153 validate_virtcol();
8154 while ((colnr_T)temp < curwin->w_virtcol && *ptr != NUL'\000') {
8155 prev_ptr = ptr;
8156 temp += lbr_chartabsize_adv(line, &ptr, (colnr_T)temp);
8157 }
8158 if ((colnr_T)temp > curwin->w_virtcol)
8159 ptr = prev_ptr;
8160
8161 c = (*mb_ptr2char)(ptr);
8162 if (c == NUL'\000')
8163 vim_beep();
8164 return c;
8165}
8166
8167/*
8168 * CTRL-Y or CTRL-E typed in Insert mode.
8169 */
8170static int ins_ctrl_ey(int tc)
8171{
8172 int c = tc;
8173
8174 if (ctrl_x_mode == CTRL_X_SCROLL2) {
8175 if (c == Ctrl_Y25)
8176 scrolldown_clamp();
8177 else
8178 scrollup_clamp();
8179 redraw_later(VALID10);
8180 } else {
8181 c = ins_copychar(curwin->w_cursor.lnum + (c == Ctrl_Y25 ? -1 : 1));
8182 if (c != NUL'\000') {
8183 long tw_save;
8184
8185 /* The character must be taken literally, insert like it
8186 * was typed after a CTRL-V, and pretend 'textwidth'
8187 * wasn't set. Digits, 'o' and 'x' are special after a
8188 * CTRL-V, don't use it for these. */
8189 if (c < 256 && !isalnum(c)((*__ctype_b_loc ())[(int) ((c))] & (unsigned short int) _ISalnum
))
8190 AppendToRedobuff((char_u *)CTRL_V_STR"\026"); /* CTRL-V */
8191 tw_save = curbuf->b_p_tw;
8192 curbuf->b_p_tw = -1;
8193 insert_special(c, TRUE1, FALSE0);
8194 curbuf->b_p_tw = tw_save;
8195 revins_chars++;
8196 revins_legal++;
8197 c = Ctrl_V22; /* pretend CTRL-V is last character */
8198 auto_format(FALSE0, TRUE1);
8199 }
8200 }
8201 return c;
8202}
8203
8204/*
8205 * Try to do some very smart auto-indenting.
8206 * Used when inserting a "normal" character.
8207 */
8208static void ins_try_si(int c)
8209{
8210 pos_T *pos, old_pos;
8211 char_u *ptr;
8212 int i;
8213 int temp;
8214
8215 /*
8216 * do some very smart indenting when entering '{' or '}'
8217 */
8218 if (((did_si || can_si_back) && c == '{') || (can_si && c == '}')) {
8219 /*
8220 * for '}' set indent equal to indent of line containing matching '{'
8221 */
8222 if (c == '}' && (pos = findmatch(NULL((void*)0), '{')) != NULL((void*)0)) {
8223 old_pos = curwin->w_cursor;
8224 /*
8225 * If the matching '{' has a ')' immediately before it (ignoring
8226 * white-space), then line up with the start of the line
8227 * containing the matching '(' if there is one. This handles the
8228 * case where an "if (..\n..) {" statement continues over multiple
8229 * lines -- webb
8230 */
8231 ptr = ml_get(pos->lnum);
8232 i = pos->col;
8233 if (i > 0) /* skip blanks before '{' */
8234 while (--i > 0 && vim_iswhite(ptr[i])((ptr[i]) == ' ' || (ptr[i]) == '\t'))
8235 ;
8236 curwin->w_cursor.lnum = pos->lnum;
8237 curwin->w_cursor.col = i;
8238 if (ptr[i] == ')' && (pos = findmatch(NULL((void*)0), '(')) != NULL((void*)0))
8239 curwin->w_cursor = *pos;
8240 i = get_indent();
8241 curwin->w_cursor = old_pos;
8242 if (State & VREPLACE_FLAG0x80)
8243 change_indent(INDENT_SET1, i, FALSE0, NUL'\000', TRUE1);
8244 else
8245 (void)set_indent(i, SIN_CHANGED1);
8246 } else if (curwin->w_cursor.col > 0) {
8247 /*
8248 * when inserting '{' after "O" reduce indent, but not
8249 * more than indent of previous line
8250 */
8251 temp = TRUE1;
8252 if (c == '{' && can_si_back && curwin->w_cursor.lnum > 1) {
8253 old_pos = curwin->w_cursor;
8254 i = get_indent();
8255 while (curwin->w_cursor.lnum > 1) {
8256 ptr = skipwhite(ml_get(--(curwin->w_cursor.lnum)));
8257
8258 /* ignore empty lines and lines starting with '#'. */
8259 if (*ptr != '#' && *ptr != NUL'\000')
8260 break;
8261 }
8262 if (get_indent() >= i)
8263 temp = FALSE0;
8264 curwin->w_cursor = old_pos;
8265 }
8266 if (temp)
8267 shift_line(TRUE1, FALSE0, 1, TRUE1);
8268 }
8269 }
8270
8271 /*
8272 * set indent of '#' always to 0
8273 */
8274 if (curwin->w_cursor.col > 0 && can_si && c == '#') {
8275 /* remember current indent for next line */
8276 old_indent = get_indent();
8277 (void)set_indent(0, SIN_CHANGED1);
8278 }
8279
8280 /* Adjust ai_col, the char at this position can be deleted. */
8281 if (ai_col > curwin->w_cursor.col)
8282 ai_col = curwin->w_cursor.col;
8283}
8284
8285/*
8286 * Get the value that w_virtcol would have when 'list' is off.
8287 * Unless 'cpo' contains the 'L' flag.
8288 */
8289static colnr_T get_nolist_virtcol(void)
8290{
8291 if (curwin->w_p_listw_onebuf_opt.wo_list && vim_strchr(p_cpo, CPO_LISTWM'L') == NULL((void*)0))
8292 return getvcol_nolist(&curwin->w_cursor);
8293 validate_virtcol();
8294 return curwin->w_virtcol;
8295}
8296
8297/*
8298 * Handle the InsertCharPre autocommand.
8299 * "c" is the character that was typed.
8300 * Return a pointer to allocated memory with the replacement string.
8301 * Return NULL to continue inserting "c".
8302 */
8303static char_u *do_insert_char_pre(int c)
8304{
8305 char_u buf[MB_MAXBYTES21 + 1];
8306
8307 /* Return quickly when there is nothing to do. */
8308 if (!has_insertcharpre())
8309 return NULL((void*)0);
8310
8311 if (has_mbyte)
8312 buf[(*mb_char2bytes)(c, buf)] = NUL'\000';
8313 else {
8314 buf[0] = c;
8315 buf[1] = NUL'\000';
8316 }
8317
8318 /* Lock the text to avoid weird things from happening. */
8319 ++textlock;
8320 set_vim_var_string(VV_CHAR, buf, -1); /* set v:char */
8321
8322 char_u *res = NULL((void*)0);
8323 if (apply_autocmds(EVENT_INSERTCHARPRE, NULL((void*)0), NULL((void*)0), FALSE0, curbuf)) {
8324 /* Get the value of v:char. It may be empty or more than one
8325 * character. Only use it when changed, otherwise continue with the
8326 * original character to avoid breaking autoindent. */
8327 if (STRCMP(buf, get_vim_var_str(VV_CHAR))strcmp((char *)(buf), (char *)(get_vim_var_str(VV_CHAR))) != 0)
8328 res = vim_strsave(get_vim_var_str(VV_CHAR));
8329 }
8330
8331 set_vim_var_string(VV_CHAR, NULL((void*)0), -1); /* clear v:char */
8332 --textlock;
8333
8334 return res;
8335}
